loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and has five children. Rosalie is married, and four of her children are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets, wood, iron, and a washstand.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un gran hombre de 47 años de edad es casado tiene una linda familia de 4 hermosas hijas  de las edades entre 7 y 16 años.
Roberto ama mucho a su familia y se fuerza día a día para darles lo mejor, el para generar sus ingresos se dedica al cultivo de tomate y flores desde hace 6 años, para Roberto la naturaleza es muy importante pues es de lo que vivimos, es por eso que también trabaja como técnico en agroecológia en una asociación que funciona en una aldea circunvecina de su comunidad.
Roberto ahora ha empezado a preparar la tierra para cultivar tomate, pero su capital ya no se da abasto para cubrir todos los gastos que se deberá realizar para este cultivo, pero  él es un hombre optimista y perseverante, que para cultivar en esta época a decidido solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando fertilizantes, fungicidas, foliares, tutores y pita.
Roberto sueña con realizar esta inversión para mejorar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios así también construir otra casa para ellos.
texts.en:
Roberto is a great 47-year-old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with 4 lovely daughters, whose ages range from 7 to 16.

Roberto loves his family very much, and he exerts himself day after day to give them the best. To earn money, he has made a living growing tomatoes and flowers for 6 years. For Roberto, nature is very important, since it's what gives us life. For this reason, he also works as an agro-ecology technician for an association that operates in a neighboring small town of his community.

Roberto has begun to prepare his land for growing tomatoes, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to cover all of the expenses of this crop. However, he is an optimistic and persevering man, who, in order to cultivate this season, has decided to request a loan which he will use to buy fertilizer, fungicide, liquid plant food, stakes, and twine.

Roberto dreams that, by making this investment, he will improve his income and continue to support his children in their studies, as well as build another home for them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fungicide, liquid plant food, stakes, and twine to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 47 years old and blessed with two children. Being a responsible mother, she helps support her family by buying and reselling frozen foods, peanut butter and used clothing within the local community.

Having insufficient capital, Emilia is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy additional stock to resell. She works to keep her business viable, and with this financial assistance she believes that her efforts will result in a higher income.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods, peanut butter and used clothing to resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Agnes is 54 years old and has children who are in school.

Agnes has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. Agnes requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Agnes has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Marissa requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Marissa has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Crisalyn

texts.en:
Crisalyn is a 25-year-old, married woman with one kid who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Crisalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Crisalyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

Crisalyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Crisalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and single.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Marilou aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jeanie is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Jeanie has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Jeanie requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Jeanie has been in this business for a year. Jeanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 60-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Virgilia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell religious articles business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Virgilia is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of religious articles to sell to her customers for her buy-and-sell religious articles business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Virgilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of religious articles to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Chanry is a 29-year-old woman with one child from Battambang province. For a long time now she has grown rice on two hectares of land, and it is her main source of income. Her rice earns her on average about 40,500 KHR a day.

This will be Chanry’s third loan through VisionFund, Kiva’s partner; she successfully repaid her past loans. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes for a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured) is 43 years old. She lives in the Dongkor district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two sons and three daughters. Two are garment factory worker and the other three are attending school.
Phalla is a garment factory worker and has sold groceries out of her home for eleven years in her experiences, while her husband has been an administrator for a private company for two years of his experiences. Phalla is applying loan for a $250 USD to buy goods for resale.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale out of her home.

loans.name: Taiva

texts.en: Taiva is 63-year-old widow with four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as food stock, drinks, materials, etc. She has been doing this for four years. Taiva needs a loan to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, boxes of chickens, boxes of twisties, etc. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy food stock, drinks, bags of flour, bags of sugar, boxes of mutton, boxes of noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales menores.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 06 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias personales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, patos, pavos, gallinas, entre otros para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Maria espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She has a partner and 3 children. She lives in her own house in a rural area of the Cayaltí district, which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The people who live in this district work in agriculture, commerce, and raising small animals.

She makes a living raising and selling barnyard animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her house. She has been performing this work for the past 6 years. She relies on experience in this business as well as regular customers who provide good personal references.

She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals such as pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, to increase the stock of her business. With this, Maria hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income level and, therefore, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals such as pigs, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 59 years old, married and has four children. 

Lucresia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucresia requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucresia has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jerren

texts.en:
Jerren is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet café business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional units of computers and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Jerren has been in this business for seven years. Jerren earns more income from raising pigs.

Jerren has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional units of computers and spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Marichu is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marichu requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marichu has been raising pigs for eleven years now. She has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Prezel

texts.en:
Prezel is 35 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Prezel is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to sell.

Prezel has been raising cows for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Prezel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 30 years old and married with three children.

Adela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, beers and cooking oil to sell.

Adela has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Adela aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, beers and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: A local resident living in Battambang province, Pheng is 28 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. To support her family’s living, she grows rice as her single main source of income. This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her entire loan on buying fertilizer and paying for labor to plow the field. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family and live better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor to plow the field.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita, aged 64, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with one child. She has sold doormats in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of 300-400 PHP weekly. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenditures. Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like the help of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase materials needed for making doormats to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making doormats to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristita is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Cristita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cristita requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her food production business.

Cristita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Maximela

texts.en:
Maximela is 53 years old, married and has two children in school.

Maximela is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. Maximela requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her cows.

Maximela has been raising cows for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maximela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her cows.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marivic is 44 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marivic has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Marivic has been in this business for 10 years. Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nhib

texts.en: A villager living in Battambang province, Nhib is 48 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping. She has involved this business for ages and it earns her a decent income. For Nhib, this is her ninth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. She will spend her loan portion to purchase fertilizer. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old and married with two children; both of her children are in school. Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell at her stall. Shiela has been in this business for three years. Shiela earns more income from a general store.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 53, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province and is a mother of three children. She grows rice as the main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her loans successfully. 

Hong will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pig feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children who are 14 and 15 years old, respectively. She engages in buying and selling of fresh fish to the locals in her place. She is 38 years old and a resident of Getafe, Bohol. Her husband earns a living by operating a tricycle (a motorcycle with aside car).  Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like canned goods, beverages, condiments and toiletries.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish and have additional capital for the store. This will allow her to display a variety of stocks and cater to the needs of her customers. She can now sell more fish and start to augment her income. In this way, she can now continue to send her children to school and provide them with healthy diets.

In the future, Jocelyn dreams of expanding her business to become more sustainable, to be able to set aside some of the savings, and purchase a  new and bigger capacity motorboat.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and have additional capital for the store

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely, age 55, is widowed and has five children. She has owned and managed a vegetable farming business in her village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 400 weekly. Her net profits from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to inadequate capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase vegetable fertilizers and to pay the labor of those people who are working at her vegetable farm. She's hoping that her vegetable production business will continue to grow productively and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable fertilizer and to pay the labor of those people who are working at her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Analisa works very hard to provide for them.

Analisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cereals, creamer, seasonings, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

Analisa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, creamer, seasonings, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. 

Analisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cereals, creamer, seasonings, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, and fabric conditioner to sell

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Residing in Battambang Province, Pheap is 55 years old. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping. For Pheap, this is her seventh loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to purchase rice seed. She hopes that she can get a bigger yield than last year.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita works hard to support her family. Lita is married and has a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines.

Lita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Lita has been in this business for five years now.

Lita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is a 46-year-old woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Malia has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, baking powder, containers, a gas oven etc. She joined SPBD this year 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malia will support her family and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, baking powder, a gas oven, containers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish an addition that was started with a previous loan, in order to have more space in her family's home.

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Reina works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store.  Reina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Reina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor principalmente.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Marcela espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes para satisfacer sus gustos y preferencias lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcela, 52, is married and lives in the district of Buenos Aires which is in the province of Morropon in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. Life in her community is peaceful and the inhabitants work in commerce and cattle raising.

Marcela sells groceries like rice, sugar, oil and other things. She has been doing this for five years and has fixed customers who give personal and professional references for her. Her loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of merchandise like rice, sugar, oil and other things, in order to increase the stock of her store. Marcelo hopes to offer a greater variety of products for her customers to satisfy their needs and preferences, which will allow her to make more income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in greater quantities, like rice, sugar, oil and other things.

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Sia is a 61-year-old married woman with 10 children. She makes and sells banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has more than two years of experience with this business.

Sia needs a loan to buy cooking oil, bananas, a frying pan, tongs, plastic bags, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Sia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bananas, a frying pan, tongs, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Viope

texts.en:
Viope is 27 years old and has two children. Viope has a live-in partner, and one child is currently in school.

Viope is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Viope requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Viope has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Viope would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a buying and selling of livestock business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for nine years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Willian Rafael

texts.es:
Willian, de 24 años de edad, está casado desde hace un año, tiene un niño de 6 meses de nacido y actualmente viven en la casa de su jefe.

Willian, trabaja como empleado, se dedica a criar ganado, su trabajo consiste en estar al pendiente de la comida de los animales, ordeñar las vacas y estar pendiente de los cercas, que se mantengan en buen estado, para que los animales no se salgan a molestar la propiedad ajena.

William, apredió este trabajo desde que tenia 12 años, no le habia tomado importancia, pero al fallecer su tio, que fue quien le enseño este trabajo, se dio cuenta que le habia heredado algo muy valioso, que le podia servir toda su vida y por esa razon aunque el trabajo sea pesado, él lo hace con mucho gusto.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar dos cabezas de ganado, con el dinero podrá podrá tambien pagar transporte, para trasladar los animales hasta su vivienda.

Su deseo es ir comprando ganado poco a poco, hasta obtener una buena cantidad para trabajar con ganado propio y tener el dinero suficiente para construir su casa propia y de esta manera vivir sin preocupaciones.- Además, darle una vida digna a su esposa y a su hijo.
texts.en:
Willian, 24, has been married for one year and has a 6 month old son. Currently he lives in the home of his boss. Willian works as a ranch hand. He is responsible for feeding the cattle, keeping them in order and being aware of the surroundings so they stay in good shape and don't get out and mess up bordering property. Willian learned this work from the age of 12; he didn't give much importance to it until his uncle, whom he had learned from, died. That's when he realized that he had inherited something valuable that could serve him all his life. For that reason, even though the work can be hard, he loves it.

Willian needs a loan to buy two heads of cattle. With that money he will also be able to transport them to his home. His wish is to buy cattle little by little until he has enough to work with his own cattle and build his own house so that he doesn't have to worry. He also wants to give his wife and son a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Soya

texts.en:
A mother of two school children living in Battambang province, Soya is 42 years old. To support her living, she grows rice on two hectares of land. 

For Soya, this is her eighth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. 

She will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Rasin

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Rasin is a mother of two schoolchildren. For a living, she grows rice as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via raising pigs. 

For Rasin, this is her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her life, better than before.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Battambang province, Kan is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She can earn income to support her living conditions via rice cropping on a 10-hectare area. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her a decent income. 

For Kan, this is her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed to support her rice farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 21 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cordial, sugar, plastic cups, a freezer, etc. 

In the future, Mary hopes to start another business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD this year, 2015, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, plastic cups, a freezer, etc.

loans.name: Faaiu

texts.en:
Faaiu is 67 years old and a widow with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, beans, tomatoes, and other fruits and vegetables that she sells in her community or at the market. 

She has been doing this for 3 years. Faaiu needs a loan to buy chemicals, seeds, a rake,a wheelbarrow and other supplies. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Faaiu will use the profits from her sales to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, seeds, a rake, a wheelbarrow, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and widowed with three children. 

Ana is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Frelinda

texts.en:
Frelinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Frelinda is 43 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Frelinda has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Frelinda requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Frelinda has been in this business for three years. Frelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Nelba

texts.en:
Nelba is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelba is 42 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Nelba has a general store business in the Philippines. Nelba requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioners, rice, biscuits, candies, etc., to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nelba has been in this business for six years. Nelba would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioners, rice, biscuits, candies, etc., to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie is 41 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Margie has a general store business in the Philippines. Margie requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Margie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a la situación económica de su familia no pudo continuar estudiando, es madre soltera de una niña de cuatro años, ella cubre con todos los gastos del hogar.

Roxana, es una mujer con muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su hija, es por eso que desde que dejo de estudiar, trabaja como ama de casa, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde, de lunes a sábado. 

El préstamo sera utilizado para la reparación de las paredes de su vivienda, las cuales se encuentran muy deterioradas y teme que se caigan y causen una desgracia.

El sueño de Roxana, es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ademas ayudar a que su hija estudie y se prepare dedicadamente.
texts.en:
Roxana, 25, studied until the 9th grade, but due to her family's financial situation she couldn't continue in school. She is a single mother of a four-year-old daughter and is the sole breadwinner in her home.

Roxana wants to give her daughter the best, which is why she has worked as a household employee since she left school. She works from 7am to 4pm, Monday to Saturday.

This loan will be used to repair the walls of her home which are deteriorated and she fears they may cave in and cause a mess. Roxana's dream is to give her daughter a better quality of life, and help her to study and prepare herself for the future.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her home.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Sophen is 33 years old and a mother of one child. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice on a 2-hectare area. 

This is her eighth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to purchase rice seed and pay for the plowing fee to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and pay for the plowing fee to support her rice farm

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María, de 61 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está soltera y tiene 6 hijos y en su casa solo vive su hija y el esposo de su hija. Sin embargo no depende económicamente de ellos.

María, solo creció con su madre, ella no le quiso dar la oportunidad de estudiar, fue por esa razón que desde la edad de 12 años trabaja, es una mujer muy luchadora y ha trabajado 6 años vendiendo tamales, además trabajó 9 años elaborando tortillas. Actualmente, tiene 2 años de vender verduras y frutas, de donde obtiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar frutas y verduras, para hacer crecer su negocio y que sus ventas incrementen.

María, sueña con tener un terreno propio, donde pueda construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 61, didn't have the opportunity to attend school. She is single and has 6 children, and she lives with one daughter and son-in-law. However, she is not dependent financially on them.

Maria grew up with only her mother, who didn't want her to go to school. That's why, at the age of 12, Maria started working. She is a hardworking woman and for the last 6 years has sold tamales, and for 9 years she has been making tortillas. Most recently, she has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last two years, which gives her income to meet her needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to grow her business and increase her sales. Maria dreams of having her own land where she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Falconery

texts.en:
Falconery is 51 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are currently in school.

Falconery has an agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for four years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Falconery would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Metuli

texts.en:
Metuli is a 58-year-old widow with five children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Metuli needs a loan to buy cooking oil, bags of flour, containers, baking powder, sugar, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and save for unexpected emergencies. 

Metuli has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bags of flour, containers, baking powder, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Taualofa

texts.en:
Taualofa is a 65-year-old married woman with 13 children. 

She runs a business of sewing clothes in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Taualofa has requested a loan to buy an electric sewing machine, scissors, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save for unexpected emergencies. 

Taualofa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy an electric sewing machine, scissors, thread, etc.

loans.name: Meshela

texts.en:
Meshela works hard to support her family. She is married and has been running a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for four years now.
She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

Meshela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 41 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Daisy has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en:
Dolly is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now and works hard to support her family. 

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Dolly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua is a 57-year-old woman who is married with six children. She runs a business designing materials and sewing clothes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Faifua has requested a loan to buy paint brushes, rubber designs, a new sewing machine, material, color paints, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and open another new business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rubber designs, material, brooms, colour paints, clothes, needles, threads, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en:
Mesepa is 29 years old and is married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, beans and cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Mesepa needs a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, rakes, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, etc. 

Mesepa has been a member of SBPD since 2013. She will use the profits from her sales to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, rakes, weed spray, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Nive

texts.en:
Nive is 49 years old and is married with six children. 

She has a small garden where she grows beans, cucumbers, cabbages, etc that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Nive needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, spades, wheelbarrows, rakes, etc. 

Nive has been a member of SBPD since 2013. She will use the profits from her sales to to support her family financially and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, spades, wheelbarrows, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used as revolving cash fund for her travel and tours business. Her earnings helped send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to continue operations of her ticketing business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her travel and tours business and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover her family's needs and fund the schooling of her High School and Elementary children. 

Rubelyn dreams to have more clients and give her children the best education and see them become professionals. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to add to the revolving cash fund needed in her travel agency business.

loans.name: Jomildred

texts.en:
Jomildred is grateful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan which she used for repairs and maintenance of their tricycle unit and to add grocery items for her store.  Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditure. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy spare parts, maintain her tricycle unit and buy more grocery items to sell at her small store. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investments and the financial grant will surely help cover their daily needs and fund her children's education.

Jomildred dreams to buy an additional tricycle. She aims to send her children to good schools and get a college education.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay buy spare parts, maintain her tricycle unit and add some grocery items to her small variety store.

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda is 49 years old and is married with one child. 

Roselinda has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed and other supplies for her pigs.

In the future, Roselinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is 50 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, growing rice in the Philippines. Elmar has been growing rice for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sarai

texts.en:
Sarai is 40 years old and has four children. 

She operates a business selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years. Sarai has requested for a loan to buy banana tube (seedlings) , taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals to assist her run the business. 

Sarai joined SPBD in 2010, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy banana tube (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are in school.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for eight years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile loading. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has been running a tailoring business in the Philippines for 20 years now.  Elsa has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business.

Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, needles, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and is married with one child.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 61 years old and is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amelita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amelita has been in this business for 31 years. Amelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 37 years old, single, and has three children, two of whom are presently in school.

Eden has a pig raising business in the Philippines. She has been in business for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells basic commodities ranging from candy, biscuits, chocolates, chips, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and seasonings. She is a 25-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 4, while the other is 1 year old. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter.

Marissa has requested for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store like soft drinks, canned goods, seasonings, wood and bricks. These stocks will help fill her store and cater to the needs of her customers. Slowly, her income will grow and she can start to settle her obligations. 

Marissa dreams of expanding her business to become a successful businesswoman someday and provide for her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like soft drinks, canned goods, seasonings, wood and bricks.

loans.name: Malae

texts.en: Malae is a 32-yea- old mother with 2 children.  She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Malae has requested for a loan to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves to help run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family needs. Malae became a member of SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and hand gloves.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Bernardita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional thread, yards of cloth and maintenance for her sewing machine.

Bernardita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional thread, yards of cloth and maintenance for her sewing machine

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like flour, spices, milk and sugar.

Lucia has been in this business for 6 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, spices, milk and sugar for her food vending business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 46 years old and married with seven children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, soap and detergent.

Cecilia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, soap and detergent to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Jessa

texts.en:
Ma. Jessa, aged 25, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past three years. 

Ma. Jessa has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Famille Kashisha Group

texts.fr: A l'âge de 15 ans, Raymond a été initié à la culture du café par ses parents. Petit à petit, cette activité s'est agrandie surtout avec l'assistance de son épouse Chantal à partir de 2005. La culture du café exige beaucoup de travaux champêtres à effectuer régulièrement qui ont un impact considérable sur la qualité et la quantité à récolter; ce crédit assistera Raymond en ce sens.
texts.en:
When he was 15 years old, Raymond started farming coffee with the help of his parents. Little by little, this business has grown, especially since 2005 with the help of his wife Chantal.

Farming coffee requires a lot of regular work in the field, which has a big impact on the quality and quantity of the harvest. 

This loan will help Raymond with this work.

loans.use: to weed, mulch, and harvest

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, aged 55, is married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Eva has run a general store in the Philippines for the past two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Eva has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, coffee, spices, etc.

Eva aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, coffee, spices, etc.

loans.name: Bonifance

texts.en:
Bonifance, aged 38, is a single man with five children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who rears chickens and grows food crops like bananas and tomatoes. 

Bonifance is faced with the challenge of little capital that is hindering the progress of his business. He has asked for a loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. Bonifance hopes to have enough stock and to educate all of his children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice and her restaurant business. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Famille Karhangale Group

texts.fr: Compte tenu de l'intérêt lucratif du café, Pascal s'est lancé avec sa famille dans la culture du café en l'an 2000. Il a un projet d'étendre son activité mais pour le moment ce crédit lui servira à la prise en charge de travaux d'entretien et de récolte afin de résoudre le problème lié à l'accès au financement. Il pose sur la photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
Because of the lucrative profits in coffee, Pascal, with his family, started farming coffee in 2000. 

He has a plan to expand his business, but for the moment this loan will serve to pay the cost of labor in maintaining and harvesting to solve the problem related to accessing financing.

Pascal is standing in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest and maintain the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to expand his banana plantation.

loans.name: Famille Rutaburingonga Group

texts.fr: Après constat que la culture du café est productive dans le milieu, Moise a décidé de s'y lancer. Les seuls problèmes qui s'y posent sont l'absence des marchés d'écoulement, les innombrables travaux champêtres fatigants et la fréquence de maladies qui touchent les paysans pouvant ainsi retarder le processus de production. Toutefois, il espère renouveler ses tiges qui ont vieilli, avoir accès aux produits phytosanitaires pour un entretien efficace des plantes.
texts.en:
Moise decided to start farming coffee after he learned that it is a productive business in this area. The only problems for him are the absence of sales markets, the incessant work needed to farm the coffee, and the frequency that illness afflicts the workers which can delay production.

However, he hopes to renew his plants that are too old and to have access to pesticides to that will maintain the efficiency of his plants.

loans.use: to maintain a field

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Etant une femme au foyer et agée de 58 ans, Dédé vit avec ses sept enfants dans le quartier  Kodjoviakopé. Dédé  vend de la viande de porc préparée pour ainsi subvenir aux besoins du foyer. Dédé s’approvisionne auprès des éleveurs quatre fois par mois. Dédé est dynamique et a une bonne rentabilité dans son activité génératrice de revenu. Dédé  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des porcs en satisfaisant agréablement ses consommateurs et réaliser encore plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
A housewife who is 58 years old, Dédé lives with her seven children in the Kodjoviakopé area. She sells cooked pork so she can support her household's needs. 

Dédé procures pigs from farmers four times a month. She is dynamic and earns a good income from her business.

Dédé is seeking a loan to buy pigs so that she can more easily satisfy her customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy six pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to weed [his farmland]

loans.name: Nakan Group

texts.fr: Salimata est le membre représentatif de ce groupe, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Salimata et les autres membres ont adhéré ACFIME depuis Mai 2009 et sont à leur 13ème contrat de prêt. Ce groupe fait des remboursements correcte. Salimata fait le commerce des pagnes et en plus de cela, elle gérer un kiosque dans laquelle elle fait du thé, du café,des sandwichs,du pain. Avec ce crédit, Salimata va acheter des pagnes pour vendre et renforcer la gestion de son kiosque. A l'issue de ses ventes, le bénéfice de salimata lui permettra de continuer son activité et pourvoir au besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salimata is the representative member of this group. She is married and a mother of one child. 

She and the other members of the group joined ACFIME in May 2009, and they are on their 13th loan. They pay back their loans correctly.

Salimata works selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]. In addition, she runs a kiosk where she makes tea, coffee, sandwiches, and bread.

With this loan, Salimata is going to buy pagnes to resell and strengthen her kiosk business.

Earnings from her sales will allow Salimata to continue her business and support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] to sell and to manage her coffee kiosk

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 45 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, shampoo, noodles, sugar and coffee.

Irma has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Airen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Airen is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Airen has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 47 years old and married with five children.

Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.fr:
Immaculée fait partie du groupe  Tumaine et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 36 ans et  a  3 enfants âgés de 15 à 18 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  la  bière de banane  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  diversifier les produits, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Immaculée is a member of the Tumaine group and lives in Gitega. She is 36 and has three children between the ages of 15 and 18. They are all students.

She has been selling banana beer for six years.

This is her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to diversify her products and see her children through their studies.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanakame operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is a business woman. She was born in remote district in the southern part of the country. She is single. Her parents are helping and supporting her to do business. For about five years, she has had a business trading women and kids clothes. She has a good location for her work where she trades. 

Umeda is planning to widen her business. She requested a loan of 1,500 USD to improve her standard of living and increase the turnover of her business. She needs to buy a new collection of clothes. She awaits Kiva project members' mercy.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing a loan through NWTF to buy sacks of bananas to sell in her banana business.

Rowena has been in this business for 5 years. Rowena earns more income from raising livestock.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sahara

texts.en:
Sahara is 38 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school, Sahara works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Sahara has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Sahara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her food business.

Dominica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Dominica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is a 45-year-old hardworking lady with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a bar and at the same time is a farmer growing food crops like bananas that add to her income. She is faced with hardships of limited capital, to expand her business to the expected level she desires. 

However, she hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Peace needs a loan to buy beers, waragi (distilled drinks) and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, waragi and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Mwete Group

texts.fr:
Evelyne  fait partie du groupe  Mwete et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 23 ans et est mariée à Méthode,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 5 à 8 ans,dont  2 étudient.
 

Elle fait le commerce de  boissons  depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son 2ème   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de la biere mais, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  augmenter des achats,et voir ses enfants étudient.
texts.en:
Evelyne  is a member of the Mwete group and lives in Gitega. She is 23 and is married to Method, a farmer. They have three children between the ages of five and eight. Two of them go to school.

She has been selling  beverages for 10 years.

This is her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy corn beer for resale in order to earn more.
In the coming years, she would like to increase her purchases and see her children through their studies.

loans.use: With the Kiva credit that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy corn beer for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old, single and has one child.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in the business for 4 years now, she also earns additional income from a general store and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is twenty-five years old, married, with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Sylivia is a young enterprising woman who sells Gonja in order to earn a living. She began the business in 2012 with high hopes of diversifying her business using the proceeds and buying motorcycles for transportation. 

She is a hard-working woman faced with the challenge of limited capital. Sylivia wants money to buy sweet bananas commonly known as Gonja to sell.

loans.use: to buy sweet bananas commonly known as Gonja to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noddles, breads, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through raising pigs. 

Josefa dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noddles, breads.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 42, married and has six children who are aged 20, 18,16,14,12 and 10 years respectively. He lives in an semi-rural setting with his family. All his children still attend school and he is a farmer who grows passion fruit and tomatoes.

Benard started the farming business in 2000 and he works six days a week, eight hours a day. He started this business in order to earn a living since he did not go to school, and he supplements his family income with income from a bakery. The loan will enable him to by organic fertilizers, which will help to increase the quality of his yields. 

Benard's  customers are traders from cities and he hopes to be the leading supplier of agricultural products in his area. But he still faces the challenges of a lack of enough capital and unpredictable weather. He describes himself as a hard working and honest man. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders' services.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married woman with two children who attends school and are under her care. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marie Holande

texts.fr:
Mariée, 54 ans, Marie Holande a 4 enfants dont 2 encore à sa charge et les 2 autres déjà indépendants.
Comme activité génératrice de revenu, elle et son mari vendent de pneus et jantes d'occasion,ceci depuis 27 ans,ils ont 2 points de vente. C'est avec cette activité qu'elle a pu et continuer à scolariser ses enfants et subvenir aux différents besoins de la famille.
Actuellement, elle a besoin d'augmenter le revenu car les frais de scolarité au lycée et à l'université sont beaucoup plus cher.
Le crédit va lui permettre de mieux ravitailler les 2 magasins afin de procurer plus de revenu et pour qu'elle puisse assurer la scolarisation de ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Holande is 54 years old and married; she has four children, two of whom are still in her care, while the other two are already independent. She and her husband have an income-generating activity selling second-hand tires and wheel rims, and they have been doing this for the past 27 years. They have two sales outlets. As a result of this activity she has been and continues to be able to educate her children and provide for the various family needs. 

At the moment she needs to increase her income because high school and university costs have become much more expensive. This loan will enable her to get fresh supplies for the two shops, so that she can earn more income and cover the costs of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tires and wheel rims.

loans.name: Sulhiya

texts.en: Sulhiya is a hardworking woman who was was born in 1986. She is from the southern part of Tajikistan and is married with two children. For almost four years she has been busy with keeping and feeding livestock. She tries to raise good livestock to sell at the animal market. Sulhiya attracts a lot of satisfied clients. However, the income that she gains from her business is not enough to improve her standard of living. Sulhiya wants to renovate her house and live under better conditions. She is asking for financial support from KIVA to renovate her house and buy construction materials.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy construction materials

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Loida has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and married with seven children. Four of her children are in school.

Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Ana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 63 years old, married, and has seven children. 

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Isabelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like nipa roofing, wood, and other materials for the renovation of her pigpens.

Isabelita has been for 20 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nipa roofing, wood, and other materials for the renovation of her pigpens

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce works hard to support her family. She is single and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Joyce requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Joyce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of nine children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dressed chicken. Lilia is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell to customers.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a male, married with two children one of whom attends school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise and works 12 hours a day and 6 days a week. He has been in that business for seven years and practices farming as an additional income source. 

He intends to us the money to buy salt, sugar, soap and other merchandise to sell and hopes to expand his business. Edward is a hardworking person however lack of capital and competition are challenges he faces.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals to fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Crais

texts.en:
Crais is a married man, aged 33 years, with three kids who are 4, 6 and 8 years old. He lives on the outskirt of Kyotera town along Mutukula highway with his family, and he deals in agriculture, specifically growing coffee.  

He works 6 days a week and each day he works for 12 hours. He has been in this business since 2011 and he started it with the aim of meeting the increasing demands of his family. His clients are local people. 

Crais is acquiring this loan in order to buy more stock of coffee from the farmers since its now harvest season. He anticipates profit at the end of the sales.

His dream is to build rentals in the nearby trading centre. He is challenged by limited capital to run the business smoothly.
