He describes himself as a honest man, and believe lenders should reduce the interest.

loans.use: To buy coffee

loans.name: Moussiana

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 43 ans, Moussiana est une femme qui vit à Nyékonakpoè avec ses quatre enfants. Dans le quartier et environs, Moussiana vend des produits de commerce général et trouve son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Moussiana s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Moussiana demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs  de détergents et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes de la famille
texts.en: Moussiana is a 43-year old married woman who lives in Nyékonakpoè with her four children. She sells general products in her neighborhood and surrounding areas and makes an income for herself from this business. In order to meet demand effectively, Moussiana gets her supplies three times a month from the market. She is requesting this loan in order to order sacks of detergent and earn more income so she can help her husband to cover the family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of detergent.

loans.name: Olivololona

texts.fr:
27 ans, Olivololona est heureuse d'être mariée à un mécanicien ainsi que mère de 3 enfants.Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés. 
 Elle exerce une activité d'épicerie depuis 2 ans.
Comme nous voyons sur la photo, la boutique est encore en bois, son but est de le réaménager en dur (en brique).
Mais d'abord, le prêt va être utilisé pour ravitailler les stocks de marchandises afin d'augmenter le revenu pour qu'elle puisse épargner plus car elle pense effectuer la plupart de la réhabilitation de son lieu d'activité avec son épargne
Avec le crédit, elle va surtout acheter des produits de premières nécessités (PPN) que les clients en ont beaucoup plus besoin surtout en cette période de pluie à savoir le riz, le sucre, l'huile de table, les bougies, des légumes secs comme haricots secs etc...
texts.en:
At 27 years old, Olivololona is happy to be married to a mechanic and mother of three children. All her children go to school.
She has been running a grocery for two years.
As can be seen in the photo, her stall is made of wood, her ambition is to refurbish it in brick.
However, in the first instance, she will use her loan to replenish her stock of merchandise in order to increase her income so that she can save more because she intends to pay for the majority of the refurbishing of her business location with her savings.
With the credit, she will buy mainly essentials (products of first necessity, i.e. PPN) of which her clients are in great need especially in this rainy season. For example, rice, sugar, table oil, candles, dried vegetables such as beans, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, table oil, candles, dried vegetables.

loans.name: Voahirana

texts.fr:
50 ans, mariée, Voahirana a 6 enfants qui ne vivent plus chez elle mais tous ont chacun leurs propres foyers respectifs.
Voahirana est une femme battante, elle exerce une activité de vente de vêtements durant déjà 15 ans. 
Avant, elle vendaient avec son mari des arts malagasy mais très consciente de la dureté de la vie, elle cherchait d'autre activité pour diversifier et augmenter le revenu familial. Selon elle, mieux vaut 2 différentes activités qu'une seule pour diminuer les risques.
Actuellement, elle est très contente d'avoir pu scolarisé ses enfants par le biais de ces activités 
Pour assurer leur retraite (elle et son mari), et subvenir à leurs besoins, elle veut garder son activité en marche et demande un crédit.
Ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son fonds de roulement, d'améliorer les ventes et de procurer davantage de revenu
texts.en: Voahirana is 50 years old and married. She has six children who no longer live with her and all have their own respective households. Voahirana is a fighting woman who has been selling clothes for the past 15 years. Beforehand she sold Madagascan crafts, but conscious of the harshness of life, decided to find another activity, so she could diversify and increase the family's income. According to her, it is better to have two different activities than just one, in order to reduce the risks. Currently she is very happy to have been able to educate her children as a result of her activities. In order to provide for their retirement (her's and her husband's) and their needs, she would like to keep her activity going and is requesting a loan. This loan will enable her to increase her working capital, her sales and to make more money.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts and pullovers.

loans.name: Oliya

texts.en:
Oliya is a brave woman. She was born in 1975. She is married. She has four children. She is living in a village. For almost five years she has had experience of doing a business. She has a business trading candies, sweets, cakes and pancakes. 

Oliya knows her activity well. She wants to enlarge her business. She is asking financial support from Kiva to improve her turnover and business.

loans.use: to buy candies, sweets, cakes and pancakes.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 52 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aurelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Aurelia has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla, âgée de 30 ans est une femme mariée et vit à Tokoin avec deux enfants à charge. Abla vend des ignames  dans le quartier et ses environs pour fournir ses clients. Pour avoir un stock toujours disponible, Abla s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Abla désire commander des calebasses d’ignames pour s’équiper et nécessite ce fonds pour réaliser son achat afin avoir une rentabilité lui permettant de soutenir les charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Abla is a 30-year old married woman who lives in Tokoin with two children in her care. She sells yams in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. In order to always have stock available she gets her supplies four times a month at the market. She would like to order calabashes of yams and needs this money to purchase them and thereby have enough margin to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy two calabashes of yams.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old, a widow and has three children. She manages a store to acquire income. She is a hardworking person and wants to keep gaining income for her family. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to invest in her store. She will buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell. This will help increase her sales and acquire continuous profits for her family. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Gokale

texts.fr: Gokale vit à Kodomé et est âgée de 35 ans. Mariée, Gokale est mère de deux enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Gokale vend des détergents dans son quartier pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Gokale s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois sur un marché local. Pour commander des sacs de détergents, Gokale demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en: Gokale lives in Kodome and is 35 years old. Gokale is married with two children and works hard to promote their education. Gokale sells detergent in her district to earn enough to live on. Gokale buys her supplies four times every month at a local market. To enable her to order her bags of detergent, Gokale requests this loan to purchase her stock and ensure her financial viability.

loans.use: to buy three bags of detergent.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya lives with her husband in Yenoqavan village of Tavush region. Their only son lives separately in the same village. 

Sonya is intensively involved in agricultural activities. She keeps piglets and hens. 

Her plot of land also is rich with harvests (wheat, corn, potato, plum, nut, apple and trees) that both feed her family and allows her to sell it at the wholesale market.

For the development of her agribusiness, Sonya needs more funds. She has applied for this loan of USD 1,000 to purchase two piglets, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

This is her second loan. Sonya has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets, seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 27 years old and married to Esther and are blessed with 3 children aged 8, 4 and 2 years old. He has been in a farming for the last 13 years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,700. 

Geoffrey has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow to have surplus milk production and sales. This will enable him add more stock of agricultural produce to sell. 

He will use the generated profits to repay his loan as well as expand his businesses.

He hopes to become financially stable and educate his children for life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to have surplus milk production and sales.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Her name is Marissa, 50, she is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Hermogenes, a bus operator she has two children of which whom is in high school and the other one is still in the elementary level in school. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children 

Marissa has a direct selling business. She sells First Vita Plus, a natural health drink that boost energy levels, keeps immune systems strong enough to reduce the risk of serious illness and diseases. It has many health benefits to enhance the body's healing mechanism, promote and maintain overall good health. Filipinos are now more health conscious. They are learning to take natural vitamins to support their well-being and for the love of their family. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy several boxes of First Vita Plus products to meet the advanced orders of her growing clients. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives, friends and the local community. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial grant for it will surely help in their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Marissa aims to grow her business to better provide for the needs of her children. She prays to stay strong and healthy and that they always lead a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for natural energy drinks and natural vitamins to sell.

loans.name: Gneta Group

texts.fr: Gniné est la dame qui tient l’assiette en main sur la photo.                                                                                                             Gniné est une Malienne vendeuse des condiments et de riz,  âgée de 36 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants qui sont tous à l’école, âgés de 18 ans et moins.. Le mari de Gniné est un emboucheur de bœufs, ils sont tous alphabétisé de la 7è à 9è année fondamental respective. Gniné à commencer à faire le petit commerce depuis 10 ans. Elle fait recourt au RMCR pour demander un prêt pour son activité, enfin de pourvoir travailler efficacement en hauteur de souhait. Le profil tiré de son activité lui servira à prendre certain charge familiaux (frais sanitaire, et surtout le petit déjeuné des écoliers), ça leurs permet de bien travaillé à l’école. Elle s’approvisionne dans oignons, tomate de, riz et beaucoup d’autre, tout passe dans le marché local et revend dans le même lieu.
texts.en:
Gnine is the lady holding the plate in the photo.
Gnine is a Malian who sells condiments and rice. She is 36 years old and married with five children who are all aged 18 and less and all of whom attend school. They all became literate between the seventh and the ninth elementary grade respectively. Gnine's husband is a livestock farmer who fattens cattle. Gnine started in small business 10 years ago. She appeals to RMCR to request a loan for her business in order to be able to work as effectively as she would like to. The profit from her business will enable her to assume certain family expenses (health expenses and above all breakfast for the children before leaving for school), as this enables them to study properly at school. She stocks up on onions, tomatoes, rice and many other products, she buys all her supplies at the local market and sells her merchandise at the same place.

loans.use: to buy condiments and rice for resale.

loans.name: Gnibassan Group

texts.fr: Gnibassan fait partie des premiers clients de ACFIME. Ce groupe est formé de 6 femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Hado est la responsable de ce groupe, elle est marié et a des enfants dont ceux qui sont en âge d'aller à l'école y vont. Cette brave dame vend des pagnes bazins et elle a besoin de ce crédit pour s'approvisionner. A l'issue de ses ventes, elle épargnera une somme de 12 500 francs et aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer son activité et de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Gnibassa is one of the first clients of ACFIME. This group is composed of six dynamic ladies who all work in trade. Hado is in charge of the group, she is married with school-aged children and they go to school. This good lady sells pagne traditional dress bazin fabrics and she needs a loan to buy her stock. When she has sold her goods, she will save 12,500 francs and will have a profit that will enable her to continue her activity and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy bazin fabrics.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es una mujer de 43 años de edad ella siempre ha sido muy dedicada a su hogar, a su pareja, en términos generales no ha tenido un trabajo estable, ella genera ingresos prestando servicio de cuidado de niños, en hogares de familia y cosas muy esporádicas no fijas.
Marleny quiere revertir una dificultad económica por la que está pasando, ella quiere sentirse útil, ser útil no solo estar en una casa ordenando y cocinando quiere generar su propio sustento, comprarse su propia ropa, pagarse sus cuentas, comprar su alimento, recoger para comprar un hogar muchos proyectos que ahora está dispuesta a iniciar.
Marleny con tu apoyo desea iniciar un negocio porcicultura, una actividad que conoce muy bien, que aprendió de sus padres y que ahora desea ejercer.
Tu apoyo significara para ella comprar cerdos, alimento de engorde y construir el corral.
texts.en:
Marleny is a 43-year-old woman. She has always been very dedicated to her household and her partner. In general terms, she hasn't had a steady job. She earns money by offering childcare services to families at their houses, and through other occasional things that aren't regular.

Marleny wants to reverse the financial difficulty that she is going through. She wants to feel useful and to be useful, not only live in a orderly house and cook. She wants to earn her own income, buy her own clothes, pay her own bills, buy food, and save to buy a house. There are many projects that she is ready to begin now.

With your support, Marleny would like to start a business raising pigs, an occupation that she knows very well. She learned it from her parents, and now she wants to do it herself. Your support will enable her to buy pigs and feed, and to build a pigsty.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed, and to build a pigsty.

loans.name: Patawenam

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 32 ans, Patawenam est une femme mère de deux enfants. Patawenam habite à Amadahomé et vend des charbons de bois dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Patawenam s’approvisionne trois fois par mois chez un fournisseur du quartier. Pour commander des sacs de charbon, Patawenam demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Married and aged 32, Patawenam is a woman with two children. Patawenam lives in Amadahomé and sells charcoal locally in order to make enough profit to permit her children to thrive. To manage this, Patawenam buys her stock three times a month from a local stockist. To order her sacks of charcoal, Patawenam requests this loan to pay for her purchase and make enough income to help her husband to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 03 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
Ceferino tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyugue y sus cinco menores hijos en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. Esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto y obtendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ceferino is 44 years old. He lives in his own house, built from crude materials, with his wife and five young children in the district of Pucará, which is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajarmarca region on the northern coast of Perú. The people of this district make a living working in agriculture and commerce, and by raising animals.

Ceferino makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee beans, and he has 14 years of experience in this line of work. He has regular customers who recommend him both personally and professionally. The loan to be granted to Ceferino will be used in agricultural work, such as the incorporation and application of plant protection products and fertilizer, as well as the labor costs of his harvest. This will help him to improve the physiological, morphological, and productive aspects of his crop, as well as have a more timely harvest. Hence, Ceferino will have a more productive crop and a higher-quality product. As a result, he won't have any problems selling his product, and he will earn more income, which will enable him to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to incorporate and apply plant protection products and fertilizer, and to help pay for the labor costs of his harvest.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 56 year old vegetable vendor at Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of adult children.  Her husband is a farmer and provides her with additional income.  She has been in this business for the last five years and has done very well.

This marks her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase several bags of onions.

With the profits, Esther will continue to restock her business. She hopes to be the major supplier of onions to the whole town in future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of onions

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 54 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school, Lani works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF, to purchase additional stock of spices, soft drinks, cooking oil, soap, shampoo, etc. for her store.

Lani has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lani would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of spices, soft drinks, cooking oil, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
Maira es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella es muy trabajadora, independiente y responsable, es madre de dos hijos uno de ellos de 6 años de edad y una bebe de 1 año, vive junto con su pareja, por amor, por estar juntos tomaron la decisión de estar juntos aún en contra de sus familiares, ellos se aman y juntos trabajan en diferentes campos para llevar el sustento a su casa.
Por su parte Maira tiene una venta de bolis y cremas que en pocas palabras es un líquido de sabores como chocolate, mango biche, naranja, mora, maracuyá, lulo introducidos en una bolsa plástica y puesto a refrigerar para que se congelen, dicho negocio lo tiene en su hogar, donde de igual manera puede cuidar a sus pequeños que aún están muy bebes.
Su preocupación inmediata es poder tener el capital para pagar la educación de sus hijos y aunque sabe que puede emplearse prefiere quedarse en casa y educar de buena manera a sus dos pequeños.
Maira solicita un préstamo, con el que tendrá capital de trabajo para comprar los insumos que necesiten por el momento necesita moldes para vender cremas, empaques de bolsas plásticas, y surtido de frutas y leche para realizar sus productos congelados.
texts.en:
Maira, age 21, is a very hard-working, independent, and responsible young woman.  She has two children.  One of them is six years old, and the other is a one year old baby.  She lives with her life partner.  Out of love and being together, they made the decision to be together even when it went against her family.  They love each other, and together they work in different fields in order to bring sustenance to their household.

For her part Maira sells ‘bolis y cremas’.  In a few words, it is a flavored liquid like chocolate, green mango, blackberry, passion fruit, or ‘lulo’ [exotic fruit with citrus flavor] in a plastic bag, which is then frozen.  She has this business at her house.  This way she is able to take care of her little ones who are still very young.

Her immediate concern is being able to have the capital to pay for her children’s education.  Even though she knows that she could get a job, she prefers to stay at home and raise her two little ones in a good way.

Maira is requesting a loan to have working capital to buy the supplies she needs.  At this time she needs molds to sell creams, plastic bags to package them, and stock of fruit and milk to make her frozen products.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, fruit, and milk to make 'cremas y bolis' [frozen flavored milk].

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth, 45, is married and has four children. The children are presently in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been working in agriculture for six years and earns additional income from a general store. 

To sustain her business, Lilibeth has borrowed eight times from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now requesting a loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sohad

texts.en:
Sohad, 35, is married and has five children. She likes her occupation a lot because she likes to feel independent. She works cooperatively with her husband to collect enough money to live with her family in peace and to protect them from poverty.

Sohad breeds sheep. She wants to expand her work to increase her income and cover her children`s education fees. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to help her buy more sheep and expand her work.

loans.use: To help her buy more sheep and expand her work

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Phally’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Phally was selected to be a group leader for a loan requested from Maxima. In the group there are two members and they are from a village in the Dongkor district of Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

1-Phally (pictured) is 65 years old and a widow, She lives in the Dongkor district, Phnom Penh ,Cambodia. She has one son. He is a student.
Phally has been a sewer for fifteen years. Phally is applying for a loan of $250 to repair her house.
2- Sophea (shown in photo) is 33 years old, She lives in the Dongkor district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two daughters. They are still young.
Sophea has been a garment factory worker for four years, while her husband is a tuk tuk driver with five years experience. She is applying for a loan of $250 to repair the tuk tuk. 

Photo: Phally is one the left of Sophea.

loans.use: to repair a tuk tuk and her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy pagne dresses.

loans.name: Dolvine

texts.en:
Dolvine is 26 years old and married to Domic. They are blessed with three children. She has been farming for the last seven years and earns 14,000 KES per month.

Dolvine has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income by supplying milk to her clients. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming.

She hopes to have educated children and vast farming activities in future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase her income by supplying milk to her clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase her sources of income

loans.name: Naiime

texts.en: Naiime is a 61-year-old Lebanese widow of three children. She is the main income provider for her family. Naiime has been working in the agriculture sector since 2005 in order to earn extra income and support her family financially. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings as well as manure for her business. She is well-known in her region due to her good reputation. She is sure that with the new merchandises, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for plantings as well as manure for her busines

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old nursery school teacher and proprietor at Voi Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband provides additional income to the family.

Her school is called Children's Care Academy and Beatrice has run it for the past twelve years.

This marks her second borrowing of 50,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to advance her school. She will use the loan to purchase desks and chairs for her classrooms and the anticipated profit will be used to expand her school further.

In future she hopes to own a complex.

loans.use: to purchase desks and chairs for her classrooms

loans.name: Margarita Mariela

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de peluquería en su salón de belleza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 16 años contando con gran experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes dan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio como shampoos, peines, secadores de cabello, sillas, entre otros, para implementar su negocio, con esto Margarita espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house in a rural area of the district of Oyotún which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. Life in this district is quiet and the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

Margarita works offering hair cutting services in her beauty salon. Her business is located in her house, She has been working in this business for 16 years so she has great experience in the business and has regular clients who can provide her very good personal and work references. She is requesting this loan to buy a greater quantity of products for her business like shampoo, combs, hair dryers, chairs amongst others to use in her business. Doing this Margarita hopes to offer better service for her clients which will allow her to increase her income and in the end improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of products for her business like shampoo, combs, hair dryers, chairs amongst others to implement in her business.

loans.name: Ma Theresa

texts.en:
Ma Theresa sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to renovate her store and buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 28,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional products like groceries, merchandise and other items which she resells. 

Ma Theresa wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to help support the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise and products to display and sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, a 50-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Pasay City, Philippines, has run her processed and frozen meat retailing business for five years now; she makes a good income. She also sells direct-selling products and she also profits well from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide for their family.

What she basically does is buy processed meat products from wholesalers. Then, she sells them per piece or pack with a profit. Products can range from ham, hot dogs, processed pork, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low-selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Flordeliza is taking out a 17,000 PHP loan to buy additional frozen food products and orders for her customers. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more processed meats and direct-selling products which are necessary to increase her inventory.

Flordeliza hopes that her business will grow and continue to flourish. She also wants her children to have good lives in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen products and merchandise items to resell

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 28 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them. Ailyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF, to purchase more groceries to sell.  Ailyn has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.  In the future Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mesalimu operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall; she sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, egg, etc. Rosana has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, milk, coffee, egg, etc.

loans.name: Sophay

texts.en:
Sophay (pictured) is 44 years old, She lives at Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has two sons and three daughters. One works at a garment factory, one is attending school and the others are still young.
Sophay is a farmer and has been raising cows for two years, while her husband has been a construction worker and fisherman for eleven years. Sophay is applying for a loan to build the new house. Their current house is so old, he wants to get a new house for her children.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various supplies for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making cakes

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 49 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has managed her "kandingan eatery" (goat eatery) with her husband and has had this business for 2 years now. She has requested a loan to buy more spices and goat meat for her eatery. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years now. In the future, Anecita wants to renovate her eatery house in order to earn more.

loans.use: to buy more spices and goat meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow to increase his income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is a 62-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative Disud, Sindangan, industriously caring for her fishing activities. She is married and has five children. She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Remegia has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Remegia sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting 30,000 PHP from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for her children to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Sylvio

texts.en: Sylvio has a banana farm in Sindangan, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for his family. Sylvio makes it a point to earn a good income to sufficiently provide for his family. He recently needed a loan to buy fertilizers for his farming activities, which he borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Sylvio hopes that his business will continue and be able to supply bananas in the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farming activities

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a 40-year-old resident of Kilifi who runs a food stall as well as a motorbike transport service. He is a married father of five. His wife earns additional income.  Katana has been in these businesses for the last ten years with a great income. 

This marks his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance and expand his business. He will use the loan to purchase maize, beans, cooking fat, wheat flour and rice for his food stall.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

He hopes to have a good financially stable life in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, cooking fat, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is managing her eatery business in Molave. She mastered the business during the early years of her marriage. This business has been doing well for supporting the needs of her family. She has local customers, and sometimes would also accept catering for additional income. Recently, she loaned an amount to buy additional spices and goat meat for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and goat meat

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 62 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, reside en casa propia en el distrito de Buenos Aires que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 10 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes que brindan buenas referencias de el. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para incrementar su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones del lugar donde los cría, con esto Wilmer espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que va a mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 62 years old, partnered, and lives in his own house in the district of Buenos Aires which is located in the province of Morropón, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in the district is peaceful, its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary economic activities. 

He works raising and selling cattle, work that he has done for more than 10 years, having experience in this business and with customers who offer good references for him. The loan will be used to purchase a larger number of cattle to increase his business and to do some repairs on the place where he raises them. With this, Wilmer hopes to offer a greater variety of animals to his customers, which will improve his income level with the end of improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of cattle to increase his business and to do some repairs on the place where he raises them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of mangoes, bananas, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF, to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.  

She supplements this income with earnings from her charcoal retail business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Liezel dreams that one day will be able to save enough, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, spices, chips, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Rachel has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, spices, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Mary Sheryl

texts.en:
Mary Sheryl works hard to support her family. Mary Sheryl is married and has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Mary Sheryl requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more products of ready-to-wear items such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

Mary Sheryl has been in this business for two years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of ready-to-wear items such as shirts, t-shirts, pants, shorts, etc

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Josie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Josie is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like banana, cooking oil, flour etc for her food vending business. Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like banana, cooking oil, flour etc

loans.name: Nigesa

texts.en:
Nigesa is married with two children who attend school and are under her care. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For more than two years she has operated a clothing business, selling door-to-door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge with seasonality in her business. 

She has decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear for resale.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids wear for resale

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak, 34, lives in Gandzaqar village with her big family: her husband and two children, her in-laws and her husband's grandfather, who is 91 years old.
 
This whole family is involved in farming. They keep hens and 43 colonies of bees, from which they get high quality honey to sell in local markets.

The plot of land near their house is also rich in harvest. Corn, potatoes, plums, apples and pears are grown there. Arusyak and her family have managed to enrich their farm over the years, and their income from farming activities is very important for them.

This is Arusyak's first loan, so it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides for the land, to repair a truck and to purchase bee boxes

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 55 years old and has four children. Merlinda is married and has two children who are still in school. Merlinda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Merlinda has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Merlinda has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a cuidar a su hijo de 4 años de edad y a realizar los oficios del hogar, en su casa también vive su madre, pero de él solo depende su pareja e hijo.

Santiago, desde que ya no pudo continuar sus estudios, a los 14 años de edad, inicio a trabajar en la agricultura junto con sus padres, ya que sembraban 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca.- También, aprendió lo necesario para el manejo y el cuidado del ganado, porque trabajo como corralero en una hacienda.

Hoy en día Santiago, continua sembrando 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, a 900 metros de su casa, además, trabaja como jornalero y gracias al crédito anterior, inicio con la crianza de ganado, de esta forma obtiene ingresos para cubrir las necesidades  de su familia.

Con el préstamo Santiago, continuará invirtiendo en la compra de ganado.

Santiago, continua teniendo el sueño de tener un lugar propio donde vivir y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Santiago, 20 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, is partnered, and his partner works caring for their 4-year-old son and doing the household tasks. His mother also lives in their house, but only his partner and son depend on him. 

Santiago, since he couldn't continue with his schooling, at 14 years old began to work in agriculture with his parents. They planted 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of yucca. He also learned what he needed for raising and caring for livestock because he worked as a corral worker on a farm.

These days, Santiago continues planting 7,000 square meters of corn, 900 meters from his house. In addition, he works as a day laborer and, thanks to the previous loan, began raising livestock, in this way he gets income to cover his family's needs. With the loan, Santiago will continue investing in the purchase of livestock. Santiago continues having the dream of having his own place to live and building his house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 3 hijos y por el momento solo uno asiste a la escuela.

Ana, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 12 años, aprendió a realizar la siembra de cultivos de maíz y frijol y a criar ganado, gracias a que sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en estas actividades, actualmente le ayuda a su pareja a sembrar maíz y a criar ganado. 
De estas dos actividades dependen sus ingresos y es por eso que unen esfuerzos con su  pareja para sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto. 

Ana, sueño con vivir en mejores condiciones y tener una casa bonita.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and studied up to Grade 3. She is in a relationship and her partner is a farmer. They have 3 children and for now only one attends school. Ana started to work at the age of 12. She learned how to plant corn and beans and to raise cattle, thanks to her parents teaching her to do these things.

Today she helps her partner grow corn and raise cattle. Their income depends on these two activities and therefore they put their efforts together to get their family ahead. The loan will be invested in buying cattle. Ana dreams of living in better conditions and having a pretty house.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy animals to fatten and then sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various grocery products.

loans.name: Vey's Group Leader

texts.en:
Vey was selected to be group leader for a loan that is requested from Maxima. In the group, there are two members, and they are in a village in Keansvay district Kandal Province, Cambodia.

Vey (pictured) is 53 years old. He lives at Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia. He has two sons and one daughter. Two are policemen and the last one is a student.

Vey has been a farmer for 20 years in his experiences, while his wife is doing the same work. Vey would like to apply loan for a $350 loan to purchase fertilizer to do the farming.

Tha (shown in photo) is 42 years old. She lives at Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has three daughters. Two are garment factory workers and the last one is still young.

Tha has been a farmer for 12 years, while her husband is a traditional musician with 22 year of experience. She is applying for a $350 loan to purchase construction materials.

In the photo, Vey is the man on Mrs. Tha's left.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: Ilhom is an active student living in a remote district. He was born in 1994 and is single. Ilhom is an honest, capable, hardworking and kind person. He has a big family. He graduated high school with excellence. His father is in construction and his mother is in agriculture. He entered the university to get higher education and become a professional. Every day after classes and on weekends, he works as a rental worker and tries to earn money for his rent and education. Ilhom unfortunately could not cover his University tuition fees from earned money.  He is asking for financial support from the KIVA project, to make a payment of his university fee. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to make a payment of his studies

loans.name: Wediyan

texts.en:
Wediyan is a 34-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her husband, the main provider for the family. She is hardly working and trying her best to be as helpful as she can. 

She started her own job at an early age. She opened a beauty salon in her house when she was 25 years old. She has her loyal customers and is happy with the results that she has attained so far. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate her salon. With this investment, she will be able to serve her customers better. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to renovate her salon

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
From Molave, Margie earns a living through her clothing sales. She strives to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the business odds with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. 

Margie hopes to live comfortably with her children and that they will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.en:
In 2011, Arcadio learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. As a farmer in Dumingag, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. 

To this day, Arcadio  feels he owes his good fortune to the cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. He wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice to neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

location.town: Molave - San Pablo, Dumingag,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Sindangan. She is 60 years old and is a widow with six adult-age children. In 2010, Teresita applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, Teresita asked for financial assistance of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items for her store. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. 

She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is 30 years old and resides at Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and is blessed with two school-age children. She joined PMPC on June 10, 2011 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op.

Recently, she is accessing her fourth loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities. She is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 22-year-old second-hand clothes dealer in Voi, Kenya. She is a single lady who has been in this business for the last one year and makes profits.

This marks her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the requested loan to purchase additional bales of second-hand clothes for sale, and the anticipated profits will be used to repay her loan and add more bales. 

She hopes to be a wholesale supplier of second-hand clothing, as well as new clothes, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, five of whom are in school, Laura works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Laura is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her business.

Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional trays of eggs to sell for her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58 years old, married and has four children.

Nenita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenita has been in her business for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cecil is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Cecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 28 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell native products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional native products such as brooms, baskets, etc.

Irene has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional native products such as brooms, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Sharo Scarleth

texts.es:
Carismática, versátil, responsable, y creativa, son algunas de las cualidades de Sharo, una joven estudiante de contabilidad pública y finanzas, y también de cosmetología y estética. Desde pequeña siempre le gustaban los números, pero también,  le gustaba practicar haciéndoles peinados a sus amigas. Así que cuando creció, decidió especializarse en esas dos áreas.
 Ahora, ella solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora portátil,  porque esta es la herramienta principal para desarrollarse en su profesión.  Cabe destacar, que con la laptop podrá realizar sus trabajos universitarios, hacer investigaciones, y también podrá aprender tips de bellezas online. Sharo desea finalizar sus estudios con éxito y disfrutar de sus dos profesiones al máximo.
texts.en:
Charismatic, versatile, responsible, and creative, are some of Sharo's qualities. She is a young student in public accounting and finance and also in cosmetology and beauty. Since she was little, she has always liked numbers, but also she liked to practice doing her friends' hair. So, when she grew up, she decided to train in both of those areas.

Now, she is asking for a loan to purchase a laptop, because this is the primary tool to develop herself in her profession. It should be noted that with a laptop, she will be able to do her university work, do research, and also learn beauty tips online. Sharo wants to finish her program successfully and enjoy her two professions to the maximum.

loans.use: to purchase la laptop computer.

loans.name: Napoleón Enrique

texts.es:
Napoleón, de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y su esposa es comerciante y no tiene hijos.

Napoleón, es un hombre con muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante con su esposa, como no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, inicio a trabajar a la edad de 13 años, su trabajo fue de zapatero, gracias a un tío que sabía este oficio, el segundo oficio que aprendió fue el de carpintero y actualmente tiene 15 años de estar trabajando en una panadería. 

El crédito será invertido para comprar lámina para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, el cual está muy dañado y en época lluviosa, hay muchas filtraciones en su casa.

Napoleón, sueña con tener su propia panadería, es por eso que se está esforzando mucho, para conseguir su sueño.
texts.en:
Napoleon is 54 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study. He is married and his wife is a merchant; they do not have children. Napoleon is a man with many desires to improve and get ahead with his wife. As he didn't have the opportunity to study, he began working at the age of 13. His job was as a shoemaker, thanks to an uncle who knew this profession. The second profession that he learned was that of a carpenter, and he currently has been working in a bakery for 15 years.

The loan will be used to buy laminate to replace the roof of his home, which is very damaged and has many leaks in the rainy season. Napoleon dreams of having his own bakery, and that is why he is working so hard; so he can achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy laminate to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Nelly Yamileth

texts.es:
Nelly, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja es comerciante de ropa, tienen 3 hijos y dos de ellos asisten a la escuela.

Nelly, es una mujer trabajadora y durante muchos años se ha esforzado para ayudar a su familia, es por eso que ha trabajado como cajera en un restaurante, también trabajo como empleada doméstica.- Hace 7 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de tortillas, con el cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo, con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito será para comprar maíz para hacer las tortillas, de esta forma podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

Nelly, sueña con poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y que puedan preparase academicamente.
texts.en:
Nelly is 31 years old and studied through 9th grade.  She lives with her partner, who sells clothing, and they have three children, two of whom attend school. 

Nelly is a hard-working woman and during many years she has pushed herself to help her family.  For this reason she has worked as a cashier in a restaurant, and also as a maid.  Seven years ago she began her own business selling tortillas, which has allowed her to help her husband with household expenses and help her family move ahead.  

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase corn for making tortillas.  In this way she will be able to grow her business.  

Nelly dreams of being able to help her children get ahead and allowing them to prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Eugenio Antonio

texts.es:
Eugenio, de 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y tienen 6 hijos.

Eugenio, trabaja desde la edad de los 12 años, dado que no pudo estudiar, su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, es así que toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en esta actividad.- Actualmente, siembra maíz y cría ganado de repasto, de esta forma ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 	

Eugenio, invertirá el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto, de esta forma invertirá en una de las actividades en las cuales posee mucha experiencia.

El sueño de Eugenio, es seguir trabajando en la agricultura y tener más ganado de crianza.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 46 years old, never had the opportunity to go to school. He is partnered and his partner works in agriculture and they have 6 children. 

Eugenio has worked since the age of 12, given that he couldn't go to school. His father taught him to work in agriculture, and in this way he has spent his whole life working in this field. Currently, he grows corn and raises beef cattle, in this way he has managed to get his family ahead.

Eugenio will invest the loan to purchase beef cattle, in this way he will invest in one of the jobs in which he has a lot of experience.

Eugenio's dream is to continue working in agriculture and to have more cattle to raise.

loans.use: to purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Maurice's Group

texts.en:
Maurice, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 57 years old, married and has 9 children.

Maurice likes to think of himself as a very reliable person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learnt a lot from the farming trainings. Maurice plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Maurice’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land. With this loan, three members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvest.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a 38-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Isaac has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Isaac described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Isaac’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Masan

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 40 ans, Masan est une femme mère de cinq enfants. Masan habite à Tokoin et vend des garnitures pour bébé dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Masan s’approvisionne une fois par mois chez des fournisseurs au ghana. Pour commander des lots de garniture, Masan demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants
texts.en:
Married and forty years old, Masan is a woman and mother of five children. She lives in Tokoin and sells diapers in the neighborhood to generate the necessary revenues for her family's well-being.

To reach her goals, Masan procures her supplies monthly from suppliers in Ghana. To order diaper packages, Masan is requesting this loan. Making her purchase will allow her to have revenues and to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: to buy twenty-six packages of diapers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna, 34, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children.

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of rice farmland that is located in her community. So far, she has been in this type of business for fifteen years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD 3.00 per day.

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of travelling.

She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kanata Colca Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 41 años de edad, viuda, tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 16, 19 y 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de juguetes de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, fuerte, solidaria, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes lugares de la zona central; un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado, con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
Juana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste de negro). Su vida la comparte con sus hijas que trabajan y estudian, viven en un cuarto propio que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su deseo por ayudar a sus hijas a emprender sus propios negocios la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de bisutería, venta de comida, mantenimiento a pc, venta de ropa de segunda mano, comercio de cereales, venta de fruta y comercio de ropa interior, para solicitar un préstamo para ampliar sus actividades y mejorar sus ingresos. Su negocio es la venta de juguetes de segunda mano; juguetes para baño, para bebés, para niñas, para niños, toda variedad de juguetes. “los juguetes infantiles, son caros y tienen una duración limitada, por eso es importante conocer si vale la pena comprarlos nuevos o comprarlos de ocasión...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es el costo bajo de sus productos, la desventaja es el transporte porque vende de forma ambulante. Su sueño es tener otro cuarto para que la familia viva más cómoda, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de juguetes de segunda mano para ofertar mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de juguetes de segunda mano para ofertar mayor variedad e iniciar a sus hijas en el comercio.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman 41 years of age, widowed, she has three daughters aged 16, 19 and 22. Her business is the sale of second-hand toys. She is a good mother, enterprising, strong, supportive, patient, responsible and hardworking. She carries out her business on foot in different places of the central zone; an area characterized by trade in all of the areas, and that houses universities, public offices and private businesses that live side by side. It's of temperate climate, with an ambient temperature that varies during the day from 14-24 degrees celsius.

Juana has browned skin, long black hair that she has tied up, brown eyes, short stature, robust physical complexion. Her mother tongue is Quechua that she speaks with the family; she speaks Spanish because of the culture in general and because of the business that the does. (She is the first on the left, dressed in black).

She shares her life with her daughters who work and study. They live in their own room that has electric energy and well water; it doesn't have sewage. She wishes to help her daughters start their own businesses. She took the lead of a bank of people with businesses like: sale of costume jewelry, sale of food, maintenance, sale of second-hand clothing, trade of cereals, sale of fruit and trade of underwear in order to apply for a loan to grow their activities and increase their incomes.

Her business is the sale of second-hand toys: toys for the bathroom, for babies, for boys and girls; all variety of toys. "Children's toys are expensive and they have a limited duration, this is why it's important to know if it's worth buying them new or buying them on occasion," she comments. The advantage of her business is the low cost of her products, the disadvantage is the transportation because she sells on foot. 

Her dream is to have another room so that the family can live more comfortably. She wishes to make the purchase of a variety of second-hand toys to offer a better variety and increase her sales. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the seven years that she's been carrying out this activity. It's for these reasons that Juana is applying for a loan for the purchase of a variety of second-hand toys: to offer more variety and start her daughters in the trade.

loans.use: to buy a variety of second-hand toys to offer a better variety and start her daughters in business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 40 años de edad soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es la panadería.
Él es una persona emprendedora, activa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ área caracterizada por situarse sobre la ladera este de la ciudad, de calles pendientes muy empinadas. Los orígenes de sus pobladores son; campesinos aymaras que pelearon por la liberación del yugo español y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados, durante todo el año.
Carlos es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. su vida la comparte en casa de sus padres y con su hermana, viven en una casa propia de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la panadería y los panes más comunes son; la marraqueta (Es el pan popular; horneado sin manteca y crocante), las Kaukas (Panecillos de harina blanca, se lo hornea doblado), las sarnitas (de forma redonda de masa fina y livianas, con queso desmenuzado) y otros. Actividad que realiza de lunes a domingo por la madrugada. “a las 5y30 de la madrugada los repartidores hacen cola esperando a que salgan las canastas con pan recién horneado…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y una panadería grande. Él desea realizar el mantenimiento de su panadería mediante el vaciado de la loza del piso para hornear en mejores condiciones. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Carlos solicita un préstamo para vaciar la loza del piso con cemento para hornear en mejores condiciones higiénicas
texts.en:
Carlos is a 40 year old single man without children. His business is a bakery. He is an enterprising person, active, patient, responsible and very hard-working. His business takes place in the ‘Pampahasi’ neighborhood, an area characterized by being on the slopes of the city with steep hilly streets. The origin of the inhabitants were Aymara peasants who fought against the Spanish rule and used the area as trenches. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 2 to 14 degrees Celsius.

Carlos is dark-skinned, with short black hair, dark eyes and this height and build. His native tongue is Aymara and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for his business. He shares his life in his parents house along with his sister. They live in their own family house built of brick and cement which has running water, electricity and sewage.

His business is a bakery and his most common breads are the Marraqueta (popular bread, baked without lard and crispy), Kaukas (bread made from white flour that is baked folded), Sarnitas (round using fine light flour and grated cheese) and others. He works from Monday to Sunday in the morning. "at 5:30 in the morning the distributors are lined up waiting for the baskets of recently baked bread" he commented.

His dream is to have his own house and a large bakery. He wants to undertake maintenance on his bakery, by laying tile on the floor to have better baking conditions. This is his second loan with the institution in the 5 years he has been in business independently. For these reasons Carlos is requesting a loan to lay the floor in tiles to bake in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to cover the floor with tiles to bake in better sanitary conditions.

loans.name: Los Palacios Group

texts.es: Con el objetivo de capitalizar más sus negocios y expandir sus ventas, solicitan por segunda ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM el grupo solidario “Los Palacios”, que es coordinado por Yacela una mujer que desde muy joven aprendió los oficios de comercializar especies y condimentos, y quien a sus diecisiete realizó un préstamo a un familiar con el objetivo de invertir e independizarse, ahora a sus 27 años de edad continua ofreciendo estos productos en las calles de la capital, y solicita el financiamiento de ADIM para invertir en manzanilla, canela, algodón, achiote, mostaza, salsa inglesa, clavo de olor, pimienta de chapa, etc., ya que el primer financiamiento le permitió invertir en más capital de trabajo. El resto de los integrantes son, Yerald un joven que tiene la edad de 23 años y comercializa especies en la ciudad de Granada desde hace tres años, Irma de 32 años de edad y con una experiencia de diez años en la comercialización de especies en los barrios de la capital, y Heyling una joven que tiene la edad 19 años y ofrece el servicio de elaborar y vender comida (fritanga) en su domicilio, este negocio lo inicio hace dos años.
texts.en:
With the goal of capitalizing their businesses and expanding sales, this group is asking for a second loan from Kiva field partner ADIM. The communal banking group is called "The Palaces" and it is coordinated by Yacela.  She is a woman who from the time she was very young learned the task of selling spices and condiments.  At the age of 17 she received a loan from a family member in order to invest and become independent in her business.  She is now 27 years old and continues offering her products on the streets of the capital.  She is asking for a loan from ADIM in order to invest in the purchase of chamomile, cinnamon, cotton, achiote, mustard, ketchup, cloves, peppers, etc.  Her first investment allowed her to invest in more capital for her work.  

The other group members are Yerald, a young 23 year old man who sells spices in the city of Granada and has been working in this field for 3 years; Irma, a 32 year old woman with ten years of experience selling spices in the neighborhoods around the capital; and Heyling, a young 19 year old woman who makes and sells food (fritanga) in her home.  She began the business two years ago.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of chamomile, cinnamon, cotton, achiote, mustard, ketchup, cloves, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Cresente

texts.en:
Cresente thought he was in the right place when he joined Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he can access financial assistance for his chosen business.

Cresente has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, he availed himself of a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his chosen business. Cresente wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 29 years old and married. She has been blessed with three children. She has been a farmer for four years now and has been growing wheat and maize.

She is taking her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce.

She intends to use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children and expand her current business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful farming business and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for use on her farm so she can get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old, married and is blessed with three children. She has been a farmer for the last 15 years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000.
