She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to boost her milk production and be able to buy fertilizers and seeds for use in her farm. 

She plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to become a large-scale farmer in the region.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to boost her milk production for sale, and buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee seis reses de su propiedad, tiene sembrado tres Has de inverna donde cría su ganado, su esposa le apoya en esta labor elaborando artesanalmente quesillos, queso fresco, que lo comercializa en el mercado de su distrito son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan y cuentan con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona.

José Manuel ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de terneras para posteriormente aumentar la producción de ganado lechero, generando mayores ingresos para su familia y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 42, lives along with his wife and children in a rural zone of the Santo Tomás district, a community that works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry. It's located in the Cutervo Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

He works raising and selling beef cattle. He owns six cattle that are his property. He has planted three winter pastures where he can raise his cattle. His wife supports him in this labor, making artisanal cheeses and fresh cheese which she sells in the market of their district. They are a united family who push themselves in the work that they carry out. They have good personal and work references in the area.

José Manuel has applied for a loan to purchase cattle to later increase the production of dairy cattle, generating more income for his family and, therefore, he will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves to later increase the production of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57 years old, married to Loice, and blessed with six children, ages between 28 and 13 years. He has been a bread distributor in the market for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to educate his children to higher levels of education.

He plans to use his gained profits to repay the loan and expand his business through buying and selling more stock of bread in the market.

His hope is to be financially stable and be a dominant supplier in the market.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 43 years old, married to Mogaka ,and together they are blessed with five children of ages between 20 and 10 years old. She is a farmer, a business she has done for the last seven years, and earns KES 10,000 per month.

Margaret has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy bales of second-hand clothes and expand her farming. 

She hopes to be a wholesale supplier of second-hand clothes in future.

loans.use: To buy a cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Ruben Fernando

texts.es:
Ruben tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con sus padres y hermano en la provincia de Lagunas que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente sincera y amable, dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como jornalero agrícola por su zona de residencia y alrededores, realiza esta actividad desde hace 03 años, contando con experiencia en este negocio. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de sus actuales herramientas que se encuentran en mal estado, con esto Ruben espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que va a generarle mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruben is 21 years old, single, he lives in the family house of his parents and brother in the Lagunas province, which is found located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in the northern coast of Peru. He lives in a community inhabited by sincere and friendly people, dedicated mainly to agriculture and animal husbandry.

He works providing services as an agricultural day laborer by the area of his residence and surrounding areas. He has been doing this activity for three years, having experience in this business. He will utilize the loan for the purchase of tools to implement his business like for carrying out repairs and maintenance of his current tools which are found in a bad state. With this, Ruben hopes to offer a better service to his clients which will generate him more income and will permit him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools in order to make repairs and maintenance to his current tools that are found in a bad state.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with three children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for more than 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her work and buy more products to sell

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a 24-year-old young woman from Gori city. She lives with her husband, who has a stable job and gets a fixed salary. Lela married at an early age and wasn’t able to get education, and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment.

She started a trading business with clothing at the local market and was generating a small income. Now she needs financial support to re-start her business and open a store. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, a Startup Program that gives poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

With the loan, Lela will renovate the space that she had already found, purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices, and sell it with price mark-ups. Due to her nice and kind attitude toward clients, Lela already has a list of loyal customers and will run her trading business in a more profitable way, as the wide assortment and more comfortable space will satisfy all her customers’ needs.

Lela will be very grateful for giving her a chance to re-start her business and become financially independent. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to re-start her trading business and open a store.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices for her business.

Mary Joy has been in this business for two years. Mary Joy earns more income from a general store.

Mary Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables and spices

loans.name: Fátima Esmeralda

texts.es:
Fátima, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está casada y su esposo es albañil y le ayuda en la agricultura, tienen 6 hijos, de ellos solamente dos están estudiando.

Fátima, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de cultivos, este oficio fue enseñado por sus padres, actualmente siembra maíz y frijol.- Ademas, tiene 1 año de estar trabajando en la crianza de ganado, de estas dos actividades obtiene ingresos para salir adelante.  

El crédito sera invertido para comprar ganado, de esta forma se contribuye a que Fátima pueda continuar trabajando, en las actividades que tiene experiencia.

Fátima, mantiene su sueño de tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 41 years old and studied through the eighth grade. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer, and he helps her with the farming. They have six children, of which only two are in school.

For her entire life, Fátima has worked planting crops. She was taught this profession by her parents. She currently has planted corn and beans. She has also been working to raise cattle for one year. From these activities she earns income to get ahead.

The loan will be used to buy cattle, and this will support Fátima so she can continue working in the fields where she has experience. Fátima holds onto the dream of having a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and syrups to make shaved ice and buy the necessary supplies to make the business of his son larger who sells hot dog buns.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa trabaja 15 días en una venta de ropa, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad y ya asiste a la escuela.

Santos, trabaja desde la edad de los 13 años, su primer oficio fue en la agricultura, ya que su padre le enseño a realizar la siembra de cultivos de maíz y frijol.- Además, aprendió el oficio de albañilería, es de esta forma que ha logrado salir adelante.- Actualmente, continua trabajando en estas dos actividades, con el objetivo de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Gracias al crédito anterior logró producir 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz.- Con este nuevo crédito comprará insumos agrícolas, ya que este año quiere sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz.

El sueño de Santos, sigue siendo el de tener un terreno propio y comprar ganado de repasto.
texts.en:
Santos is 27 years old and studied up to Grade 9. He is married and his wife works selling clothing. He has a 5 year old son who goes to school. Santos has worked since the age of 13. His first work was in agriculture as his father taught him to grow corn and beans. He also learned to be a bricklayer and in this way he has manged to get ahead.

Currently he continues to work in these two activities with the goal of providing a better quality of living for his family. Thanks to his last loan he managed to produce 7000 square meters of corn. With this new loan he will buy agricultural inputs as this year he wants to plant 14,000 square meters of corn. Santos' dream is to have his own property and to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds and pay for labor to cultivate 7000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Domitila Antonia

texts.es:
Domitila, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, tiene dos hijos y está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor.

Domitila, ha trabajado en la agricultura desde los 7 años de edad, ya que sus padre fueron agricultores, gracias a que aprendió esta actividad, ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.- Actualmente, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz, ahora trabaja en conjunto con su esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler del terreno, porque sembrará 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz.   

El sueño de Domitila, es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ademas le gustaría criar ganado bovino.
texts.en:
24-year old Domtila has a grade six education. She has two children, is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has worked in agriculture since she was seven years old since her parents were farmers so it is thanks to them that she was able to learn about farming. Domtila has managed to help her children get ahead.

Currently she grows maize on a 7,000 m2 plot of land; her husband helps her. The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies and pay rent for the land.

Domtila’s dream is to improved the living conditions of her family. She would also like to raise cattle.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and pay rent for the land where she grows 7,000 m2 of maize

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Yawavi vit à Cassablanca et est âgée de 39 ans. Mariée, Yawavi est mère de trois enfants et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser leur éducation. Yawavi vend des fruits en se promenant dans son quartier et ses environs pour avoir son revenu pour leur subsistance. Yawavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs d’orange, de bananes et des cartons de pommes Yawavi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité nécessaire.
texts.en:
Yawavi lives in Cassablanca and is 39 years old. She is married and a mother of three. She works energetically to make sure her children get an education.

Yawavi sells fruits itinerantly in her neighborhood and nearby areas to make the money that ensures their subsistence. Yawavi procures her supplies twice monthly from the market.

To order bags of oranges and bananas as well as boxes of apples, Yawavi is requesting this loan which will allow her to make her purchase and generate sufficient revenues.

loans.use: to buy one bag of oranges, three baskets of banana, and one box of apples.

loans.name: Indiana Del Carmen

texts.es: INDIANA DEL CARMEN: Es una joven cordial de 26 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Habita en casa de sus padres, la cual es compartida por 6 personas. Con el propósito de tener su vivienda e irla construyendo con gran esfuerzo poco a poco, solicita su primer financiamiento para  comprar su terreno y algunos materiales de construcción: Postes de cemento, madera. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda, con las condiciones adecuadas, para brindarle mayor seguridad a su pequeño.
texts.en: Indiana del Carmen is a cordial young woman of 26 years. She is a single mother of a small son, 3 years old. She lives in the house of her parents, which is shared by 6 people. With the purpose of having her home and going about constructing it with great effort little by little, she is applying for her first loan to buy her land and some construction materials: cement posts, wood. Her dream is to have her own home, with adequate conditions, to provide better security to her little one.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man, aged 37 years, with five children who are 10, 9, 6, 3 and one year old. He lives in a rural area with his family and other two dependents who are relatives. Three of his children are attending school. He deals in the transport business and agriculture. He works seven days a week and each day he works for 12 hours.

He started his business in 1992 with the aim of getting money to be able to solve some problems at home. He has acquired this loan facility in order to service his vehicle for business. This will help him cover longer distances.

His clients are traders from surrounding towns who transport their products to the city and his dream is to enlarge his business by buying two other motor vehicles but his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital.

He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To pay for servicing  his motorvehicle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful that she was previously granted a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to purchase various grocery items and ready-to-wear clothes to sell in her general store. With her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet the family's daily living expenses. 

She is now into direct sales for personal products. She would like to apply for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more personal products, such as lotions, body powders, cosmetics, underwear and towels, to fill several orders from her customers. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that she will receive, for it will surely help fund the family's everyday personal and household needs and pay for the education of her children.

Rebecca dreams of having her own store, where she can display her items to attract more clients. She aims to give her children the best education to afford them better opportunities in the future. 

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and skin products, underwear and towels to sell.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing and caring to harvesting and earning income as well. She has supported her husband doing this type of work.  

As she does with farming, she has nurtured her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to produce healthier, heavier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, she hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate, which will potentially add to the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to produce healthier, heavier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has improved her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 13,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Emily hopes for protection in their everyday work and good health for her family. She dreams to give them a good life through all her hard work in business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Maelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, paints, etc. for her motorcycle transport business.

Maelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, paints, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Gloria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero por falta de oportunidades laborales se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, es madre soltera de un niño.

Ana, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, durante la mañana junto a sus padres.

Ana, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono y pesticidas para los cultivos, que espera sea una buena producción de maíz

Ana, sueña con colocar una tienda de granos básicos, ya que en los alrededores de donde vive, no hay tiendas.
texts.en:
26-year old Ana has graduated from high school but because there were no work opportunities, she works in agriculture and animal raising. She is a single mother with one child. She farms her land in the mornings alongside her parents.

Ana is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, compost, and pesticides for her land and hopes to have a good crop of maize.
She hopes one day to open a small store selling basic grains as there are no stores in the area where she lives.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies like seeds, compost, and pesticides for her fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain his sales and increase his working capital.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo has a collection of ornamental garden plants. He finds pleasure in doing his gardening activities and earning income for his family as well. 

As a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, he is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell. In the future, Danilo wishes to become the supplier of flowers in neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has mastered her hog-raising business in Tudela and this is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. Her lowest point was when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, Helen was truly grateful for the ability to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. She maintains her membership with PMPC in the same way she takes care of her business.

Helen is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan with PMPC to build sanitary concrete pigs pens to care for the environment. She wants to maintain her PMPC membership in good standing so she can always apply for any financing needs.

loans.use: build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina sends you her thanks for your generosity. She runs a general store and her previous loan strengthened her business. She used it to purchase additional groceries to increase her inventory. Angelina’s loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and pay her expenses. 

Angelina is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries, toiletries, and beverages. She is very positive that she would improve her business with her loan. Angelina’s customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase on sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will help her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, Angelina could sustain the needs of her family. She will use the profit from her loan to support the educational expenses of her nieces and nephews. She desires for them to have good life in the future. Angelina meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dinah has successfully paid back her previous loans with and is requesting this new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Dinah's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines.

Emelinda is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of ginger to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Lydia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, plant food, fertilizers, and other items to assist her coffee plants.

loans.name: Ana Carlina

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer grandiosa, talentosa, responsable, sabe buscar su horizonte, es muy aterrizada y consciente de sus acciones, ella es una madre de 51 años de edad cabeza de familia de las zonas rurales de Antioquia, vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad, un lugar muy afectado por la desigualdad, la falta de oportunidades, y la inseguridad pero ella sigue en pie en su negocio de venta de ropa, carne y pollos, actividad que inicio por necesidad económica ante la ausencia de su esposo pues se separó de él, con su esposo tuvo tres hijos de 12, 4 y 22 años de edad, todos ellos depende de ella y se siente orgullosos de tener una madre con el carácter suficiente parta ejercer el papal tanto de mamá como de papá.
Ana presenta un incoveniente y es que para comprar el surtido de ropa debe desplazarse hasta la ciudad de medellin y esto pro costos lo hace periódicamente.
Analizando sus dificultades Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo el monto es justificado en:
•	Transporte (tanto de desplazamiento como de mercancía
•	Surtido de ropa para hombre y dama que trae directamente de Medellín
•	Comprar surtido de carne
•	Comprar 20 pollos

Con estos implementos tendrá una muy buena base para trabajar y seguir buscando un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a impressive woman. Talented and responsible, she knows how to broaden her horizons. She is very grounded and aware of her actions.

At 51, she is a mother of three and the head of her household. She lives in a rural zone of Antioquia, far from the city, in an area affected by inequality, lack of opportunity, and a climate of insecurity. Nonetheless, she keeps her business going, selling clothing, beef, and chicken. This is work that she started out of necessity after her husband's absence, when they separated. 

With her husband she had three children now aged 22, 12 and four, all dependent on her and proud to have a parent who can fill both the mother and father roles for them.

Ana's challenge is that, in order to buy her stocks of clothing merchandise, she needs to travel to the city of Medellin, an expense that she incurs periodically. 

Analyzing her needs, she is requesting a loan with the amount justified to cover:
the transport, both personal and for the merchandise,
the purchase of an assortment of men's and women's clothing that she will bring directly from Medellin,
the purchase of an assortment of beef, and
the purchase 20 chickens.

With these supplies she will have an excellent base for her work, and she will continue seeking to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for transport to/from Medellin, as well as to buy her merchandise there, including an assortment of clothing, beef, and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy papayas, oranges, mandarin oranges, pineapples, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary, 31, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. Thary sells traditional medicine and she earns, on average, 4 USD per day. Her husband, Orn, 29, is a cassava farmer who earns 4 USD each day. Thary lacks money to buy farm supplies for her farmland for this farming season. 

Thary is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, seed, and insecticide. She will use her loan to continue her family’s farming business. Thary is thankful to lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: El Granjero De Cofradia Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario “El Granjero de Cofradía” lo integran tres mujeres y un varón que solicitan por segunda ocasión el financiamiento para su negocio e incrementar el capital de trabajo de cada uno en sus negocios, quien lo coordina es Karen una mujer de 27 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 9 años, quienes han sido su mayor fuerza para su superación, ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de segunda y cosméticos, ella los comercializa en su comunidad desde hace dos años y gracias al financiamiento obtenido logró aumentar los productos ofrecidos lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos e invertir en paca de ropa y útiles deportivos, ya que es uno de los productos que mayor demanda tiene. El resto de los integrantes son, Daniela una joven que a sus 18 años ha dedicado dos años de su vida a la comercialización de ropa en su comunidad, Joselin que tiene la edad de 20 años y se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad por más de un años, y Darwin que tiene la edad de 25 años su negocio es la crianza de cerdo y pollo en su domicilio, luego los comercializa en el mercado.
texts.en: The members of the El Granjero de Cofradía community bank, three women and one man, are applying for a second round of funding.  They will use the new funds to finance and build working capital for their businesses.  The group's coordinator, Karen, 27, and her partner have two children, 9- and 5-years old and she says that they are the reason that she works so hard to get ahead.  Karen has a retail business, selling used clothing and cosmetics.  She has operated the business for two years and credits bank loans for helping her to broaden the range of merchandise she sells.  She wants to continue expanding her business and will use this round of funding to stock her business with used clothing and sports equipment, the merchandise most in demand among her customers.  The other members of the group are: Daniela, 18, who has operated a clothing sales business here for two years; Joselin, 20, who has operated a clothing and cosmetics sales business here for more than a year; and Darwin, 25, who raises and sells pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to stock her used clothing business.

loans.name: Agua Es Vida Group

texts.es: Con el objetivo de incrementar el capital de sus negocios y así mejorar el nivel de vida de sus familias, se unieron tres mujeres y un varón para conformar un grupo solidario al que llamaron “Agua de Vida” y así solicitar por primera ocasión el financiamiento para sus negocios, es coordinado por la joven Alda que tiene la edad de 24 años y ha dedicado los últimos años de su vida a la compra-venta de cosecha para comercializar dichos productos en el mercado de Masaya, asegura que el estar soltera le permite dedicarle más tiempo a su negocio, el financiamiento lo solicita para invertir en mandarinas, mangos y limones, se ha propuesto incrementar los productos ofrecidos. El resto de los integrantes son, Petrona una señora que a sus 61 años es un ejemplo de superación ella es propietaria de una pulpería, además se dedica al destace de cerdo en su vivienda, negocio que ha logrado mantener por veinte años, José un señor de 58 años de edad, quien se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de Masaya además le vende a pobladores del país de Hondura, y Socorro que a sus 32 años ha dedicado ocho años al destace de cerdo en su domicilio.
texts.en: The members of the Agua de Vida community bank, three women and one man, started their group to support each other's efforts to improve the lives of their families.  This is the group's first round of funding and they will use the funds to build working capital.  The group's coordinator, Alda, 24, has operated a produce sales business in the market at Masaya for several years and says that being single has allowed her to spend more time building her business.  She will use her share of the loan to broaden the range of fruits she sells, adding mandarins, mangoes and lemons.  The other members of the group are: Petrona, 61, who has operated a corner grocery and pig-butchering business for 20 years; Jose, 58, who operates a food-sales business at the Masaya market and in nearby Honduras; and Socorro, 32, who has operated a pig-butchering business for 8 years.

loans.use: to stock her fruits & vegetables business.

loans.name: Liz Beth

texts.en:
Liz Beth is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 1 year old. She engages in buying and selling of repossessed motorcycle units. She has been in that kind of business for a year now. Her husband has small earnings which are able to help defray the family's daily expenses. 

She has requested a loan to buy more units of motorcycles and capital start-up for RTW (ready to wear) business. These will probably improve her daily income and allow her to handle her finances. With these, she will be able to provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions. 

In the future, Liz Beth is determined to handle her current business to be successful and she is hoping to rent a stall for her RTW (ready to wear) business.

loans.use: to buy more units of motorcycle and capital start-up for RTW (ready to wear) business

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia did not hesitate to become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) after hearing about all of its benefits and financial services. She has tried her luck as a farmer and feels she owes her success to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Virgenia is requesting a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Her loan will give her farming income a big boost. In the future, she is seeking better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga. Ester is a farmer and grows vegetable and root crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase 2 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Ester has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ester hopes to harvest more vegetables and root crops.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 31 years old, married to Polycarp, and they are blessed with two children, aged 3 and 1 years old. She has been farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 8,200 per month and it has been profitable.

Linet has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her farming.

Her future hopes are to expand her farming and make more income to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 56 years old, married to Mellen, and they are blessed with eight children with ages between 33 and 17 years. He has been a farmer for the last 17 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Albert has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to meet his clients' expectations and demand for milk. 

He plans to use the profits generated to repay his loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to meet his clients' expectations and demand for milk.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is 30 years old, married to Charles, and blessed with one child, aged 2 years. She has been farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 4,500 per month.

Wilkister has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk to her clients. She plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and build rental houses for more income gain.

She hopes to have many rental estates in the area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk to her clients.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She runs a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines and also earns additional income pig fattening and selling bamboo. Jenelyn has sustained her business activities with her three previous loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva.

Jenelyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 38 years old and married with two children. For the past four years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns income from selling pre-paid mobile load. Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid 10 previous loans from NWTF.

Jenny is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other products. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a business selling firewood in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising ducks.  Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF.

Helen is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood and charcoal to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is very pleased with his experience at SEF as a responsible borrower. This is his third loan, which he asks to pay for his third-year university tuition.

Narek hopes for lenders' support one more time, ensuring monthly on-time payments.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Delia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo, nails, paints, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo, nails, paints, etc.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Judith, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 49 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and has one child.

Judith is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Judith says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Judith will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Nebo's Group

texts.en:
Nebo is a 52-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Nebo has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Nebo described his harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar-powered light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Nebo’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar-powered lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar-powered light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “VIRGEN INMACULADA” una de ellas es la Sra. Carmen   de 33 años casada   y con 3 hijos, la Sra. Carmen  se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de abarrotes en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Carmen  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Carmen   trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (Arroz, leche, golosinas, ETC)y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Carmen se encuentra parada y se le distingue con una blusa color verde agua , se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: The five members of the VIRGEN INMACULADA community operate different retail businesses.  One member, Sra. Carmen, 33, is married and has 3 children.  She has operated a small corner grocery for 3 years and works every day in order to support her family and pay her children's school expenses.  Her earnings from the business have helped her cover both school expenses for her children and improvements to the family house.  She says that she will go on working hard for her children because she wants them to be able to take paid, professional jobs in the future.  Sra. Carmen will use this loan to stock her grocery with the merchandise she sells: rice, dairy, snacks, etc.  In the photo, Sra. Carmen is wearing an aqua-colored blouse.  She sends her warmest thanks to supporters of Kiva and Edaprospo for their help and the opportunities this loan provides.

loans.use: to purchase legumes for her grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare a room to rent, which will allow them to offer better living conditions to their tenant.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is a 30-year-old Lebanese woman with two school aged-children. She has worked as a private teacher since 2008 to provide her family with additional financial support. She loves her profession and always gives the best education she can. She visits her customers at their places since she will not be able to receive this number of students in her house. 

Today she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a car for her business. 

Aliya states that the car will facilitate her transportation and she will access her students on time. She hopes to receive more students with the coming school season and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her business

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 42 years old and married. He has four children attending school. He is raising his family in a rural community and makes their living through farming.

Due to the hardships of living, he aspires to improve his farming business to increase his production and income to sustain his family's necessities. Due to capital insufficiency, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for rice production.

A hard working father, Romeo hopes that someday he will improve his farming business as well as his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for rice production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda, 48 years old, lives in Tudela. She was gifted with three children. Nilda and her husband are both farmers. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member has always helped her husband in plowing the rice field and planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities.

In need of additional working capital, Nilda decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 7,000 to buy farm and garden fertilizer and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Nilda is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to arrange a decent house someday for her family and to live comfortably with them.

loans.use: to buy farm and garden fertilizer and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has mastered her skills in a beauty salon. She is very efficient at her job, and she is known for her salon. This has kept her business going for more than 8 years now.

Recently, Gloria requested a loan to buy additional curlers, hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon business in order to attract more clientele. She hopes to expand her salon business by hiring dermatology workers.

loans.use: to buy additional curlers, hair chemicals and cosmetics for her salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 53 years old and lives in Rizalina, Rizal. She is married and has three children. 

She has a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy stocks for her business. 

Jovita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 51 years old and single. He lives in Tudela, in the Philipines. Nestor owns and cultivates his rice farm to earn a living, and he also engages in the hog raising business. Nestor has mastered doing this type of activities for twenty years now. 

He joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in June of 2012. He is hardworking and has strong determination to pursue his goals to sustain his needs, alleviating poverty. Nestor requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase production on his rice farm, animal feeds, and vitamins. This will greatly help Nestor to boost his income. 

Someday, he hopes to buy a parcel of rice land to expand his rice farm. Aside from his project of building a concrete pig pen, he thought of adding heads of piglets for commercial sale. Nestor is now supporting his nephew with his educational needs.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her hog raising business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of working on swine production. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Basfica

texts.en:
Basfica is 44 years old, married, and blessed with three children. For the last 10 years, she has been a farmer. Basfica earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Basfica is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from Visionfund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. This will be her first loan and she will use her cow to produce milk to sell. Basfica will use the profit from her loan to buy farm inputs and increase her farm produce. She hopes to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, Basfica plans to expand her farm and become a large-scale farmer in the region.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is 25 years old and married; he has been blessed with two children, aged 3 years and 1 year. He has been growing wheat for five years now, and it has been profitable. 

He is taking his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant in his farm to get more farm produce to sell and get more income. 

He intends to use anticipated profit to expand his farming business by buying more farm inputs. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be successful in his business and be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to fund her small grocery store. Her earnings were a big help in seeing to the education of her children and in paying for their personal, household and business expenditures.

Aside from her store, Vilma also earns income from her junk shop business. She would like to apply for a 51,000 PHP loan which she will use as a revolving fund to buy scrap and recyclable materials.

She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial grant that will be given to her, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and for the education of her children. Vilma hopes to get her own stall for her junk shop, and she aims to send her children to school up to the college level.

Each week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. There, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials and metals to sell.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mera works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mera is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional foods to sell like milk, sugar, fruits, beans, etc. for her food-vending business.

Mera has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods to sell like milk, sugar, fruits, beans, etc.

loans.name: Rochille

texts.en:
Rochille is 23 years old and single with one child.

She is living in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rochille has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old and married with two children. With her children currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Arcelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Arcelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

Arcelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of ginger

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Norma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 59 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 16 years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Edna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is from the town of Likoni; she is a very hardworking person who has always worked and strived to reach her goals and objectives.

She owns a food cafe in downtown Likoni, which she has had for more than six years; she comments that it has attained a good reputation in the neighborhood and, as a result, she has good clientele.

She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Meali is asking for this loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil, and other products to stock her store, so that she will have good products to offer her customers.

She is grateful for this opportunity, which will help her very much.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Ayubu's Group

texts.en:
Ayubu's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Ayubu, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 28 years old, is married and has three children. Ayubu has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Ayubu isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Ayubu will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Ayubu's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Matsezi

texts.en:
Matsezi is a married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business; her customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. 

She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group formed by 9 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. He is 46 years old and a married father of 6 children, often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Simon has been a farmer for 20 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Simon wanted to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Simon hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 4 solar-powered lights, as, even though Simon decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar-powered light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Wafula's Group

texts.en:
Wafula, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 52 years old, is married, and has 6 children.

Wafula likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014, and he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of the One Acre Fund farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has allowed him to learn a lot from farming training. Wafula plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Wafula’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao, 41, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province and she is a mother of three children. She grows rice as the single main source of her income to improve her family’s living. 

This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her business. She hopes that she can get income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 27 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 1 y 4 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Ana para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a junto a su esposo a prestar servicios  de trasporte a los vecinos de su comunidad, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también vende comida  en su domicilio.
Ana es una mujer que le preocupa su fuente de ingreso, y su fuente de ingreso es el vehículo con el que trasportan a las personas de su comunidad, que ahora tiene algunos problemas de llantas y de su motor, ella ha considerado solicitar un préstamo para comprar sus llantas y reparar el motor del carro, para que siga funcionado bien.
El gran anhelo de Ana es poder conseguir el crédito para reparar lo más pronto posible su vehículo y seguir generando ingresos para luego construir una casa más grande para ellos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 27-year old woman. She is married and has a lovely family, with 2 children, ages 1 and 4. They live in a community of Sololá. 

To generate income and help her husband with expenses, she and her husband offer a transportation service to the neighbors in their town. She also sells food from her home to bring in more income. 

Ana worries about her income source. Her main source is the vehicle with which she transports members of her community. It is now having some problems with the tires and the engine. She is requesting a loan to buy tires and repair the car’s motor, so that it will continue to run well.

Ana’s great wish is to be able to obtain the loan to repair her vehicle as soon as possible in order to eventually build a larger home for her family.

loans.use: to buy tires and repair the motor of the car that she uses for her transportation service.

loans.name: Biebieta's Group

texts.en:
Biebieta, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is 42 years old and a married mother of five children; she is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Biebieta has been a farmer for 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Biebieta wanted to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Biebieta hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights, as, even though Biebieta decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine is a 60-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in the Kakamega north district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Christine has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming training.

Christine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Christine’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single, with two children, all of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees. 

Teddy offers secretarial services in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 9 years and works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy reams of duplicating papers, staplers and boxes of books.

Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages which interrupt her work. Teddy's goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy reams of duplicating papers, staplers, and boxes of books

loans.name: Sandra Berónica

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer laboriosa que tiene la edad de 39 años es propietaria de un taller de carpintería donde se elaboran puertas, gabinetes, comedores, etc., es el décimo sexto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio, este es un negocio familiar donde los principales trabajadores son sus hijos varones e inicia este negocio con apoyo de su esposo, de esta manera ha crecido en esta industria, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de madera (cedro macho y real), sellador, pintura, zener, lija, etc., uno de sus mayores logros es el crecimiento de su negocio y se ha propuesto continuar así.
texts.en: Sandra is a hard-working 39-year-old woman. She is the owner of a carpentry workshop where doors, cabinets, dining tables, etc are made. This is the sixteenth cycle where ADIM has given a loan to her business. This is a family business where the main employees are her sons. The business was started with support from her husband. Through these connections, the business has grown in the industry. She is requesting a loan to purchase wood (cedro macho and Argentine cedar) sealant, paint, sandpaper, etc. One of her greatest achievements is the growth of the business and she wants this growth to continue.

loans.use: purchase wood, sealant, paint, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Sofia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Sofia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and appreciates the financial assistance it gives. Myrna tried her luck with doing a business focusing on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the Paglaum Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Myrna borrowed another amount to pay for fertilizer and compost. This will give her farming income a big boost. 

Myrna looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to meet his clients' expectations and demand for milk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and married to Julius; they are blessed with five children. She has been a small-scale farmer for the last 16 years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 from the business.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production. This will enable her to supply more milk to her clients and earn enough money to educate her children. 

She plans to use direct profits to buy fertilizer, seeds and more dairy cattle for milk production. Her future hopes are to expand her farming operations to become a large-scale farmer and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production to enable her to supply more milk to her clients to earn more income for educating her children.

loans.name: Roche Mae

texts.en:
Roche Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Roche Mae successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Roche Mae's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like bamboo and paints, and to pay laborers' salaries for her furniture making business.

Nelly has been in this business for 13 years and earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like bamboo and paints, and to pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Wellien

texts.en:
Wellien is 46 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are still in school.

Wellien is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Wellien has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 4 times in the past to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanamina

texts.en:
Mwanamiwa is a single woman who has no child, and lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions.

loans.name: Linieliza

texts.en: Linieliza is 30 years old and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. She has run a business selling bananas for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to resell. Linieliza has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bulk bananas for resale

loans.name: Rakita

texts.en:
Rakita is a 23 year old male and married. He has two children aged 5 years and 6 months whom he supports. He has been a farmer for two years growing maize.

He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya in order to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and farm chemicals. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to expand his current business. His hope and dream is to have his children educated for life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, farm inputs, and farm chemicals

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 1 año, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante
Doña María es una joven madre y esposa que le gusta trabajar para ayudar con los gastos que se generan en su hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños, ella se dedica al  comercio, tiene un local en su casa donde vende artículos de papelería y cosas para fiestas ya sea infantiles o de cualquier tipo ( piñatas, adornos, juguetes, entre otras cosas), trabaja todos los días en ocasiones con la ayuda de su marido, son seis años que lleva en este negocio el cual lo ha ido mejorando con los créditos que ha recibido de la institución.
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares, juguetes, piñatas, sorpresas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 2 años en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, La Rosa De Guadalupe credit group meets every two weeks. This area is known for its traditional culture. In addition, it's a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province like San Jacinto and San Clemente. 
Mara lives in this zone. She is 26 years old. She is married. She has two children from this relationship who are five and one-year-old. The older child is in school. Her husband is a merchant. 
Maria is a young mother and wife who likes to work in order to help with the household expenses and raising her children. She has a store in her home where she sells paper products and party goods for children and everyone ( piñatas, decorations, toys).  She works every day, sometimes with some help from her husband. She has had this business for six years. It has been improving with the loans from the institution. 
The loan is for purchasing school supplies, toys, piñatas, surprises and other items to sell. She has ben involved with her credit group for two years. She likes it because the loans help her business. Her dream is to have a larger location.

loans.use: purchase school supplies, toys, piñatas, surprises, etc.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 30 years old, married to James, and they are blessed with three children aged 10, 8 and 5 years old. She has been practising poultry farming for the last 15 years and earns KES 5,400 per month.

Everline has applied for                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her poultry farming. 

She hopes to have a greater egg supply.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 42 years old and has three children. She is single and her three children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nerissa has been in the business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter, pictured above, has been a farmer for five years and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. He is 32 years old, is married, and has five children.

Peter likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Peter plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Peter’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell and expand her work

loans.name: Donna Vee

texts.en:
Donna Vee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Donna Vee has been in this business for two years and earns more income from pre-paid mobile load.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Prezel

texts.en:
Prezel is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.
