She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Prezel has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ángela Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 62 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos mayores e independientes. El marido es ebanista. 
Doña Ángela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, con su esfuerzo ella hace 8 años surtió un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende  colas, aguas, golosinas, helados, papas fritas, hielo, entre otras cosas. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en su taller, el elabora puertas, camas y una gran variedad de muebles, los mismos que fabrica bajo pedidos, de esta forma ellos logran ganarse la vida de una manera honrada y honesta.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sodas, dulces, golosinas y madera para el negocio de su marido. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Grupo de Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan en su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una gran tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the Credit Group Rose of Guadalupe meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its traditional culture as well as being just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province; San Jacinto and San Clemente.  In this places lives Angela, who is 62 years old and is in a civil union from which she has 4 children who are independent adults.  Her husband is a carpenter.  

Angela is a woman who likes to work.  With great effort, 8 years ago she stocked a small business in her home, where she sells Cola, water, snacks, ice creams, fries, ice and other things.  She also gives part of the loan to her husband, so that he can use it in his workshop.  He makes doors, beds, and a great variety of furniture.  He manufactures based on orders, and in this way they are able to earn an honorable and honest living.  

She will use this loan to buy sodas, sweets and snacks, and wood for her husband's business.  She has 4 loan cycles with the Credit Group and likes it because the loans help her business.  Her dream is to have a large store of goods.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sweets, snacks and wood.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, she has operated a food selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, beans, and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a single woman. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mwanaisha has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

Mwanaisha wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase cloth and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married, aged 42 years, and has six children who are 24, 22, 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old, respectively. He lives in a rural setting with his family and he is a farmer who deals in banana growing.

He started the farming business in 1993. He works six days a week and each day he works for eight hours. He started this business in order to earn a living since he did not go to school. 

He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides. This will improve his yields.

His customers are traders from nearby areas and he hopes to be the leading supplier of banana in his area, but he still faces the challenge of lack of enough capital and unpredictable weather changes. 

He describes himself as a hard working man and honest. He thanks Kiva lenders for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 54, is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a receptionist, and they have two children who are in high school and college. Lydia manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to augment the family's income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her two children to school. 

Lydia operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. Lydia earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Lydia earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day.

To help Lydia continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to buy grocery items such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, etc. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Lydia thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Lydia hopes to maintain and grow her business so that her family could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. Lydia faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha una mujer dedicada y amable, tiene 36 años es casada tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 7 y 16 años de edad, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Bertha desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de refacciones como atoles, chuchitos y tostadas en la plaza de su comunidad, ella realiza esta actividad con el único fin de generar sus ganancias y mantener a su familia.
Ella es una madre que se preocupa por el futuro de sus hijos se ha puesto a ver las necesidades primordiales de la familia y una de ellas es que no cuentan con suficiente terreno donde sus hijos puedan cultivar o en un futuro construir por tal motivo ella ha tomado la iniciativa de comprar media cuerda de terreno, pero Bertha tiene una dificultad, de no contar con suficiente dinero para poder realizar la compra, entonces Berta ahora solicita un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 que lo utilizara para la compra de media cuerda de terreno
El gran deseo de Bertha es  mejorar su vida económicamente y seguir comprando mas terrenos
texts.en:
Bertha is a dedicated, friendly woman. She is 36 years old and married. She has a beautiful family with five children ranging in ages from seven to 16. They live in the city of Sololá. 
For 12 years, Bertha has sold snacks like atole, chuchitos and tostadas in the plaza in her city.  Her sole purpose in this work is to generate income and support her family. 
She is a mother worried about the future of her children and their basic needs. They do not have enough land where her children can grow or build. For this reason,  she has taken the initiative to purchase half an acre of land. However, Bertha is having difficulty. She does not have enough money to make the purchase. Bertha is requesting a loan of Q 7,000.00 which be used to purchase the land. 
 Bertha's big wish  is to improve her life economically and to continue buying more land.

loans.use: purchase land.

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Carmen realiza el crédito para su esposo, el tiene un puesto en el mercado local  en el cual vende carne de chancho, él se desplaza hasta los campos a comprar los chanchos en pie y luego los lleva a los centros de faenamiento, vende la carne, huesos, cuero y todo lo que pueda vender de los credos,  su clientela es abundante ya que  saben que él les da un buen producto y al peso correcto, lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el mismo que les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos.  Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the communal loan bank “La Rosa de Guadalupe” meets every fifteen days.  This place is known for its traditional culture, as well as for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, the San Jacinto and San Clemente beaches.  Carmen, 54 years old, lives here.  She lives in a common law marriage, from which she has five grown children, two of whom still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Carmen is taking out this loan for her husband.  He has a stand in the local market, where he sells pork.  He travels to the country to buy the pigs and then brings them to be processed.  He sells the meat, bones, hide, and everything that he can sell from them.  He has an abundant client base because they know that he will give them a good product at the correct weight.  He has had this business for more than 20 years, which allows them to move forward in life.

The purpose of this loan is to buy pigs.  Carmen has been with this communal bank for five cycles and likes it because of the benefits that the institution provides.  Her dream is for herself and her family to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Javier Alfonso

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive don Javier, tiene 42 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 10 años, los dos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposa trabaja en un colegio.
El señor Javier es un hombre muy trabajador que para salir adelante  hace tres años con los ahorros que tenia y haciendo muchos esfuerzos logro comprar un taxi, el trabaja todos los días en la ciudad de Portoviejo realizando fletes a personas que a diario utilizan este medio de transporte para viajar de un lado a otro de la ciudad,  trabaja desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, no trabaja más tarde por los peligros que hay en la noche, de esta forma el se gana la vida y trata de que a su familia no les falte nada.
Este crédito es para comprar llantas nuevas y repuestos que necesita el taxi  para brindar un mejor servicio.  Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque  los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto the Credit Group Rose of Guadalupe meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its traditional culture as well as being just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province; San Jacinto and San Clemente.  In this places lives Javier, who is 42 years old, married, and has two children, ages 14 and 10.  Both are studying, in high school and grade school.  His spouse works in a high school.  

Javier is a man who works hard to get ahead.  Three years ago, with his savings and with great effort, he managed to buy a taxi.  He works every day in Portoviejo giving rides to people who use this transportation daily to move from one side of the city to the other.  He works from 6 am until 7 pm.  He doesn't work later because of the dangers of working at night, and in this way he earns his living and tries to ensure that his family wants for nothing.  

This loan is to buy new tires and spare parts that the taxi needs to give a better service.  He has two loan cycles with the Credit Group and he likes it because the loans are fast.  His dream is to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Cristina es una mujer optimista y responsable, para que a sus hijos no les falte nada ella se dedica  a la elaboración de  ropa típica y artesanías desde hace 14 años en lugar de su  domicilio, para ella es importante la prosperidad, es por eso que ahora ha tomado la iniciativa de comprar una máquina industrial para mejorar la calidad de sus productos,  pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la compra, entonces ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando una maquina industrial, encajes de perlas, telas e hilo para la elaboración de blusas típicas.
El gran sueño de Cristina es realizar esta inversión para mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la casa.
texts.en: Cristina is 53 years old and the mother of a family who lives with her children in the San Andrés Semetabaj community.  She is an optimistic and responsible woman.  For fourteen years, she has made a living making traditional clothing and crafts in her home so that her children would not be lacking of anything.  Prosperity is important to her, which is why she has now taken the initiative to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of her products.  However, one of the difficulties she faces is that she does not have enough money to make the purchase.  Because of this, she has decided to request a loan that she will invest in an industrial machine, pearl laces, thread, and fabric to make traditional blouses.  Cristina’s greatest dream is to make this investment to increase her income and to improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine, thread, and fabric to make blouses

loans.name: Eveling Carolina

texts.es:
Eveling es una mujer de 30 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de 2 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 8 años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Eveling para mantener a su familia y que sus hijos tengan lo necesario se dedica a oficios domésticos lavando trastos, realizando limpieza y otras cosas, esta labor lo realiza ella desde hace 4 años en una de las aldeas circunvecinas de su comunidad.
Eveling se apuesto a ver una de las necesidades de su familia y una de ella ahora es la remodelación de sus servicios sanitarios, pero para poder realizar esta remodelación ella necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero  por tal motivo ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar arena, cemento y cal para el repello de la pared de su baño.
El gran sueño de Eveling es seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela para que san buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Eveling  is a 30 year old woman who has a beautiful family of two children, ages 5 and 8, and lives in the community of Sololá.  To support her family and ensure her children have everything they need, Eveling works in domestic services such as washing dishes, cleaning and other things.  She has been doing this work for 4 years in one of the villages surrounding her community.  

Eveling has seen the needs of the family, and one of them is to remodel the bathroom, but to be able to do the remodeling she needs a good quantity of money.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy sand, cement and lime powder for the cracks in the bathroom wall.  

Evening's dream is to continue helping her children in school so that they will be good professionals.

loans.use: to buy cement and lime powder, and sand to remodel her bathroom.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: Katherine es una joven soltera que desde el año 2013, emprendió su propio negocio dirigido al comercio de articulos varios. Ella genera sus  propios ingresos  vendiendo ropa, utensilios de cocina y toda clase de articulos, que sus clientes solicitan de acuerdo ala temporada. Su madre siempre ha sido comerciante, por eso ella siguió sus pasos, pues dede muy niña le inculcó el ser independiente. Hoy Katherine tiene una oferta de productos a crédito, que exhibe de lunes a viernes, en horarios de 9 de la mañana a a 7 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos y referidos por estos, que cada dia la ayudan a impulsar sus ventas, lo cual convierte su necesidad de obtener dinero en un desafio constante. Esta es la razón por la acual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa en general y articulos para el hogar. Con esta inversión ampliará sus inventarios e incrmentará sus ventas y esto es lo que justamente hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Katherine is a young, single woman who, in 2013, started her own business selling various items. She generates her own income selling clothes, kitchen utensils, and all types of items that her customers request according to the season.

Her mother has always been a shopkeeper, which is why she followed in her footsteps, because from a very young age, she was taught to be independent.

Today Katherine sells products on credit, which she displays from Monday to Friday, between the hours of 9 in the morning to 7 in the evening. Her primary customers are her own neighbors or those referred by them, who help boost her sales everyday, which turns her need to earn money into a constant challenge.

That is why she is resorting to a Kiva loan, the first financing she is getting through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy clothes in general, and items for the home. With this investment, she will increase her inventory and increase her sales, and that is just what will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes in general, and items for the home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 48years old, is married and has two children, both currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past 15 years, Teresita has run a business farming fruit in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Teresita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kassim's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Kassim, 33 years old, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  Kassim is married and has 4 children.

Kassim is returning to work with One Acre Fund again this season. This means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Kassim says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2012, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Kassim will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres. Some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, so the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Doricas's Group

texts.en:
Doricas is a 42-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is often described as a very hardworking individual.  Doricas is a group leader and is representing her group of twelve farmers from Kakamega North District.  Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Doricas has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings.

Doricas described her harvest last year as excellent, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, which will allow her to have light at night for her children to be able to study.  Lastly, Doricas will also use the funds to purchase fertilizer and maize.  She plans to send her children to school with the profits from this season’s harvest.

With this loan, Doricas’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, mayor de edad soltera originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de golosinas  y dulcerías como; tortillitas, caramelo, bombón, chocolates, bollitos de cocos y leche entre otros productos. se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora que ha tenido que luchar dia a dia para salir adelante, sus compras y  ventas  son al contado inicio este negocio con el objetivo de salir adelante, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano a realizar sus deliciosos dulces para luego salir a las calles a ofrecer los tiene cliente fijos y eventuales,  Uno de sus sueños es llegar a tener un gran negocio  y salir adelante. el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de materia prima como: coco, leche, azucar, mani, canela, arroz, aceite entre ortos mas. Alicia se siente muy agradecida  por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Alicia is an older single woman from the Chinandega municipality, located in the west of the country.  It is an area characterized by its commerce, productivity, and tourism.  She is a micro-business manager and owner of a business that sells sweets and confectionaries such as tortillitas (traditional Nicaraguan fried flatbread), caramel, and a variety of chocolates and sweet rolls.

She is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who has had to fight day by day to move forward in life.  Her sales and purchases are in cash.  She started her business in order to move forward.  Her typical workday starts very early to make her delicious sweets so that she can later go out into the streets to sell them.  She has regular and potential clients.  One of her dreams is to have a big business and to move ahead in life.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing raw materials such as coconut, milk, sugar, peanuts, cinnamon, rice, and oil.  Alicia is very grateful for the economic support that Kiva provides to those in need.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials including cinnamon, vanilla, and rice

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is single with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a stall of charcoal at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 9 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and cabbages. Her major business challenges include transportation. 

She aspires to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a clinic on a retail basis from a shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cough syrup, malaria tablets, and vaccines. Her major challenges include seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy beds and a medical personal to start making admissions for patients. 

She lives in a family house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup, malaria tablets, and vaccines

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María, mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país zona caracterizada por ser productivamente comercial, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general como; ropa ,zapatos, perfumes cosméticos de belleza prendas de oro, plata y acero labiales pinturas entre otros etc. Negocio el cual lo realiza de forma  ambulante y también su casa de habitación,  Rosa Maria se caracteriza responsable, trabajadora  y con muchos deseos de superación personal. Desde muy temprano ella sale a vender y a ofrecer sus productos para así conseguir nuevos clientes su jornada diaria es de 8 horas diarias de trabajo continuo sus compras y ventas son tanto al  crédito como al contado los cuales recupera quincenal y semanal las ventas al crédito que les da a personas de mayor confianza tiene tres años de experiencia. poco a poco ha ido engrandeciendo su negocio con esfuerzo propio. Debido a su necesidad de salir  de trabajar y adelante con su familia es su primer crédito pero a demostrado que es capaz de llegar a ser un buen cliente ella tiene muchos expectativas a llegar a hacer una gran negociante con hijos preparados el objetivo de este crédito es para engrandar su negocio y comprar más mercadería como; ropa íntima, toallas sandalias etc.
texts.en:
Rosa María is a single adult with two children living in the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country and characterized as a commercial area.  She is a small business owner who buys and sells general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, beauty products, gold, silver, and steel jewelry, lipstick and others.  

The business is realized in the form of a portable stall as well as in her house.  Rosa Maria is characterized as responsible, hard working, and with many desires to better herself.  She leaves early to sell and offer her products to obtain new clients.  Her workday is 8 continuous hours.  Her purchase and sales are on credit and cash.  She sells on credit to reliable clients, and is paid on a weekly or biweekly basis.  She has 3 years of experience.   Little by little she has grown her business through her efforts.  Because of her need to work and get ahead for her family, this is her first loan, but she has demonstrated that she is capable of being a good client.  She hopes to become a bigger businesswoman and prepare her children.  The objective of this loan is the grow her business and buy more merchandise such as intimate clothing, sanitary pads, and sandals, etc.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as:  perfumes, cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production to enable him to get milk to sell and use the income to educate his children and satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over five years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Asha dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Muna Jubilee Group

texts.en:
In 2013, Muna Jubilee Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from the training on savings and enterprise development and uplift their living standards.

The person raising her hand in the photo is Ruth, who is 51 years old, married, and living with her husband and her seven children.  She practices dairy farming and sells milk and dairy feeds. She has applied for a loan to buy more animal feeds and hence add stock.

She hopes that this loan will help her increase her income which will improve her living standards and enable her to pay for her child’s school fees.

Ruth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds that will boost incomes and thus support her child's education.

loans.name: Doricus's Group

texts.en:
Doricus's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Doricus, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 43 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Doricus has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Doricus isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Doricus will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Using this loan, Doricus's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Lucy, 43 years old, married and living with her husband and her six children. She practices mixed farming where she grows potatoes, maize, and beans and also runs a milk shop. She has applied for a loan to add stock to her milk shop that will help meet her customers' demand. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her income, which will help support her children's education.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk that will help meet customers' demand thus earning more income to support family needs.

loans.name: Johanna Monserrate

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
En este lugar vive la señora Joanna, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia Ing., Química en una universidad de la localidad, ella está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede salir adelante y continuar con sus estudios.
Doña Johanna además de estudiar se dedica al comercio para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su mamá con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende a sus compañeras de clases las que son sus mejores clientes, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo necesario para continuar con sus estudios esperando en un futuro ser una gran profesional.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Higuerón is very close to the city of Portoviejo and is surrounded by a great amount of vegetation.  Its residents make a living in agriculture and livestock raising, which they use to carry their families forward.  Every fifteen days, the members of the communal bank “San Antonio de Higuerón” meet here.  This is where Johanna lives.  She 21 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s house.  She studies engineering and chemistry at a university in the area.  She has been in this communal bank from the start and likes it because she can move forward and continue with her studies thanks to the loans.

In addition to her studies, Johanna makes a living in commerce selling all kinds of clothing to obtain her own resources to help her mother with household expenses.  She sells all kinds of clothing door-to-door and also to her classmates, who are her best clients.  She extends credit and collects payment every eight days.  For four years, she has made a living in this profession, where she earns what she needs to be able to continue with her studies.  In the future, she hopes to be a great professional.  This loan is to purchase pants, shirts, and children’s clothing.  Her dream is to finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en: Sokna is a 38-year-old woman with two children from Battambang province. She grows rice as the main source of income. This is her eighth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to get more yields to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farmland

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all go to school. She has no additional members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village to the market to sell. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a salon and charges phones. He is very hardworking and hopes to build a permanent house for his family. He is affected by a challenge of inadequate capital. 

He wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to  buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet her customers' demand for milk.

loans.name: Maeli

texts.en:
Maeli is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five months, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Matete's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Matete, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 56 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of fifteen farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Matete is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that he is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Matete says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Matete will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of eight acres. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Cleophas's Group

texts.en:
Cleophas' Group is formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Cleophas, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 22 years old, is married, and has one child. Cleophas has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Cleophas isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since.

This year, Cleophas will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Cleophas's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi, pictured above, has been a farmer for eight years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega North District. She is 35 years old, is married and has seven children.

Naomi likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. Naomi plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Naomi’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 12 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the harvest of maize

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 40-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Stephen has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Stephen described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Stephen’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 26-year-old married woman from the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband who is the only breadwinner in the family. Gia works as a private artisan and gets insignificant income that is really hardly enough to make financial stability. Tea has great desire to add her bit to the family's welfare and tackle the financial difficulties. According to the above-mentioned situation, Tea lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tea to get a loan of 700 USD and start her own business.  She will purchase a stock of merchandise and have money for working capital for opening a bakery. She will rent the space that she has already found and will start working herself. 

Tea thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income, which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With the support of the Start Up program, Tea will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a bakery and generate her own income

loans.name: Kokin Rolan Rangler

texts.es:
Kokin tiene 19  años soltero hace más de tres años que se dedica al servicio de transporte de moto taxi, con los ingresos de su  trabajo diario apoya a sus padres. Su mayor anhelo es poder ahorrar un pequeño capital para seguir sus estudios superiores. Solicito el préstamo para regularizar los documentos de su  moto taxi y poder asociarse a una empresa de transportes.
Está muy agradecido por haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
Kokin is 19 years old and single. For more than three years, he has been providing motorcycle taxi services. With the income he earns each day, Kokin is able to support his parents. His greatest wish is to save a small amount of capital so that he can continue his higher education.

He is requesting a loan in order to file the documents for his motorcycle taxi so that he can become affiliated with a transportation company.

loans.use: to file the documents for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Calister

texts.en:
Calister is 52 years old and married to Aloys. They are blessed with five children between 28 and 18 years old. She has been a farmer for the last 38 years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,500. 

Calister has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet her customers' demand for milk. Her plans are to use the gained profits to educate her children and expand her agricultural sector. 

Her hopes is that she be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to meet her customers' demand for milk.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 36 years old, married to Julius and together they are blessed with five children. She has been farmer for the last 18 years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,900 from selling farm produce such as maize, beans and vegetables.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to enable her supply enough milk to her customers and get more income.

She plans to use the profits she will gain to educate her children and have more dairy cattle and increase her milk production. Her hope is to be able to expand her farming and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and married. She has been blessed with 2 children of 13 years and 8 years respectively who she supports. 

Betty has a café which she has run for 9 years now. She is taking her second loan. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her hopes and dreams for her business and children is to open a restaurant and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and salts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her sewing business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for a PHP 11,000 loan, which she will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her round palm-sized rugs are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters. It is a major item for housekeeping and cleaning, and is changed constantly to ensure a bacteria-free rug. She also has a small general store for additional income. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help to run her business. Her income will surely cover their daily needs and fund the education of her children.

Erlinda hopes for her business to grow so she can help support her grandchildren's schooling. She prays for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies she needs for her rug-sewing business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Lolita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is 58 years old and is a hard-working woman, from a small village, Zemo Alvani. She lives with her husband, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Venera works at the local water-supply company and gets 150 GEL monthly. As this income has become hardly enough to even cover the basic needs of the family, Venera decided to make business income and requested a loan. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Venera has requested a Credo loan to open a bakery. Her loan request was approved in the framewor of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions for the country's poor people, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Venera will purchase all equipment and will start baking traditional Georgian bread. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will significantly increase. Venera and her husband will be able to create better living conditions and will be very grateful.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and open a bakery.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Everlyne's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Everlyne, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. She is 36 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has 3 children.

Everlyne is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Everlyne says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Everlyne will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Sifuna's Group

texts.en:
Sifuna is 60 years old and has six children. He has been a farmer for twenty years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Sifuna is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by twelve farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Sifuna started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Sifuna’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eleven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey, 24, is a married man with three children from Talibon, Bohol. His oldest child is five and the youngest is three months old. He grows and sells seaweed. He has been growing seaweed for almost four years now.  

He is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and pay for the laborers. This will help Junrey grow and sell more seaweed in the coming few months. With this, his income will improve and he will be able to provide his family with a nutritious diet. Junrey dreams of expanding his current livelihood to make it sustainable in the coming future for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and pay for laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, shorts, shoes, and other products.

loans.name: Bunty

texts.en:
Bunty is a 26-year-old student who is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in English literature in his third year. He lives in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. Bunty has also worked as a cashier in a hotel since 2013, making around USD 4 a day. 

He is short of finances to pay his third-year tuition fees, therefore he would like to take out a loan. This loan will help him to go through the third year at the university successfully. In the future, Bunty hopes to have enough money to run a business and have his own house.

loans.use: to pay his third-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives happily with her family in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. She is a mother of two school-aged boys. Her beloved husband is a constructor, but he is mainly busy with farming and agriculture with Anna. Anna has a pedagogical vocational education; for five years she worked at the kindergarden. Now she is unemployed and has great plans for developing her farm. On her farm she has cows, calves, pigs, sheep, lamb and chickens. She sells her farm’s milk, meat (pork, mutton and beef) and eggs locally or right from her house to her neighbors. 

Anna is also a connoisseur in agriculture, and on her land she cultivates a lot of potatoes, greens, cucumbers, tomatoes and peppers, and sell all of these mainly to re-sellers. Anna says that with coming of spring, every family in her native village hopes to have a good income from potato cultivation. That is why she also wants to be ready for its cultivation. 

She needs this loan as she wants to buy a lot of potato seedlings and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings and also animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 42 years and is blessed with 7 children who are between 24 and 10 years old. She has been a poultry keeper for the last three years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow and get more chicks for sale. She will educate her children with the anticipated income. 

Her plans are to use gained profits to add more poultry for egg production and start small-scale farming. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and buy more chicks for sale to earn income to educate her children.

loans.name: Anne's Group

texts.en:
Anne is a 53-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of six farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Anne has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Anne described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Anne’s Group will be able to plant a total of three acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to add more stock of milk to sell in the market and be able to educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable her meet her customers' demand for milk supply.

loans.name: Telmina

texts.en:
Telmina is 39 years old and she lives in the village Tsovazard of Gegharkunik region. Since she married, Telmina together with the family of her husband became engaged in farming and agriculture. Now already with her husband she became master in this field. She has a farm where she takes care of cows, calves, bulls, pigs and chickens. 

She cares for her animals very properly keeping them clean and always fed. Her farm products are also of high quality and tasty. She sells milk, cheese, meat and eggs. Telmina with the help of her husband, cultivates potatoes on their plot of land. Her orchard is full of apple and fig trees. The main part of her farm products she sells at the city’s wholesale market and the other part she uses for her family. 

Telmina has three children; her son temporally lives and works in abroad, her elder daughter is marred already and the smallest still lives with them.

Telmina needs this loan of 300.000 Armenian drams to buy a cow and also animal fodder for her all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Mary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. Mary has been a farmer for four years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Mary isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Mary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Mary's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to improve her maize harvests

loans.name: Olga Maribel

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que vive en una comunidad de Sololá, tiene 23 años cuenta con una linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 2 y 7 años.
Olga con el propósito de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo al mantenimiento de la casa, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de jaspeado en el lugar de su domicilio.
Desde hace algunos días Olga está pasando por una pena, porque su esposo se encuentra muy enfermo, por lo que ella ha estado gastando con médicos para la curación de su querido esposo, dado a las circunstancias que se encuentra Olga ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar la medicina de su esposo.
El gran anhelo de Olga es poder conseguir el crédito lo más pronto posible para que su esposo se cure, y juntos puedan seguir luchando para tener algún día una casa propia.
texts.en:
Olga is a hardworking and responsible woman who lives in the community of Sololá. She is 23 years old and has a beautiful family that includes three children between the ages of 2 and 7.

In order to generate income and help her husband with maintaining their home, Olga has been producing woven goods in her home for the past 10 years. For several days, Olga has experienced grief because her husband is very ill. For this reason, she has had to pay doctors to cure her loving husband. Given the circumstances that Olga is in, she decided to request a loan in order to pay for her husband’s medicine.

Olga’s greatest wish is to secure this loan as soon as possible so that her husband is cured. Together they can continue striving toward having a house of their own someday.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her husband.

loans.name: Mahbubakhon

texts.ru: Махбубахону 28 лет. Она мать двоих детей. Для Махбубухаон ее дети смысл жизни, стимул и мотивация для продвижения вперед. До сегодняшних дней, она работала продавщицей, но теперь хочет сама начать новый бизнес и работать на себя, чтобы получить больше дохода и собрать деньги для образования детей. Махбубухон будет заниматься продажей одежды. В ее ассортимент товара будет входить в основном детские вещи, носки, колготки, ласины, брюки и рубашки детские, платья, детская обувь и т.д.. Махбубахон верит в свою удачу и надеется, что ей удастся получить кредит, купить товар и начать новый бизнес.
texts.en:
Mahbubakhon is 28 years old. She is the mother of two children. To Mahbubakhon, her children means the world. They are her incentive and motivation to move forward. To the present day she has worked as a saleswomen. Now she wants to start a business and work for herself, in order to get a higher income and save money for educating her children. 

Mahbubakhon will work with selling clothing. She will mainly have children's things; socks, tights, leggings, pants, shirts, dresses and shoes for children. Mahbubakhon believes in her fortune and hopes that she will be able to get a loan to purchase goods and start her new business.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for selling

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 61 años separada con hijos independientes. Hace 5 años que ella se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y jamón  en su triciclo de manera ambulatoria con los ingresos de su venta diaria  Ella solventa los gastos de su hogar. El sueño de catalina es tener un local propio para brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de llantas,cadena para su triciclo.
Está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva
texts.en:
Catalina is 61 years old, separated from her spouse, and has children who are independent. For the past five years, she has been selling grilled meat skewers and ham from a tricycle that she uses for traveling. Making daily sales is how she earns an income to pay for her household expenses.

Catalina dreams of having her own shop where she can provide better service to her customers. She will invest the loan in the purchase of tires and a chain for her tricycle.

Catalina is very pleased to have received the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and a chain for the tricycle she uses for her traveling food business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una madre de 46 años de edad es casada, tiene una linda familia de 5 hijos de las edades entre 5 y 25 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Francisca es una mujer responsable y dedicada, que para sacar adelante a su familia ella trabaja como cocinera desde hace 15 años en una finca de su comunidad, a Francisca le gusta la cocina por lo tanto es su actividad principal, pero para mejorar sus ingresos ella también vende bananos que produce en su pequeña parcela, Francisca cuenta que desde hace algún tiempo ella avía deseado comprar un terreno donde pudiera incrementar su cultivo de banano, pero lamentablemente Francisca no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder hacerlo, por tal motivo ella solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando un terreno donde pueda cultivar más banano y café.
Para Francisca el sueño más grande es tener una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 46-year-old mother. She is married, and she has a beautiful family that consists of 5 children between the ages of 5 and 25. She lives in a community in Solola.

Francisca is a responsible and dedicated woman. In order to move her family forward, she has been working as a cook at a farm in her community for the past 15 years. Francisca likes to cook, and at the moment it is her primary job. However, to improve her income, she also sells bananas, which she produces in her small plot of land.

Francisca states that for some time now, she has wanted to buy land in order to expand her banana cultivation. Unfortunately, Francisca does not have enough money to do this. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy land where she can cultivate more bananas as well as coffee. Francisca's biggest dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation.

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
This nice woman lives in the village of Lchasen in the Gegharkunik region. Her name is Zepyur and she lives here with her husband, son (a student) and daughter (she is a pedagogue). Zepyur has two higher educations and both of them are pedagogical. From 1990 until today, Zepyur has worked at her village school as a teacher of mathematics. In her school she is characterized as a very kind, intelligent and patient teacher. She also has a not-small group of pupils to whom she gives private courses of mathematics at her house, preparing them for the entrance exams. 

Zepyur says that she feels she has a lack of information in the sphere where she works. With this loan she hopes to buy a computer and some methodological literature which will surely help her to get informed of innovations in the field of pedagogy and she will surely use that in her teaching process.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some methodological literature which will surely help her to get informed of innovations in the field of pedagogy

loans.name: Tekla

texts.en:
Tekla, who is 34 years old and divorced, lives in Batumi city with her school-aged son. Tekla takes care of him alone and finds it hard to provide a good education and financial stability for her family. She was unable to find any stable job and earns a living with a private activity. She goes to Turkey and generates a small income there. In order to make income in her country, Tekla decided to purchase furniture for her house and rent it seasonally. The city where she lives is one of the most popular resorts in the country and she will always have her own clients, especially during the season. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Tekla applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses.
 
The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as her income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders and Tekla will tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her house and rent it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and paint so that she can make improvements to her vending stall.

loans.name: Samuel Moises

texts.es:
Moises de  22  años conviviente con una pequeña hija. Desde muy joven él se dedica a la agricultura ya que aprendió de sus padres. Actualmente Moisés  tiene su propio terreno  agrícola donde siembra y vende plátanos. Con los  ingresos de  su venta de plátanos  mantiene su hogar. El mayor anhelo de Moisés es comprar un pequeño lote en la ciudad para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Solicito el préstamo para poder comprar más plantaciones de plátanos.
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo recibido
texts.en:
Moises is 22 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a young daughter. He has been farming from a very young age since he learned the trade from his parents. Moises currently has his own farm land where he plants and sells bananas. With the income he earns from the sale of bananas, he is able to maintain his home. His greatest wish is to buy a small plot in the city so that he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

Moises is requesting a loan in order to buy more banana seedlings. He appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy banana seedlings.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en: Dilovar is a single third-year student who was born in 1994. He is living in a remote district. The basic income of their family is from his parents' work. He is trying to add additional money to his parents' monthly income by working at a computer centre and serving people. Additionally, he is copying and saving DVD and CD disks and sales in the domestic market. Dilovar needs to pay his university tuition fee for this year. He is asking for financial support from Kiva to make a payment to the university. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to make a payment to the university

loans.name: Halimjon

texts.en: Halimjon is a bright single man, born in 1993. He lives in a remote district with his parents. He is a fourth year student at university, majoring in finance and credit. His father is a construction worker and mother is an agrarian woman. Halimjon is asking for financial support from Kiva to pay his tuition fee for university. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee for university.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and married to William. They are blessed with 5 children of ages between 29 and 12 years old. Hellen is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 11 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her earn more income to help her buy more land to plant trees for sale.

She hopes to educate her children and be financially stable through increasing her agricultural produce.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to enable her earn more income and buy more land to plant trees for sale.

loans.name: Andrea Janneth

texts.es: Andrea es una señora de 27 años de edad, está casada, tiene una hija de 5 años y un hijo de 8 años mismos que se  encuentran estudiando, Andrea se dedica  a la crianza de animales y su esposo es jornalero de trabajos de agricultura, Andrea necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca ya que  su ingreso lo obtiene de la venta de leche, la aspiración más grande de Andrea es de seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para apoyar a sus esposo en los gastos del hogar y sobre todo en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Andrea, age 27, is married and has a five year old daughter and an eight year old son.  The children go to school.  Andrea raises animals, and her husband is an agricultural day worker.

Andrea needs the loan to buy a cow because she gets her earnings by selling milk.  Her biggest aspiration is to continue working and improving her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses and, above all, with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton is 32 years old and he lives in Gavar city in the Gegharkunik region. Anton is married and he lives with his pretty wife, two children and his retired mother. Anton now works at a private company as a distributor-driver. Simultaneously, Anton and his mother are engaged in farming, where he takes care of cows, calves and heifers. The main farm products that he manages to sell are meat, milk, and macun (a national dairy product made by his mother). Anton greatly wants to enlarge his farm but having financial difficulties, he has not managed to do it. Now becoming aware of the Kiva program, he is happy and he hopes that, like many people, he will also be supported to develop his farming.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Anton wants to spend on the purchase of three cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows for his farm

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa, 36 years old, lives in Irbid. She is married and has four children.

She wants to meet the needs of her children and she dreams that their future will be full of success and excellence. All that depends on the financial situation of her family, so she started in commerce many years ago selling general products. Her shop is beside her house so she can still be near her children. Wafaa is doing all this to provide a good life and good education to her children.

She wants to expand her work to increase her income so she asked for a loan to help her buy what she needs, to buy more products to sell, and improve her work.

loans.use: To help her buy what she needs, to buy more products to sell, and to improve her work.

loans.name: Narciza Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es madre soltera de 29 años de edad, su hija tiene 7 años y asiste a la escuela,  Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y adicionalmente trabaja de vendedora en una tienda de zapatos, comenta Elizabeth que con el dinero del crédito va a comprar pollos para seguir adelante con su negocio al que ya se dedica 15 años, la aspiración de  Elizabeth es mejorar su negocio comprar mas pollos, readecuar sus pequeños galpones y asi tener buenos ingresos que permitan darle lo necesario a sus hija y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 29, is a single mother with a seven year old daughter who goes to school.  Elizabeth raises small animals.  She also works as a salesperson at a shoe store.

Elizabeth says that she will use the loan to buy chickens in order to get ahead with her business.  She has been in her business for 15 years.

Elizabeth’s aspiration is to improve her business, to buy more chickens, and to overhaul her small sheds.  This way she will have good earnings that will allow her to give her daughter what she needs and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Pablo Jorge

texts.es:
Pablo de 63 años separado  con un hijo independiente. Años atrás  Pablo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa pero como tuvo dificultades decide comprar su moto taxi. Con los  ingresos de su trabajo ahorra un pequeño capital para poder arreglar su casa. El sueño de Pablo es mejorar su casa construyéndolo de material noble. Adquirió el préstamo para el cambio de sistema de arrastre de su moto taxi.
 Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Pablo is 63 years old, separated from his spouse, and has a son who is independent. He sold clothing years ago but had difficulty. Therefore, he decided to buy a motorcycle taxi. With the income he earns from his work, Pablo was able to save a small amount of capital so that he could repair his house. He dreams of improving his house by building it out of solid materials.

Pablo is acquiring this loan so that he can replace the crankshaft system of his motorcycle taxi. He appreciates the Kiva lenders for the support he has received.

loans.use: to replace the crankshaft system of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Pucaray De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria, la socia tiene 4 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de verduras, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de papa, negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de comida, venta de hortalizas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Pucaray De Huancalle". The group is located in the district of Pisac, which belongs to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

The member Victoria is married and has 4 children. The member alternates her daily activities. She makes a living selling small animals. The member has had this business for several years, and she does well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. At the same time, the member sells vegetables. She wishes to continue working so that, in this way, she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables.

The other members make a living selling potatoes, working in agriculture, selling food, and selling vegetables. Victoria is grateful for the loan that she is being given, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

The member that appears in the attached photograph received permission to arrive late to the meeting as a result of his work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sa'bagul

texts.ru: Саъбагул проживает на районе Вахш. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей(2 сына и 2 дочки). Муж занимается земледелием, а Саъбагул животноводством. Этим бизнесом она занята на протяжении 10 лет. Работать в этой сфере деятельности она научилась у своего отца. Саъбагул на сегодняшний момент имеет троих маленьких телят и хочет увеличить их поголовья, расширить малый бизнес. Дети Саъбагула растут и растут их расходы. Она с мужем стараются работать еще больше, чтобы дать детям достойное образование и поставить их на ноги. На заемные деньги Саъбагул намерена приобрести пару голов телят и бычков.
texts.en:
