Sa'bagul lives in the Vakhsh region. She is 43 years old. She is married and has four children (two sons and two daughters). Her husband works with field crop cultivation, and Sa'bagul with livestock breeding. She has worked with this for a period of 10 years. She learnt this type of business from her father. 

Sa'bagul currently has three small calves and would like to increase their number, expanding her small business. As Sa'bagul's children are growing, so does her expenses. She and her husband strives to work more, in order to give their children a decent education and put them on their feet. 

Sa'bagul intends to use the loan amount to purchase some calves and bull-calves.

loans.use: to increase her livestock herd

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Carmen Rosa  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa continues to manage her business of selling food. She is an enterprising woman who wants to help her children finish their studies as a result of this business. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

Carmen Rosa is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
María, es dueña de una venta de artículos plásticos y de aluminio, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco dela tarde, lo inicio sola, obtuvo un pequeño crédito con el que se compró artículos plásticos, las ganancias le han ido ayudando para ir aumentando su inventario, lo atiende sola. Vive con sus dos hijos y su madre, sus hijos tienen 10 y 8 años de edad, es una mujer que sola cumple con las responsabilidades de su hogar, ya que es madre soltera.
El financiamiento lo invertirá en detergentes y jabón, su intención es incorporar nuevos productos a su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, espera atender mejorar  a sus clientes y salir adelante con su familia.
Sus sueños son cancelar sus deudas y ahorrar para abrir otro punto de ventas y ofrecer empleo a otra persona.
texts.en:
María is the owner of a shop that sells plastic and aluminum goods. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. María works by herself and obtained a small loan in order to buy plastic goods. With the earnings, she was able to increase her inventory on her own. María lives with her two children and her mother. Her children are ages 10 and 8. María is a woman who takes care of her household responsibilities alone since she is a single mother.

Her loan will be invested in detergents and soaps with the intention of incorporating new products into her business so that she can increase her sales and profits. She hopes to provide better service to her customers and help her family move forward.

María dreams of repaying her debts and saving money toward opening another shop where she can hire another person.

loans.use: to buy detergents and soaps so that she can incorporate new products into her business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, a skilled farmer with 20 years of experience, lives in Nor Khachakap village. She lives with her husband who supports her with farming activities. Their only son lives and works in another town. Sara's and her husband's main occupation is agriculture. They keep cows, calves, piglets and hens. They also cultivate potatoes and sell them in local markets. 

To be able to enlarge her farming business, Sara has applied for this loan to purchase ten piglets, two calves, and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Sara's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for ten piglets, two calves, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en:
Featured in the above picture is Paul, who has been a farmer for more than 40 years. Although he is pictured alone, he is actually representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Paul has always been described as a very hardworking individual, which is largely why he was selected to be the group leader.

Paul started working with One Acre Fund for the first time in 2013, and this year he decided not only to get farming inputs but also a solar light as part of his loan. 

He is very excited about this new addition, as now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He can’t wait to invest in a business using the profits he earns from this coming season. 

Paul's Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres using the farming inputs obtained with this loan, and will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Elphas's Group

texts.en:
Elphas is a 40-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Elphas has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Elphas described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Elphas’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a builder from Gyumri town. He works at a local secondary school and after his work provides construction services to local people living in Gyumri town. 

For the time being, Armen provides different construction work, including installation of heating systems and internal design of houses.
 
Due to his creativity, Armen always finds original solutions for his customers' housing design. These customers highly value the top quality and fast service Armen provides. 

To purchase needed construction materials, tools and accessories for providing construction work, Armen asked this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. 

This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials, tools and accessories for providing construction work.

loans.name: Jafred's Group

texts.en:
"Jafred's Group is formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Jafred, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. Jafred has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Jafred isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to save more money ever since. This year, Jafred will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Jafred's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4 acres."

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Lenard's Group

texts.en:
Lenard is 54 years old and the proud father of seven children. He is often described as a very friendly person and is a group leader, representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Lenard has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Lenard described his harvest as good last year, but he believes that he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize seeds, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Lenard’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la albañilería y a la agricultura, creció con su padre, quien le enseño estas actividades; sus estudios culminaron en noveno grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y solo tiene 1 hijo.

José, se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar en construcción y en proyectos en los alrededores de su localidad. 

José, solicita el préstamo para comprar abono, semilla y pagar el alquiler de tierra donde sembrará, porque desea cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno.


José, sueña en un futuro iniciar en la producción de leche, e involucrar a su esposa para que todos trabajen en conjunto.
texts.en:
José is 29 years, married, and the father of a son who is one year old. José has a ninth-grade education and works both in construction and also as a farmer, while his wife cares for their son and manages the household. He gets up at 4:30 each morning to go to work on construction projects in his town and nearby. 

José is applying for a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds and to pay the rent for the 7,000-square meter plot where he'll plant his crops.

José hopes to start producing milk in the future, and that his wife can work with him.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay the rent on the land where he'll plant.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is a 54-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Sophy has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Sophy described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Sophy’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Roshan

texts.en: Roshan is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of 6 children. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Roshan is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life through all her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is 55 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Irshad has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Irshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Jesus

texts.es:
Juan es un joven estudiante de SENATI, que vive en Lima  junto a su madre y 3 hermanos. Su madre tiene un pequeño negocio propio de comida rápida y trabaja duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pero debido a la actual situación económica por la que están atravesando les es muy complicado apoyar a todos sus hijos para que surjan como buenos profesionales.
Juan actualmente se encuentra estudiando el II Ciclo de Procesos de Producción Industrial en SENATI, carrera que le interesa mucho porque cumple sus expectativas, cuando la culmine siente que lo beneficiará tanto a él como a su familia. Él empezó a trabajar desde los 13 años realizando labores pequeñas con las cuales obtenía propinas; pero a los 18 años ya empezó a trabajar de manera formal como ayudante de cocina.
Antes de recibir el crédito, él trabajaba solo en sus vacaciones para poder reunir el dinero que le permita continuar estudiando la carrera que tanto le gusta. Pero, debido a la difícil situación económica por la que están atravesando, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el apoyo de KIVA porque no quiere dejar de estudiar. De no contar con el apoyo de KIVA hubiera tenido que dejar de estudiar, hasta poder reunir el dinero indispensable que le permita cubrir los gastos de su matrícula y pensiones.
Juan se siente muy agradecido con la labor que realiza KIVA al brindarles a jóvenes como él, la oportunidad de convertirse en excelentes profesionales al culminar su carrera. Augura muchos éxitos para KIVA por la acción loable que realizan.
texts.en:
Juanis a young student at SENATI who lives in Lima with his mother and 3 siblings. His mother has her own small fast food business and works hard to raise her children. But due to the current economic situation they are going through it is very difficult for her to support all of them to become professionals.

Juan currently is studying in his second cycle of Industrial Production Management at Senati. He is very interested in his studies as they satisfy his expectations and when he finishes it will benefit him and his family. He started to work at 13 years old doing small jobs from which he got tips. By 18 he was working in a formal situation as a cool's assistant.

Before getting the loan he worked only during vacations to be able to continue the studies he like so much. But because of the difficult economic situation he is experiencing he has requested a loan from Kiva as he doesn't want to stop his studies. Not being able to count on the support of Kiva he would have to discontinue his studies until he could amass the needed money to cover the cost of his studies and living.

uan feels very grateful with the work that Kiva does offering the opportunity to youth people like him, to become professionals completing their studies. He envisions much success for Kiva for the praiseworthy work they do.

loans.use: to pay expenses for his Industrial Production Management course and become an excellent professional.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
Насибе 30 лет. Она проживает на районе Бохтар. Насиба замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж работает строителем.
  Насиба более 4 лет работает в торговой сфере деятельности. Раньше она жила у свекра и там занималась торговлей, но сейчас Насиба с семьей переехали в новый дом, и у нее на сегодняшний день нет ни место деятельности, ни большого количество товара. Вес ее товар вы можете увидит на фотографии на подоконнике возле окна. Подоконник на данный момент это и есть место деятельности. Основными ее клиентами являются соседи. Процесс торговли проходит так. Клиент- сосед приходит к ним домой, стучит в окно и Насиба оттуда продает им нужный продукт. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить товар на продажу и постепенно собрать деньги и открыть собственный магазин. Для Насибы сейчас тяжелое время и она надеется, что скоро все нормализируется и у нее и семье настанет светлые дни.
texts.en:
Nasiba is 30 years old. She lives in the Bohtar region. Nasiba is married and has three children. Her husband works as a carpenter. Nasiba has worked in retail for more than four years. 

Earlier she lived with her in-laws and worked with sales from there, but currently Nasiba and her family moved to a new house. Here she currently doesn't have any place for her business, nor enough goods. You can see the goods she has on the photo, on the window sill. The window sill is also where she currently sells from. Her customers are mainly her neighbors. The sales process is currently like this: Her customers comes to their home, knocks on the window and Nasiba sells them the products needed from there. 

Nasiba applied for a loan in order to purchase goods for selling and stepwise save money and open her own store. Nasiba currently has a difficult time, and she hopes that soon everything will be as normal and she and her family will have lighter days.

loans.use: to purchase food products for selling

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Мастоне 31 год и она мать одиночка. Ее сыну 12 лет. Мастона с сыном проживают на районе Вахш. У нее имеется не большой магазин, где занимается продажей разной одежды и хозяйственных товаров. В ассортимент ее товара входит детская одежда, шарфы, платки, полотенца, мыло стиральный порошок и даже обувь. У нее маленьких магазин с большим ассортиментом товара, но сейчас ей нужно привести новый товар, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. 
  Экономическое положение страны очень влияет на рынок и Мастоне необходимо удержать бизнес. Она верит, что вскоре экономический кризис пройдет и Мастона будет думать не об удержании бизнеса а, об ее расширения.
texts.en:
Mastona is 31 years old and a single mother. Her son is 12 years old. Mastona and her son lives in the Vakhsh region. She has a small store, where she sells different clothing and household goods. In her assortment of goods she has children's clothing, scarves, handkerchiefs, towels, laundry detergent and even shoes. 

Mastona has a small store with a large assortment of goods, however currently she needs to bring in new goods in order to attract more customers. The economic condition of the country affects the market very much, and Mastona needs to keep her business. She believes that the economic crisis will pass soon, so that she will be able to think about expanding her business, not only retaining it.

loans.use: to purchase new goods (towels, children's clothing and household goods) and retain her business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de libreria ,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de libreria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lapices,cuadernos,libros y lapiceros. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage a bookstore. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who wants to move forward as a result of her business. Her dream is to expand her bookstore. She is requesting a loan in order to buy pencils, notebooks, books, and pens.

The borrower is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy pencils, notebooks, books, and pens.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 57 years old and married. He has three children aged 15, 13, and 10, whom he supports.

Philip runs a butcher shop which has lasted for 10 years now. He is taking a fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase meat to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his current business. His hopes and dreams include opening a slaughterhouse.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell to his customers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 35 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives in Kisumu and currently he supports 3 people in his family.

He has a motorcycle transport business, which he has been operating for the last 5 years, and earns a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

He has applied for his 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy motorcycle spare parts and service his motorcycle so he can serve more customers and make more income. 

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business by buying another motorcycle. His future hopes are to expand his transport business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts and service his motorcycle so he can serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to produce more litres of milk to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 31 years old and is blessed with four children, aged 13, 11, 9 and 4 years. He has been a motorcycle transporter for the last 4 years and earns a monthly income of about KES 8,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable him to supply milk to his clients.

His plans to use the generated profits to educate his children and open a motorcycle spare parts shop.
 
His hopes are that he will be financially stable and realize his dreams.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable buy him to supply milk to his clients.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en: Franciscah is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children between the ages of 19 and 7 years. She is a farmer, and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 11,000.  Franciscah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to allow her meet customer demand for milk. She will use the profits she expects to earn to educate her children and expand her farming business. Her goal is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to meet customer demand for milk.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, desde pequeño les ayudo a sus padres en la agricultura y la ganadería, está casado y todos sus hijos ya tienen sus propios hogares, su esposa le ayuda con las actividades diarias.

José, junto a su esposa trabajan en la agricultura desde hace varios años en sus parcelas y en la tarde ordeña las vacas y cuida sus animales, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a vender leche en los alrededores de su vivienda.

José, solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca, que le ayudará en un futuro a incrementar la producción de leche para la venta.

José, sueña con comprar más vacas y llegar a tener una ganadería grande.
texts.en:
José is 65 years old and studied through the ninth grade. At a young age, he helped his parents with farming and ranching. José is married and all of his children have their own households. His wife helps with the daily activities.

José and his wife have worked in agriculture for many years. They have parcels of land and he spends his afternoons milking the cows and caring for their animals. Meanwhile, his wife takes care of the household duties and sells milk in the neighborhoods around their home.

José is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow, which will help to increase the production of milk that he can sell in the future. His dream is to buy more cows so that he can have a large dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is a proud owner of an in-house store, where she trades in special paints for automobiles. She lives with her husband and 19-year-old son, who help her run the retail business. 

For about 10 years, Melanya has been involved in this business. She believes that without hard and tireless work, no successful business can exist. 

She has applied for this loan to purchase a new stock of auto paints for selling in the store.

Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of auto paints for selling in the store.

loans.name: Nelson Isaias

texts.es:
Nelson, de 31 años de edad, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron la agricultura y la ganadería, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en las tareas agrícolas y tienen 1 hijo. 

Nelson,  trabaja en las parcelas que alquila durante la mañana y en la tarde trabaja en otras parcelas agrícolas. 

Nelson, necesita el crédito para comprar una yunta de bueyes para arar sus parcelas y transportar su cosecha en la temporada, además de arar otras parcelas y obtener un ingreso adicional.

Nelson, sueña con comprar un vehículo, para iniciar una nueva actividad productiva, la cual es realizar viajes para obtener un ingreso extra para cubrir los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Nelson, 31, grew up with his parents, who taught him about farming and livestock. He finished high school, and he is married. His partner helps him with the agricultural tasks, and they have one son. 

Nelson works on his plots of land (which he rents) in the mornings, and in the afternoons he works on other plots of land. He needs the loan in order to buy a team of ox to plough his plot, and to transport his crops at harvest time. He also needs the ox to plough other plots of land, so that he can earn extra income. 

Nelson dreams of buying a vehicle, so that he can undertake another productive activity (providing transport) and earn more money to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a team of ox to plough his plot of land, and to transport his crops at harvest time.

loans.name: Norma Evelin

texts.es:
Norma, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo el menor está estudiando, los otros 2 le ayudan a trabajar con las vacas y su pareja también se dedica a la agricultura.

Norma, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería en pequeño desde que tenia 17 años, empezó con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo y actualmente sigue trabajando junto a su compañero de vida; actualmente, siembran maíz y también tienen vacas, sus hijos y su pareja le ayudan a trabajar en los cultivos.- Norma, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a hacer el desayuno para salir a trabajar y cuidar las vacas hasta las  4:00 de la tardes que termina el trabajo con las vacas. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 2 terneros para repasto. 

El sueño de Norma, es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, para que puedan graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She and her husband are farmers and ranchers, and while their youngest child is still in school, the two older children help her manage the family's herd of cows. 

Norma has an eighth-grade education and also learned how to do farming and ranching work from her parents when she was growing up. She has been earning a living from agriculture since she was 17, and today she and her husband grow corn and manage their herd. Norma wakes up at 5:00 each morning to prepare the family's breakfast, then goes to care for the cows until 4:00 p.m. 

She will use the funds from this loan to purchase two calves for grazing. She hopes that her children will continue to study and become university graduates.

loans.use: para comprar 2 terneros para repasto.

loans.name: Felesia's Group

texts.en:
Felesia is 40 years old and is the proud mother of eight children. She is often described as a very experienced farmer and is a group leader, representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Felesia has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Felesia described her harvest as excellent last year, but she believes that she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize seeds, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Felesia’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Josephat's Group

texts.en:
Josephat is a 52-year-old proud father of 8 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 7 farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Josephat has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Josephat described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school. With this loan, Josephat’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Japhes's Group

texts.en:
Japhes is a 52-year-old proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 5 farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Japhes has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Japhes described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Japhes’s Group will be able to plant a total of 2.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 44-year-old married woman. She runs a small successful general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their four children. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea, to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea, to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha num Colégio como motorista a mais de 9 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende adquirir uma viatura para sua família. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um negócio de criação de frangos, coelhos, suínos e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior, contrair matrimónio.
texts.en: Nelson was born in Massinga Province in Inhambane.  He is 33 years old.  He lives with his common law wife and 2 minor children, both of whom attend school.  He does not support anyone else.  He has worked for a college for more than 9 years as a driver, where he earns money for household expenses.  With the loan he is requesting he plans to purchase a car for his family.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to start a business raising chickens, rabbits, and pigs, pay for his children to attend school through high school, and formalize his marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, gravel, sand, zinc, and beams in order to build a room.

loans.name: Denirida

texts.pt:
A Sra Dinérida tem 30 anos de idade, mae de um filho, frenquenta o ensino primário de 1º grau (3ª classe). Ela é solteira e vive na casa da sua mae que é enfermeira num hospital rural e, nao sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o presente financiamento pretende reforçar o seu negócio comprando  refrescos, cerveja, agua mineral e outros produtos para revender e, sonha em concluir os seus estudos e fazer crescer o seu negocio.
O seu principal desafio é de manter-se firme no seu negócio e dar continuidade com a sua obra, para melhor confortar a sua familia.
texts.en: Dinérida is 30 years old, and mother of one son who attends primary school (3rd grade). She is single and lives with her mother who is a nurse in a rural hospital.  She does not support anyone else.  With this loan she plans to restock her business buying soft drinks, beer, mineral water, and other products for resale.  She dreams of completing her education and growing her business.  Her main challenge is to stand firm with her business and complete her construction project, to provide better comfort to her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, mineral water and other products for resale.

loans.name: Elmurot

texts.en: Elmurot is 40 years old and married He has two children and lives in a small village. Elmurot has always worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and he has also worked as a day laborer for hire Thirteen years ago he decided to have his own plant farm, as well as to continue growing corn and beans. He sells this harvest in the zone where he lives, and that is how he makes an income to provide for the family. He is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 TJS to buy fertilizers, compost, and leaf fertilizer to maintain the plants plantation and the crops of basic grains, in order to achieve better harvests. His plan is to continue increasing the production to generate more household income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and leaf fertilizer

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 35 years old and married. He has three children and also supports four people in his family.

He sells vegetables and fruit, a business he has been doing for the past six years, and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is taking his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to expand his business by buying more stock of vegetables and fruits for resale, in order to increase his income. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and expand his business .

His future hopes are to expand his business, earn more income and be able to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 52 years old, married to Lucy, and together they are blessed with 5 children aged between 24 and 16 years old. Samwel is a farmer, a business he has done for the last 13 years. He earns KES 13,000 per month. 

Samwel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet his customers' demand for milk. He plans to use the anticipated profits to start a retail shop and to educate his children.

He hopes to buy a shamba and have a large retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to enable him to meet his customers' demand for milk.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, los cuales estudian nivel básico y bachillerato, se responsabiliza de los gastos familiares, su negocio es cultivar maicillo, maíz, pipían entre otros cultivos, además práctica la crianza de ganado, actividad que aprendió con la ayuda de sus padres, cuando formo su hogar decidió trabajar por su cuenta, ya tiene 23 años de tener su negocio.
Comprará insumos agrícolas, otras cosechas de maíz a los agricultores vecinos y pagara mozos para agilizar los trabajos, fortalecerá su negocio para obtener nuevos ingresos, venderá el producto adquirido a mejor precio y podrá preparar el terreno para la nueva siembra. Espera administrar muy bien el crédito y cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
Sus proyecciones son agregar nuevos cultivos, comprar otras propiedades para ir teniendo un patrimonio que le asegure un futuro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his wife and their three children, who study at primary and secondary school. He is responsible for paying the family expenses, and he makes a living cultivating sorghum, maize and pipían (a type of squash), among other crops. He also raises livestock, an activity that he learned with the help of his parents. When he first made his home, he decided that he would pay his way. Now he has 23 years experience running his business. 

The loan will allow him to buy agricultural supplies, other maize harvests from neighbouring farms, and pay for labourers in order to speed up the work. In this way he will strengthen his business and create new sources of income. He will sell his products, getting the best price for them, and he will be able to prepare the fields for new crops.

He hopes that he will use the loan well and make the repayments punctually. His plans for the future are to cultivate new types of crops and buy other properties in order to have assets that will ensure a future for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, other maize harvests from neighbouring farms, and to pay labourers to speed up the work.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married mother of two school-going children. The family lives in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mwanaisha sells khangas (women's clothing wraps) from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
Aquilino, de 68 años de edad, creció junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron la agricultura y la ganadería, estudio hasta tercer grado, desde entonces se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y a la ganadería, estas actividades las ha desarrollado durante varios años junto a su familia. 

Aquilino,  trabaja en sus parcelas junto a sus hijos, que le apoyan durante la mañana y en la tarde trabaja cuidando animales y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Aquilino, con el préstamo podrá comprar una vaca, porque se la venden en buen precio y le ayudará a incrementar su producir de leche, para que su esposa lo ocupe para elaborar queso, requesón y cuajada para el consumo familiar.

Aquilino, sueña con comprar más vacas y llegar a tener una gran ganadería.
texts.en:
Aquilino is 68 years old. He was brought up by his parents, who taught him about agriculture and livestock. He studied until the third grade, and since then he has made a living producing basic grains and raising livestock. He has worked at these activities for a number of years, together with his family. 

Aquilino works on his plots of land together with his children, who help him during the day. In the afternoon, he looks after animals, and his wife tends to the housework. 

With the loan, Aquilino will be able to buy a cow, which is being sold at a good price, and which will help him to increase his milk production. His wife will be able to make cheese, cottage cheese and cuajada cheese for the family to eat. 

Aquilino dreams of buying more cows and having a large quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 33-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Nasreen makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Nasreen wishes to use part of her revenue to provide a good quality of life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market at lower rates to make stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Kalsom

texts.en:
Kalsom is 47 years old, and she is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mursidi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of the Ruma agents, Mursidi. He lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, around 2 hours by plane from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Mursidi is happily married. Together with his wife, they have a very cute 17-month-old son. 

Mursidi owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew about Ruma from their sales executive who came to his stall. 

He decided to join Ruma because he is interested in Ruma’s system. The sales executive will be coming to his stall to collect the money. Mursidi's community sees him as a cheerful and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Mursidi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for his communities, so they can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. 

Now that lenders know about the importance, their loans will be very useful to help Mursidi improve his business, and as a result help his community which needs access to such services. 

Mursidi’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his customers. As seen in the photo, Mursidi is sitting and smiling in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Senhora Felismina é solteira, mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 estudam frequentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é negociante, vive em casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o montante financiado vai comprar açúcar, arroz, feijão, amendoim para revender na sua mercearia, pois o stock está fraco porque andou doente no ano passado.
Vive basicamente de comércio, no futuro espera ampliar o seu negócio e terminar a construção da sua casa, visto que vive numa casa ainda em construção.
O seu maior desafio é liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos para a realização dos seus projectos.
texts.en: Felismina is single.  She is the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are in primary and secondary school.  She is a merchant.  She lives in a home she owns and does not support anyone else.  With the loan she is requesting she will purchase sugar, rice, beans, and peanuts to sell in her shop.  Her stock is low because she was sick last year.  She lives basically from her business.  In the future she hopes to expand it and to complete construction on her home, as it is currently under construction.  Her biggest challenge is to pay of the loan on time so that she has access to future loans to complete her projects.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, and peanuts to resale in her shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Senhora Ana tem 48 anos de idade, e casada, e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 1 filha estuda frequentando ensino secundário, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de mariscos, para revender e rações, pintos, para a criação de frangos para a venda.
No futuro pretende ampliar os aviários para criar em frangos em grandes quantidades de modo a aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros empréstimos, e consequentemente acelerar a realização dos seus projectos.
texts.en: Ana is 48 years old.  She is married and mother of 4 children.  One daughter attends secondary school.  Ana is a merchant and lives in her own home with her family.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase seafood for resale, as well as chicks and feed in order to raise chickens for sale. In the future she plans to enlarge her chicken coops to raise chickens in greater quantities so she can increase the family income.  Her biggest challenge is to pay of the loan on time so that she will have access to future loans that will accelerate the completion of her projects.

loans.use: to purchase seafood for resale, and chicks and feed to raise chickens for sale.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is single. He has no children and he lives at his parents' house. Omar is a driver and he is a member of the union. He has his own minibus. Omar needs a loan to buy an engine. He is a hardworking person. He hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy an engine.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.en: Zenon is single and he lives with his parents. He has a workshop and he makes doors for houses and garages, but he makes the doors using metal. Zenon needs a loan to buy iron plates to make doors. He is a good locksmith and he learned how to make doors when he was a teenager. He hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy iron plates.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is single and she doesn't have children.  She lives in El Alto with her cousin.  Julia is a seamstress and she needs a loan to buy fabrics.  She is still the only one in her house that makes money, so she needs your help to prosper.  Julia would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine which will help her to improve the quality of the clothes and  speed up the delivery of orders.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old. He lives in El Alto and he also lives on Suriqui Island, where he works. Gregorio is a fisherman and he works as a carpenter. He goes to work at 3:00 am to catch fish.

Gregorio has two little sons that are going to school. He is married and his wife helps him sell fish. Gregorio needs a loan to buy fishing articles. He would like to make repairs to his house located on Suriqui Island in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing articles

loans.name: Karla Margarita

texts.es:
Karla, se dedica a  vender tortillas, vive con su esposo, por el momento no tienen hijos, inicio su negocio con poco capital que poseía, lo tiene desde hace 6 años, su horario de atención es de ocho de la mañana a dos de la tarde, no presenta problemas para desarrollar dicha actividad.
Invertirá en maíz y leña, tendrá a su disposición la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y aumentar su producción, espera que sus ventas mejoren y  que la cartera de clientes sea más grande.
Karla desea resarcir su deuda y tener un negocio más popular.
texts.en:
Karla makes a living selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband.  At the moment they don’t have children.  She started her own business with the little capital that she had and she has had it for 6 years.  Her opening hours are from 8:00 in the morning to 2:00 in the afternoon.  There are no problems involved in carrying out this activity.  

She will invest in corn and firewood to have at her disposal the raw materials to produce tortilla sales and increase her production.  She hopes that her sales improve and that her customer base is larger. 

Karla wants to repay her debt and have a more popular business.

loans.use: to invest in corn and firewood to have at her disposal the raw materials to produce tortilla sales and increase her production.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 45-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Kakamega North District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Mary has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Mary described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Mary’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Aracelis

texts.es:
Aracelis, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, sus padres le enseñaron las actividades de la ganadería y la agricultura, está casada y su esposo le ayuda en los trabajos de siembra y en el cuido de las vacas que tienen.

Aracelis, se dedica a trabajar 14,000 metros cuadrados de terreno junto a su esposo durante la mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para elaborar quesos que venden en los alrededores.

Aracelis, necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca y poder alquilar la tierra donde siembra y comprar insumos para cultivar.

Aracelis, sueña con incrementar su producción de lácteos, a través de la compra de más vacas.
texts.en:
Aracelis is 54 years old, and she studied until the ninth grade. Her parents taught her how to farm and raise livestock. She's married, and her husband helps to plant crops and look after the cows that they own. 

In the mornings, Aracelis works on the 14,000 square metres of land that she has, together with her husband. During the course of the afternoon she tends to the cows and makes cheese, which they then sell in the local area. 

Arecelis needs this loan to buy a cow and cultivation supplies, and pay the rent of the plot of land that she farms. She dreams of increasing her production of dairy products through the purchase of more cows.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cultivation supplies, and pay the rent of the plot of land that she farms.

loans.name: Jorge Alexander

texts.pt: Jorge es un joven muy tranquilo, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su madre y su hermano en una casita muy humilde, esta familia vive en el campo donde  se dedican al jornal, a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, Jorge necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar chanchos que los tiene en chancheras alado de su casa, la aspiración de Jorge es de seguir adelante en su negocio, comprar mas chanchos para mejorar su negocio y de este modo apoyarse en los gastos de su familia y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge is a very calm young man.  He is 19 years old.  He lives with his mother and brother in a very humble little house.  His family lives in the country where they do day labor, agriculture, and raising young animals.  Jorge needs money from this loan to purchase pigs.  He has pig pens next to his house.  Jorge's goal is to make progress with his business and purchase more pigs in order to improve his business.  In this way he will support his family's expenses and improve his qualify of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Senhora Florinda tem 60 anos de idade, e casada, e tem 4 filhos maiores que não estão na sua responsabilidade, sustenta 5 netos órfãos, frequentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, vive de negócio e da pensão do esposo e na casa própria.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de arroz, açúcar, óleo, amendoim, feijão, leite, sabão, para a revenda na sua mercearia.
No futuro pretende iniciar a criação de frangos e ampliar o seu negocio como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio é de garantir o sustento escolar dos netos, para que tenham o futuro melhor, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora para garantir futuros empréstimos
texts.en: Florinda is 60 years old.  She is married and has 4 adult children whom she no longer supports.  She supports 5 orphaned grandchildren who attend primary and secondary school.  She lives off her business and her husband's pension in a home that they own. With the loan she is requesting she will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, beans, milk, and soap to sell in her shop. In the future she plans to start raising chickens to expand her business and increase her family's income.  Her biggest challenge is paying for her grandchildren's education so that they will have a better future, and paying off the loan on time so that she can have access to future loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts, beans, milk, and soap for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha na Sede de um Partido politico mais de 11 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões e pedrinhas. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende abrir uma ferragem de venda de todo material. O seu maior desafio é dar continuidade com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en: Joaquim was born in Massinga province in Inhambane.  He is 36 years old.  He lives with his common law wife and 3 minor children, all of whom attend school.  He also supports his niece who lives with him. He has worked at the headquarters of a political party for more than 11 years, where he earns money that he applies to household expenses.  With the money he is requesting he will continue construction on his home by purchasing construction materials such as sand, cement, metal bars, and stones.  This is his 6th loan with Hluvuku.  In the future he plans to open a hardware shop selling all types of materials.  His greatest challenge is to complete his education through college.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, metal bars and stones).

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Elisa is 61 years of age and a resident of Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. They have a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged.

Elisa and her husband work hard in selling their catch at the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fish floaters and nets for fishing. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Elisa smiles at the thought of seeing their grandchildren get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy fish floaters and nets

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is one of the members of the Fuente Para el Desarrollo (Font for Development) 3. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisan crafts, etc. They are in the city of Samana, a tourist town in development. Their town is still rural but is a great natural escape and these borrowers use this to sell their products to people visiting their town.

Juana has a child and lives with her long-term partner in her simple and rural home. Juana is very excited to be receiving her 9th loan from Esperanza International. She has successfully paid off her previous loans and taken steps to grow her business. She started her business almost five years ago. She will invest her new loan in purchasing beauty and hair products for her beauty salon. She will also invest in some equipment like hair dryers, hair irons, and others. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves to have a successful and sustainable business. Juana thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products and some equipment

loans.name: Justino

texts.en: Justino is 50 years old.  He is married and has a son.  Justino is the owner of his own house.  He makes cheese and sells milk.  He collaborates with his wife.  Justino needs a loan to buy a milk cow. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Tujyinama Group

texts.en: Epiphanie is the group leader, aged 35. She is married with two children between 1 and 3 years old. The group is called Tujyinama, which means “lets share ideas” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change to a better future. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell. With the profits from the business she wishes to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Jajorie Pearl

texts.en: Jajorie Pearl busies herself with selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. At a young age, she is able to help her parents with their daily needs and support her own education. Jajorie Pearl wants to expand her business by purchasing more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. She reached out to Paglaum MPC and applied for a loan of PHP 4,000. She hopes to open a store outlet in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, utilizo el préstamo anterior para fortalecer la porqueriza, con los nuevos ingresos ha  logrado dar mejor desarrollo a sus cultivos por lo que sus cosechas son más abundantes. Las condiciones familiares son más confortables.
Está solicitando más capital para cancelar el alquiler del terreno en el que lleva acabo sus cultivos, además invertirá en insumos agrícolas para continuar progresando y teniendo alimento para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis used the previous loan to improve his pig farm. With the new income, he has managed to improve the development of his crops and so achieve better harvests. His family's living conditions are more comfortable now.

He is asking for more capital to pay the rent on the land where he plants his crops, and also to buy agricultural supplies so that he can continue making progress and provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he plants his crops, and also to buy agricultural supplies so that he can continue making progress and provide for his family.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that, she is doing her hobby and she earns an income as well. At the age of 52 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family.

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital for supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

In the future, Corazon wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Yulita is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days.

She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 55-year-old who is very hardworking and responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children.

She and her husband are both farmers who plant rice, corn, beans, vegetables and root crops. This is how they earn a living. Lorna wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Arminda

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo y tres hijos en edades de 17, 16 y 15 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares desde hace cinco años se dedica a vender tortillas y hot dogs, tiene una empleada que le ayuda a realizar dichas actividades, atiende su negocio en un horario de seis de la mañana  una de la tarde. Su mayor ventaja es que en la zona no tiene competencia.
Invertirá en maíz, leña y un coche para elaborar específicamente la venta de hot dogs, así mejorara su negocio y tendrá el equipo necesario para abrir otro punto de ventas, espera que el crédito le ayude a continuar trabajando y generando ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones. El único problema es la delincuencia que se observa en el lugar.
Su visión es apoyar a sus hijos para que continúen superándose académicamente, disminuir las necesidades familiares y tener estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
María lives with her family which is made up of her husband and three children aged 17,16 and 15. Five years ago she started selling tortillas and hot dogs to help her husband with the household expenses. 

She has an employee who helps her with all the said tasks. She works from 6AM to 1PM. Her main advantage is that there is no competition in her area.
 
She will invest in corn, firewood and a food truck to sell hot dogs. 

She plans to improve her business this way and she will have the necessary equipment to open another store. She hopes the loan will help her to keep working and generating income to fulfill her obligations. 

The only issue is the crime in the area. 

Her dream is to support her children so they continue studying, reduce household costs and have economic stability.

loans.use: to invest in corn, firewood and a food truck to sell hot dogs. She plans to improve her business this way and she will have the necessary equipment to open another store.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.en:
Jacobo is an artisan from Nicaragua who specializes in ceramic vases. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

Jacobo has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I believe my inspiration comes mainly from God who gave me a mind, eyes and hands. He let me be born and live in this beautiful town in Nicaragua. I was 13 years old when my father passed away and one of my brothers had lost his eyesight to a medical condition. Alone, my mother had to meet household expenses and pay for schooling for her five children, so my two older brothers and I helped with her ceramic work to earn together enough for our family's needs. I began working in other people's workshops and sold my ceramics very cheaply so I could buy the tools and materials I needed. I didn't have much experience, so my friends or uncles would give me a hand with designs. One day, I decided to take up my original challenge and create my own style with some clay pots my mother had given me. This has led me to where I am today. I'm grateful to my mother because, as an artisan, she gave me the art that flows through my veins.

I'd like to thank my dear friends around the world who support me through this microcredit. The funds are so very useful to me, as I can invest in the raw materials I need to keep crafting new pieces. Hugs from Nicaragua!"

Use the link below to view Jacobo's ceramic vases on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/9121

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro (pictured second from right), who works alongside his family, is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in jade and sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including fine silver, jade, chains, files and polishing powder.

Pedro has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

After working for silversmiths for six years, the Guatemalan family decided to open their own workshop. They are all involved in their family business. "We've developed a good working relationship. Everyone specializes in a different aspect and we complement each others' work."

"We are very thankful because these loans have been helping us a great deal. The funds allow us to purchase in bulk at a much better price. Many thanks to everyone who plays a part in making this microcredit possible!"

Use the link below to view Pedro's hand-crafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7566

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including fine silver, jade, chains, files and polishing powder.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita, who works alongside her mother, Martha, is an artisan from Peru who specializes in handcrafted ornaments. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including gourds, ribbon and paperboard.

Margarita has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is her story:

Since 2002, Peru's Margarita and her mother Martha have been crafting holiday ornaments. The creative pair uses traditional materials in innovative ways, combining ribbons and fabrics with miniature people, beads and tiny straw baskets. "We wanted to make something pretty, and I wanted to be able to stay at home with my baby, Lorenzo," says Margarita.

"I'd like to thank everyone for their support with this microcredit, as it will really help us move our business forward."

Use the link below to view Margarita's handcrafted ornaments on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/4053

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including gourds, ribbon and paperboard

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
An $ 800 loan is offered to Balbina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as capsicum, onion and soy. She has been involved in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Balbina independent. She can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy  capsicum, onion and soy

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 23 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $100.  She earns a good income from her business.

Candida will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as sugar, salt, oils, water, cigarettes, coffee and biscuits. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past four years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, oils, water, cigarettes, coffee and biscuits

loans.name: Navniyol

texts.ru: Навниёлу 32 года. Она из района Вахш. Она с мужем воспитывает троих детей. Навниёл замужем за преподавателя. Она добрая, ответственная и честная девушка. Навниёл возле дома имеет не большой магазин продуктов, где сама занимается продажей. Навнихол также дома имеет одного крупнорогатого скота. Также она с мужем еще занимается садоводством. На их саду 30 плодородных деревьев. Причина обращения Навнихол за кредитом является приобретения продуктов питания для продажи в магазине. Ее полки опустели, и сократилось количество ее клиентов. Навнихолу не хватает достаточных средств, чтобы купить и привести новый товар, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Navniyol is 32 and lives in the Vakhsh district. She and her husband are raising three children. Navniyol is married to a teacher. She is a kind, responsible, honest woman. Navniyol has a small grocery store near her home where she sells things herself. She also has cattle at home and she and her husband grow fruit. They have 30 trees in their orchard. The reason Navniyol applied for a loan is to obtain food products to sell at her store. Her shelves are empty and she is losing customers. Navniyol doesn’t have the resources to buy more products, so she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her store

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 45 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 21, 15, 4 y 3 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es buen padre, independiente, emprendedor, constante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Kuwiri’ cercano al lago Titicaca, a una altura promedio de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie terrestre, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados.
German es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos; los mayores trabajan los menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la pesca y las variedades comunes son; pejerrey, trucha, Karachi, mauri, ispi, y otros. Su trabajo comienza en la noche cuando acomoda las redes de pesca para recogerlas muy temprano por la madrugada, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana a la misma hora. “las variedades de especies que pescamos son muy requeridas porque en los mercados cocinan diferentes comidas y llevan estas especies como platillo principal…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo y cemento, el dese realizar la compra de redes de pescar para continuar con su trabajo y alimentar a su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Graman solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar para continuar con su trabajo y alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
German, 45, lives with his partner. He has 4 children aged 21, 15, 4 and 3 and he works as a fisherman. 

He is a good father, independent, enterprising, stable, responsible and hard working. He works in the community of  "Kuwiri" which is close to Lake Titicaca at about 4,000m above sea level. Here the sun rays hit the Earth hard and the climate is cold and dry with an average temperature between 1-12C (30-50F). 

German has a dark complexion, black short hair, brown eyes, he is short and has a medium build. His mother tongue is Aymará which he speaks with his family. He speaks Spanish due to general culture as well as for business. 

He shares his life with his wife who works as a farmer with the children. The eldest children work and the youngest ones are still not old enough for school. 

They live in their own house made of adobe with a tin roof. They have well water and electricity. He supports himself with fishing. The different varieties of fish are mackerel, trout, karachi, mauri, ispi, etc. 

He starts working at night when he lays out the fishing nets and collects them very early at dawn. He works every day at the same time. He explains that "The variety of fish that we fish is very sought after because in the markets they cook different dishes and they have these fish as the main course". 

His dream is to build a house of brick and cement. He wants to buy fishing rods in order to keep working and feeding his family. This is the first cycle of loans with the institution in the 20 years that he has worked independently. 

German is requesting a loan to buy fishing rods so he can keep working and feeding his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing rods so he can keep working and feeding his children.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and lives in Dao, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She was proud and happy doing her farming activity with her husband. She has had this business for 10 years.

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for healthier growing and more produce. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Rosita wants to provide for their needs and also their wants.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to add more income in order to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chemicals to use on his farm.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and residing in Tudela, Mis. Occ. She is married and blessed only with 3 beautiful children.

She joined PMPC in July of 2013 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessed her 3rd loan in the amount of 14,900 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities like fruits and vegetables to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities like fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Katherine Margoth

texts.es:
Higuerón es un lugar muy cercano a la ciudad de Portoviejo rodeado de mucha vegetación en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales  con la cual pueden sacar adelante a sus familias, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo De Crédito San Antonio De Higuerón.
En este lugar vive la señora Katherine, tiene 22 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 7 años la cual estudia en escuela. Ella estudia Optometría en la universidad de la ciudad, ella y su hija viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Katherine es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para sus gastos de estudios y los de su hija se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la universidad en la cual estudia ya que sus compañeras son sus mejores clientes,  deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante pensando en forjarse un mejor futuro para ella y su pequeña.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hija y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Higuerón is very near to the city of Portoviejo and is surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  The majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising animals, activities with which they can get their families ahead.  The members of the communal bank San Antonio De Higuerón meet here every 2 weeks. 

Katherine lives here.  She is 22 years old, is separated and from this relationship she has a 7-year-old daughter who attends school.  She is studying optometry at the university in the city.  She and her daughter live in her parents’ house. 

Katherine is a stay-at-home mom who, in order to obtain her own resources for her educational expenses and her daughter's expenses, makes a living selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  Her method of sales is door to door and she also sells at the university that she attends as her classmates are her best customers.  She leaves the product on credit and collects payments every week or every two weeks.  She has been engaged in this activity for more than 5 years, which allows her to get ahead and think about carving out a better future for herself and her little one.
