This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business.  Her dreams are to give her daughter the best and to be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs for her general store.

Rosemarie earns additional income from farming rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Veronica works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising pigs. Veronica is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Veronica has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalie is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Merlie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Merlie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 35-year-old married woman who has been running a school for three years. Shabana's commitment to her school is clear as parents, teachers and students are happy with her leadership and guidance. She has worked hard to bring her school to where it is today. There are close to 100 students in the school, and almost half are girls.

Shabana wants to advance the cause of education in general, but especially for the girls in her community, so that they can have a bright future. She requires a loan of PKR 75,000 to buy chairs for her students and to repair the school building to provide the children with a good learning environment.

loans.use: to buy chairs for her students and to repair the school building to provide the children with a good learning environment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in Sukabumi, a suburb located in West Java, around 3 hours  drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Ahmad lives there with his wife and his son.

Ahmad owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago. He knew about Ruma from a Ruma sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business through technology.

As the business grows, Ahmad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits for his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Knowing about the importance of this, your loan will be very useful to help Ahmad improve his business and, accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

Ahmad’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to service an e-commerce business for his customers. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting and smiling in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with their loved ones

loans.name: Darwing

texts.en:
Darwing is an artisan from Nicaragua who specializes in ceramic vases. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including the paints and oxides used for decorating his creations.

Darwing has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I come from a humble Nicaraguan family and my childhood home was built of plastic. Like other artisans in my town, I learned to work in ceramics from my family. You might say I have ceramics in my blood, and I love this art. Sometimes our work fetches a good price and others, not so good. I'm proud I've been able to get ahead in life and change my family's living conditions. We've exchanged poverty for a more dignified way of life. Now I'm also contributing to preserving the precious arts of San Juan de Oriente by teaching future ceramists. I've always considered myself to be a traditional artisan. My designs actually come from the generations before me. I do feel as though I create pre-Hispanic and geometric art while preserving its roots. My wife helps me in my workshop, as do some other artisans. The sale of our ceramics benefits the entire community, because we're able to hire people in our workshop and to purchase our basic necessities in the local markets, which are run by people from the town."

"My friends, this microcredit serves as a great example of how there are so many wonderful people in this work who still support one another. The funds will permit me to purchase essential materials and continue crafting pieces and supporting my business and my community through my art."

Use the link below to view Darwing's ceramic vases on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/9124

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including the paints and oxides used for decorating his creations

loans.name: Eveli

texts.en:
Eveli is a designer and artist who specializes in silver and gemstone jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Eveli has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I create accessories that allow for harmonization, and consequently bodily health. Precious stones, in their colors, forms, sizes, and compositions, are chosen and combined in accordance with the points on the body of he or she who will wear it; aimed at facilitating the harmonious distribution of energy in our body and mind. The quality of the wire, be it silver or copper, is chosen according to the same criteria."

"Wishing peace and good vibes to those who contribute to making the world a better and more just place by supporting those who work with dedication and love."

Use the link below to view Eveli's silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/2419

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Elzebeth

texts.en:
Elzebeth has successfully built her animal sales business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
She is a married woman and retired. She lives with her husband, who is also retired. Their son and daughter provide financial support because they receive a little pension.

She started a year ago with visual weakness. She is currently unable to cook, which is an activity to relax.

She requires the surgical procedure to look after their grandchildren, who depend on her while their parents work.

loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Karla Sarai

texts.es:
Karla es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Arquitectura, vive en compañía de sus padres, su esposo y su hijo de 11 meses.

Obtuvó su título en bachiller técnico en computación con el apoyo económico de sus padres. Su enseñanza de vida la obtuvo al momento de convertirse en madre, ya que tuvo que dejar de estudiar por un tiempo y esto provocó que se atrasara en sus estudios, pero la iniciativa y las ganas de luchar la impulsaron; manifiesta que cuando nació su hijo allí mismo crecieron las ganas y deseos de superarse y perseverar hasta el final, ya que es una mujer de sueños y de retos.

Se considera una joven leal en ya sean laborales, amistosas y sobre todo familiares, es perseverante al momento de luchar por sus sueños y metas, su alegría la hace ser una chica simpática y con motivación propia para seguir día a día.

Motiva sus estudios el deseo de darle un mejor futuro a su hijo, su desarrollo profesional y la intención de colaborar con sus padres.  de igual forma a través de su educación, Karla desea brindar a su país mejores condiciones de infraestructura ya que su carrera está enfocada en este ámbito empresarial en el que desea desempeñarse en un futuro cercano.

Sus principales sueños y metas a futuro, son graduarse de la carrera de arquitectura, trabajar diseñando y enfocarse en el área de la construcción ya que desea obtener su propia empresa de capitalización de proyectos.
texts.en:
Karla, 25, is studying architecture. She lives with her parents, husband and her 11 month son. 

She received her technical high school diploma in computer science with the economic support of her parents. She learned her lesson in life the minute she became a mother. She had to stop studying for a while which caused a delay in her studies. 

However initiative and the desire to fight moved her forward. She explains that her desire to persevere and get ahead grew when her son was born. She is a woman of dreams and goals. 

She considers herself loyal when it comes to work, friends and above all family. She fights for her dreams and goals. She is a happy person who is motivated to keep going day by day. 

Her studies motivate her to give her son a better future, develop professionally and to work with her parents. 

Also with her education, Karla wants to give her country better infrastructure since her degree is is focused on this area.

Her biggest dreams for the future are to graduate with a degree in architecture, to work in the area of construction and have her own company.

loans.use: to finish her university studies in architecture.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman from Talibon Bohol. She is a 50 years old and has ten children. Six of her children are still attending school. She earns a living by providing tailoring services like dress making, dress adjustments and other sewing services to the locals in her place. Her husband earns a living as a tricycle driver.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted cloth and fertilizers. This will help Virginia to sew more dresses and be able to pay her obligations. She will improve the yield of her farm and augment her income. With these, she could now provide her family with healthy diets and better living conditions.

She is hoping that she will be able to manage her current source of income successfully in order to continue her children's schooling for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted cloth for her sewing business and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 30 years old and is married to Richard. They are blessed with three children, ages six, four and one year old. Teresa has been selling shoes for the past ten years and earns 4,800 KES per month.

Teresa has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, which will enable her meet her customers demand for milk. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to increase her stock of shoes for sale.

Her plan is to open more shoes stores for more income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and rice grains.  Edna is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizers and spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment for her rice farming business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 26 years old and married with two children.

Ailyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, sugar, soap and other items.

Ailyn has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ailyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, vende café, chocolate y pan, es divorciada, está al frente de su hogar y trabaja para sacar a delante a sus hijos de 10 y 18 años de edad, en la actualidad solo una persona es dependiente, desde hace 5 años inicio a vender café y chocolate caliente acompañado de pan, su jornada de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana a seis de la tarde, durante el día también se dedica labores domésticas en su hogar. Hasta la fecha no representa dificultades y cuenta con clientes establecidos.
Necesita comprar chocolate, café, azúcar, pan y dos termos, serán de utilidad para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tener equipo en óptimas condiciones, espera que sus ventas sean mayores para ir teniendo más ganancias y de esa manera respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Los sueños de Candelaria son cancelar por completo su vivienda y que su hijo se finalice una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Candelaria sells coffee, chocolate and bread. She is divorced. She is in front of her house and works to get her children, aged 10 and 18, ahead. 

Currently only one of her children is a dependent. She started selling coffee and hot chocolate with bread five years ago. Her work day is 5AM to 6PM. 

During the day she also does house chores. To date she has not had any difficulties and has an established clientele. 

She needs to buy chocolate, coffee, sugar, bread and two thermoses. This will help her give a better service to her clients and have equipment is in optimal condition. 

She hopes her sales will increase so she has more profits and in this way she can pay off her debt. 

Candelaria's dreams are to pay off her home and that her son graduates from college.

loans.use: to buy chocolate, coffee, sugar, bread and two thermoses. This will help her give a better service to her clients and have equipment is in optimal condition.

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es:
María, utilizo de buena manera el crédito anterior, pues su venta de pupusas y antojitos permanece funcionando, su familia tiene el mismo núcleo, cuenta con nuevos clientes debido a que mejoro su servicio y se cambió a otro local que tiene una mejor ubicación. 
Solicita la ayuda de Padecomsm y de los inversionistas kiva con un nuevo financiamiento para tener recursos económicos con los que comprará una refrigeradora, harina, verduras, aceite, quesillo, y gas propano para seguir elaborando la venta de pupusas y antojitos.
texts.en:
María used her previous loan wisely, and so her business selling stuffed tortillas and other snacks remains up and running. Her immediate family is the same as before. She has nine customers due to the fact that she improved her service and moved her business to a better location. 

María is requesting help from Padecomsm and the Kiva investors in the form of new financing to obtain economic resources that she will use to buy a refrigerator, flour, vegetables, oil, soft cheese, and propane gas to continue making and selling stuffed tortillas and other snacks.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, flour, vegetables, oil, soft cheese, and propane gas to continue making and selling stuffed tortillas and other snacks.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn lives and works in Kapan town with his wife and two children. For the past two years, Vahagn has been involved in providing upholstery services. He rents a small room where he sews covers for car seats, steering wheels and furniture. 

To be able to boost the services he provides, Vahagn is asking for this loan. He needs to purchase a sewing machine, fabric and some tools for providing upholstery services.
 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, fabric and some tools for providing upholstery services.

loans.name: Thomas's Group

texts.en:
Thomas's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Thomas, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 27 years old, married and has three children. Thomas has been a farmer for ten years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Thomas isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2014, and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year, Thomas will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, will save more money.

Using this loan, Thomas's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming supplies received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Eligia

texts.en:
Eligia is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a mini-shop that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy such things as shirts, long pants, shorts, and long-sleeved and short-sleeved t-shirts. She opened her mini-shop a year ago with her own working capital of 400 USD.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants, shorts, and long-sleeved and short-sleeved t-shirts

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: A $1500.00 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00. She will use the loan to buy a coconut milling machine. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the business. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business, and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy a coconut milling machine

loans.name: Maydagul

texts.ru: Майдагул прекрасная, незамужняя девушка в возрасте 30 лет. Она очень вежливая, общительная  и доброжелательная. По профессии она швея и любит свою работу. У нее  много заказов на пошив. С этим доходом она заботиться о себе и обеспечивает своих родителей. Кроме это она занимается животноводством . Не давно она потеряла одну корову. Теперь она хочет купить вместо потерянной коровы другую, но к сожалению у нее сейчас недостаточно денежных средства. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой и заранее благодарит за понимание!!!
texts.en: Maydagul is a wonderful woman, aged 30. She is unmarried, polite, sociable and friendly. She is a seamstress by profession and loves her work. She has many sewing orders. She takes care of herself and provides for her parents with this income. In addition to sewing she also raises livestock. She recently lost a cow and now would like to buy another, but unfortunately she does not have the money. This is why she turned to Arvand for financial support and thanks them in advance for their understanding!

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Suliatik

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet a new Ruma agent, Suliatik. Suliatik lives in Magelang, Central Java, a city located about 1 hour and 30 minutes flight from Jakarta.

Suliatik owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks. Suliatik is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman, that’s why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. As a woman, she began to realize that she needs to help her husband to improve their life by increasing their income. Therefore, almost a year ago, she decided to join Ruma and provide the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits and pay the bills.

As the business grows, Suliatik is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Knowing the importance of this, your loan will be very useful to help Suliatik improve her business and her community, who needs access to such services.

In the photo, Suliatik is the one holding one of her daughters, in her own stall. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: improve her business selling mobile airtime credits and providing mobile payment services for her community.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
She is a married woman and works as a market trader. Over ten years, she began to notice a decrease in sight, and she did not visit the doctor because of fear.

After a complete analysis of the eye, she was diagnosed with proliferative retinopathy. If it is not treated immediately, it will cause complete and irreversible blindness. She needs the surgery because she is part of the support of her home and doesn’t want to leave her work.

loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Jaibalito 1 Group

texts.es:
Dina (es la segunda del lado izquierdo de blusa negra) es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad, tiene un linda familia de 3 hijos de las edades entre 2 y 4 años de edad, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Dina para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo al mantenimiento de su casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, pero ella también cuenta con la habilidad de la cocina es por eso que también trabaja como cocinera en un hotel de su comunidad, según dice Dina que esta segunda actividad le ayuda a mejorar sus ingreso y mantener a su familia, para ella mejorar su negocio de venta de ropa es muy importante es por eso que se ha propuesto a buscar más capital para lograr la meta ha organizado a un grupo de mujeres para solicitar un préstamo que lo utiliza para comprar más ropas típicas para luego venderlas a un buen precio.
El gran anhelo de dina y su grupo es conseguir el préstamo lo más pronto posible, para realizar la inversión para que puedan mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Dina (second from the left) is a 27 year old mother. She has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of 2 and 4. They live in Solola. Dina generates income and supports her husband with maintaining their house. She buys and sells traditional clothing. She also cooks and therefore she also works as a cook in a hotel in the community. According to Dina this second job helps her improve her income and support her family. It is important to her to improve her business selling clothing so she is seeking more capital in order to achieve the goal that her woman's group organized to seek a loan that will be used to buy traditional clothing and then sell them at a good price.

Dina's goal and her group is to acquire the loan as soon as possible in order to make the investment so that they can improve their income and build their own house.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
She is 27 years old and is a single mother. She has worked in commercial sales for two years. Her mother helps to look after her children because she needs to work to keep the children.

Her use of glasses is costly because it requires changing glasses every six months. She needs the surgery to not spend more on glasses and use that money for her children.

loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 dos hijos, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas en una escuela.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, constante, activa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ un área muy estratégica por el comercio; es un mostrador de la manufactura de la pequeña y mediana empresa, el lugar es una muestra del movimiento típico comercial e industrial de la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre  0-16 grados centígrados y se encuentra a una altitud de 4070 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Victoria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos,  estatura mediana, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en otra ciudad y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la escuela dónde trabaja, está construida de ladrillo y cemento y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y refrescos, como; galletas, papas fritas, dulce, chocolates, chicles, refrescos y jugos, en un puesto de venta en la calle, al aire libre durante las horas del día de lunes a sábado. Paralelamente a su negocio trabaja en la escuela donde vive como portera y se encarga de abrir y cerrar las puertas también de la limpieza. “mi esposo nos visita 2 veces al mes porque trabaja en otro lugar, nos deja dinero, y yo aporto con el cuidado de mis hijos y con el dinero que dejan los dulces y golosinas…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa para dejarles a sus hijos, ella desea realizar la compra de golosinas, dulces, galletas y otros, para surtir su negocio y generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 14 años que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de golosinas por mayor para surtir su negocio y alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 47 year old woman, married, and has two children. Her business is selling candy at a school.

She is independent, enterprising, reliable, active, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the “16 de Julio” zone, an area known for business. This area is known for small and medium size manufacturing businesses, and this place has typical businesses and industries found in cities. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-16 degrees centigrade and is located at an altitude of 4070 meters above the sea.
Victoria has a dark complexion, long dark hair, dark eyes, medium height, and dresses in traditional dress (hat, shawl, skirt). Her first language is Aymara which she speaks with her family and her second language is Spanish that she speaks in public and in business. She shares her life with her husband who works in another city, and with her children who study in school. They live in their a home owned by the school where she works. It is built of brick and cement and has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. Her business is selling snacks and beverages such as : cookies, French fries, candy, chocolates, gum, soda pop, juices, in an open-air stand on the street. She works Monday through Saturday. Along with the business, at the school where she lives she is in charge of opening and closing the doors as well as cleaning. “My husband visits us two times per month because he works in another place. He leaves us money, and I support him by caring for the children and with the money that the snacks and candy provide,” she states. Her dream is to build a house to leave to her children. She wishes to buy candy, snacks, cookies and other items in order to stock her store and generate more income for the well-being of her children. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in 14 years that she has been working independently.
For these reasons Victoria seeks a loan to buy snacks at wholesale in order to stock her business and feed her children.

loans.use: to buy snacks at wholesale in order to stock her business and feed her children.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre de 24 años de edad, casado, tiene 1 hijo varón de 5 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de muebles artesanales en totora.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, responsable, constante, paciente y trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad de ‘Chililaya Grande’ área cercana al lago sagrado Titicaca, donde los pobladores mayormente se dedican a la pesca, agricultura y artesanía, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Omar es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza junto a su esposa que se dedica al tejido y con su hijo que esta iniciando la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua de pozo y electricidad. Su negocio es la fabricación de muebles en totora; que es un material natural propia del lago y que se utiliza desde la época incaica, con este material fabricaban barcos, con los que surcaban las aguas del lago Titicaca. los muebles mas comunes son; sillones grandes, camas, amacas y otros. Estos conocimientos son herencia de su padre que es artesano, “realizo esta actividad desde muy pequeño, primero fue un juego, luego realizábamos muebles a pedido, hasta que me casé y me tuve que independizar…” comenta. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo y darle agua potable a su familia, él desea realizar la compra de totora por mayor para fabricar muebles y darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos dentro de la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Omar solicita un préstamo para la compra de totora para fabricar muebles artesanales y darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Omar is a 24-year-old married man who has a 5-year-old son.  His business is making handcrafted furniture out of large reeds.  He is independent, enterprising, responsible, persevering, patient and hard-working.  He carries out his business in the “Chililaya Grande” community, an area near the sacred Lake Titicaca, where the inhabitants largely make a living in fishing, agriculture and handicrafts.  It is a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius (approximately 32 and 54 degrees Fahrenheit). 

Omar is tan-complected with short black hair, dark eyes, short stature and a thin physique.  His native tongue is Aymara which is spoken here and he speaks Spanish for the general culture and for business that he does.  He lives with his wife who makes a living weaving and with his son who is starting school.  They live in their own house made of adobe that has well water and electricity.  

His business is making furniture from “totora” (large reeds), a natural material from the lake that has been used since the time of the Incas.  With this material they made boats with which they sliced through the waters of Lake Titicaca.  The most common types of furniture are: large chairs, beds, hammocks and more.  This knowledge is the legacy of his father who is a craftsman, “I have done this activity since I was very young.  At first it was a game, then we made furniture to order until I got married and had to become independent,” he says.  

His dreams are to build a brick house and give drinking water to his family.  He wants to carry out a wholesale purchase of reeds to make furniture and give a better future to his children.  This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the 4 years that he has been making a living in this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Omar is requesting a loan: for the purchase of reeds to make handcrafted furniture and give a better life to his children.

loans.use: to purchase large reeds to make handcrafted furniture and to give his children a better life.

loans.name: El Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL ALTIPLANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel ella es soltero y tiene 43 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telares,tejidos y chompas.

 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the communal bank “EL ALTIPLANO”. This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Maribel, who is single and 43 years old. She works in her handcraft business. She sells weavings, sweaters, blankets and fabrics . She sells various weavings. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m. She has already had this business for 8 years, and it is going very well. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, weavings and sweaters. The other members work in businesses of selling clothing, selling shoes, grocery store, and selling purses. Maribel is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, weavings and sweaters.

loans.name: Sheena Mae

texts.en:
Sheena Mae is 23 years old and single.

Sheena Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Sheena Mae has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from rice retail and raising pigs.

Sheena Mae aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman and rents a house that has no piped water, but does have electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Mejumaa has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are women and men. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase clothing material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, utilizó el crédito anterior para adquirir materiales que le han ayudado a seguir trabajando en la carpintería y a entregar a tiempo sus pedidos, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para subsistir junto a su familia.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el que comprara madera y junco para seguir teniendo materiales disponibles para mantener la carpintería con vida.
texts.en:
Manuel used the previous loan to aquire the materials that have helped him to continue working in carpentry and deliver his orders on time. In this way he has generated the income necessary to survive together with his family.

He is asking for a new loan, with which he will buy wood and cane, to continue having materials available to keep the carpentry business alive.

loans.use: to buy wood and cane, to continue having materials available to keep his carpentry business alive.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos con edades de 18, 16, 13 y 8 años de edad, en su familia es el único que trabaja para ir disminuyendo las necesidades básicas de su hogar, en su comunidad es reconocido por cultivar granos básicos y practicar la crianza de ganado, el negocio se lo heredaron sus padres, ya tiene más de 15 años de administrarlo, trabaja a tiempo completo y por su experiencia manifiesta que es un negocio que demanda dedicación para mantenerlo funcionando, su ventaja es que posee terrenos para desarrollar sus actividades.
Comprará una vaquilla, concentrado, afrecho y vitaminas para cuidar de su ganado, está ayuda le permitirá tener un negocio con mejor inventario, espera que sus clientes, ventas y ganancias aumenten para ir progresando, Los riesgos son las enfermedades que pueden afectar al ganado.
Las aspiraciones de son Santos son tener un negocio más rentable para cancelar sus deudas y dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his life partner and their four children aged 18,16,13 and 8. 

He is the only one that works in his family to pay for the basic needs of the home. In his community, he is known for growing basic grains as well as raising cattle. He inherited the business from his parents and has owned it for over 15 years. He works full time and through his experience he can attest that this is a business that demands dedication to maintain working. 

He has the advantage of owning land he works on. 

He will buy a heifer, concentrate, bran and vitamins to take care of his cattle. This help will allow him to have a business with better inventory. 

He hopes his clients, sales and profits increase so he can keep progressing. The risks are diseases that can affect the cattle. 

His dreams are to have a more prosperous business in order to pay off his debt and give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, concentrate, bran and vitamins to take care of his cattle. This help will allow him to have a business with better inventory.

loans.name: Despine

texts.en:
Despine is a 50-year-old married woman from the village of Shashiani. She lives with her husband, two sons and a mother-in-law, who gets pension from local government. Despine's husband works as a taxi driver and generates the main source of income for his family's welfare. However, this is hardly enough for a family of five to meet even basic needs and to cover daily expenses. 

Despine has her own small agricultural business, taking care of a vineyard and selling grapes seasonally. In order to increase her share of providing for the family's welfare, Despine wants to expand the agribusiness and set up a poultry farm. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have stable revenue and enough family income, until the Start Up program began. The program is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor people like Despine to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. With the loan, Despine will purchase chickens, raise them, and then sell them at a good price at the local market.

She  is very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children have a good education for progressing in life. This loan will be a great support for the family. Despine is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to set up a poultry farm and start selling chickens.

loans.name: Ishmael's Group

texts.en:
Ishmael is a 60-year-old proud father of 11 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Ishmael has noticed that he has learned a lot from farm training.

Ishmael described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Ishmael’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sriyono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Sriyono. Sriyono lives in Pekalongan, a city located in Central Java, around two hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia, by plane. Sriyono lives there with his wife and his only child. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. It has been almost a year since he joined Ruma and he learned of Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he was interested in expanding his business using technology. 

Sriyono has a strong will to learn more about how to expand his business. His curiosity for business knowledge leads him to have more customers. As the business grows, Sriyono is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to buy more mobile airtime credits to sell to his community members, so that they can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Sriyono improve his business and accordingly, his community, which needs access to such services. Sriyono’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his customers. As seen in the photo, Sriyono is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He will be very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase more prepaid airtime credits to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones in order to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
He is 27 years old, married, and works as administrative staff. He spends about ten hours daily in front of a PC. He presents myopia, astigmatism, and dry eye due to the computer use.

He spends 1,200 US dollars per year in treatments. For this reason, he requires the laser surgery to not depend on glasses and save money for the university.

loans.use: to have eye surgery.

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en:
Emily is a member of Alpha Group. She is a married mother with two school going children. Her husband is unemployed and she is the one who is responsible for paying school fees for her children. 

She is in a business of making ladies sandals, which she sells wholesale to local retailers. Emily is the first female this writer has ever seen who is in the sandal making business. She is very talented and she said she has a long term plan of opening a factory for making shoes. 

Emily and her other group members joined Thrive Microfinance in January of 2015, and they are very appreciative for the business advice they received from Thrive. Emily and her group members have applied for a combined loan of 1,400 USD and Emily wants to use her portion of the loan amount to buy material so that she can increase her production level as she is now facing an increase in demand for her sandals. 

Emily and other group members are very happy about Thrive and its partners and want to maintain a good relationship with them so that they continue to benefit.

loans.use: to buy materials for her sandal making business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat is a generous woman. She was born in 1967. She is living in remote district. She is married and has three children. She is planning to start her new business of keeping livestock. She is seeking financial support from KIVA's project to buy honored cattle and start her business. Saodat requested 7,500 TJS loan for buying livestock and opening a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and open a new business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ceviche,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de su negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ceviche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar limon,pescado y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maria Elena sells ceviche. She is a hardworking woman who, through her business, wants to help her family get ahead. Her dream is to increase the size of her ceviche business. She asks for a loan to buy lemon, fish and sweet potato. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy lemons, fish and sweet potato.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 34 years old, married and is blessed with two children who are eight and six years old. He also supports three other members of his family. 

He operates a cosmetics shop and also makes bricks to supply to construction sites. He has borrowed this loan to pay school fees for his two children who are in primary school. This is his seventh loan with Visionfund Kenya, and he has paid all his previous loans well.

He will use the anticipated profits from his business to repay the loan and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his two children in primary school and enable them to get a good education.

loans.name: Virgen Copacabana De Calca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE CALCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonia ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the group belong to the communal bank “VIRGEN COPACABANA DE CALCA”. This bank is situated in the Calca district, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One member is Antonia, she is single, is 64 years old and has two children. She works selling clothes, she sells trousers, blouses and polo shirts. She has been doing this work for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have a shop. She is asking for the loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses. 

The group member whose photo was added onto the group photo had her photo taken after the meeting because she asked permission for this because of work.

The other members work in the business of agriculture, selling clothes, grocery store business and food business.

Antonia thanks those who form part of this dream via this medium, and promises to make her repayments within the specified time period.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: 29 De Octubre  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la Sequita de la parroquia Crucita en Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo de Crédito  29 de Octubre, este es un grupo de 11 mujeres y 1 hombre que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, este lugar está a pocos minutos del balneario de Crucita lugar de hermosas playas con una gran variedad en su gastronomía y lugares turísticos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carmen, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Carmen junto a  su familia tienen una fábrica de chifles, ellos se dedican a preparar chifles ya sean de plátano o de maduro, son dos años que tienen este negocio tiempo en el cual han conseguido muchos clientes que le piden sus productos, ella vende en su casa por fundas o tachos, aunque sus mejores ventas son a domicilio ya que ella entrega en diferentes negocios como cevicherías o restaurantes en Crucita o en la localidad que saben de lo rico de sus productos. Trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00, de esta forma ellos logran salir adelante a base de trabajo honrado.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos, manteca, sal y fundas plásticas  para preparar los chifles. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más industrializado y salir adelante.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto.
texts.en:
In Sequita, in the parish of Crucita in Portoviejo, the members of Grupo de Crédito 29 de Octubre [October 29th Credit Group] get together every fifteen days. This is a group of 11 women and 1 man that make a living in a variety of occupations in order to improve their quality of life. This area is a few minutes away from the resort of Crucita, a place with beautiful beaches and a wide variety of cuisine and touristic spots.

One of the members of this group is Señora Carmen. She is 33 years old, and she is married with two children, ages 11 and 5. One child is in high school, and the other is in school. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

Doña Carmen, along with her family, has a factory that makes banana chips. They make a living preparing these chips that are made with either bananas or plantains. They have had this business for two years, and in this time they have acquired many repeat customers who ask for their products. Carmen sells from her house in either plastic bags or containers, although her best sales are those that she delivers to different businesses such as ceviche restaurants or other restaurants in Crucita or in other places where people know how delicious her products are. Doña Carmen and her family work everyday from 6:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. In this way, they manage to get ahead due to their honest work.

This new loan will be used to buy bananas, butter, salt, and plastic bags to prepare banana chips. Doña Carmen has been in Grupo De Crédito since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help she receives by way of loans. Her dreams are to have a more industrialized business and get further ahead.

The small photo is of a member that couldn't be present when the other photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy bananas, butter, salt, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a motorcycle spare parts business from home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. In addition, she also operates a crop farming business, which earns her another source of income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a single woman with two school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap clothing) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans for boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (women's wrap clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives with her husband and smallest son in Kapan city of the Syunik region. Her two elder sons are already married and they live with their families separately. Rita has vocational medical education in nursing. She never worked in her specialty and, for ten years, she has worked as a secretary at the Kapan State College. Rita’s son and husband work as drivers, but they both help Rita in her agricultural activities. On her plot of land, she built a small greenhouse where she cultivates greens. She also cultivates potatoes, beans and garlic. She also has small orchard where there are mainly apple trees. All her land’s goods she sells with the help of her husband at the city wholesale market. 
This loan of 500,000 Armenian drams Rita hopes to receive, as she wants to repair the fence of her vegetable and fruit garden, to change the water pipes, since they are already too old, and she will also buy potato seedlings and apple tree layers.

loans.use: to repair the fence of her vegetable and fruit garden, to change the water pipes which are too old and to also buy potato seedlings and apple tree layers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, and a table, stocking her inventory with ingredients in order to make the tortillas that she sells and she will equip her business.
